text:

The results are in: You deserve to treat yourself. 
Here at ELLE, we believe in tote bags‚Äîof any variety, really, but especially in designer tote bags. As modern-day working girlbosses women, we can only do it all and have it all if we quite literally ‚Äúhave it all‚Äù on hand. Any bag I purchase needs to serve as my work bag, gym, lunch, diaper, and shopping bag simultaneously. Translation: It has to have space. Totes are great for this, and to prove my point, I spoke with Blake Geffen, CEO and co-founder of Vivrelle, a designer bag rental service, to get a non-partisan take on which totes are really all that. 
An avid tote user herself (she‚Äôs a mother of three),  Geffen confirms that a designer tote is a great investment option for anyone looking to start‚Äîor expand‚Äîa high-end collection. As for what to look for in a tote, durability is definitely key. ‚ÄúBoth designer and non-designer bags should always be judged by the quality‚Äìfrom fabrics and construction to the stitching and zippers, buckles, etc.,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúOur tote bags are constantly in motion, so it‚Äôs important that the one you‚Äôre using can endure your day-to-day comings and goings.‚Äù 
You should also take lifestyle and occasion into consideration. Are you more into canvas totes or leather ones? ‚ÄúCompartments and zipper pockets are also qualities I‚Äôm always looking for, though may be less important to others. Depending on the setting, shoppers may also want to consider fabrics and strap styles...While the trend cycle shifts quickly, nothing is more fashionable than owning your own unique sense of style. So, choosing a handbag that‚Äôs true to you is by far the most important factor when looking for your next bag!‚Äù
I took Geffen‚Äôs expertise, fellow ELLE editor recommendations, size, style, and features into account to bring you a list of the 22 best designer tote bags to shop now.

Lust-worthy designs for any type of lifestyle.
Lingerie brands have come a long way since the days of ultra-push-up bras and bows on panties. Not to say those can‚Äôt be fun, but there‚Äôs so much more nuance to what can be sexy these days (and thank God‚Äîand Rihanna‚Äîfor that). From ultra-sexy to minimalistic to just pure fun, there‚Äôs a lingerie style out there for every woman, and for every version of you that you want to be. Some days you want to be bright and bold, and others, you‚Äôd rather throw on something sleek and classic. No one feels the same every day, and whether someone sees it or not, what you wear under your clothes should reflect how you feel.
Whether you‚Äôre wearing lingerie for yourself or as a special surprise, out on the town or lounging at home, you‚Äôll want to feel comfortable and confident. That‚Äôs where these brands come in. Not only will they make you feel great, but you‚Äôll look great too (priority #1 and priority #2). Underwear can be worn as outerwear now, too, so if you‚Äôre trying to get in on the sheer trend that we‚Äôve been seeing all over the runways, you‚Äôll want to check these out too. title: 15 Best Drugstore Retinol Products That Are Just as Effective as Expensive Ones
text:

Ask anyone you know: The best part about visiting your local drugstore is the versatility of snagging your everyday essentials, preventative medicine, and beauty staples in a swipe. Our introduction to beauty likely began in the sprawling aisles of our drugstores, from affordable cleansers and moisturizers to mascaras and eyeliners‚Äîif you need it, the drugstore likely has it. This also includes retinol‚Äîa topical ingredient used to increase skin rejuvenation and address texture, among other issues‚Äîthat was traditionally prescribed by dermatologists but is now offered over the counter at drugstores for a fraction of the price, in formulas that treat the body and skin. ‚ÄúRetinol is a vitamin A derivative that regulates skin cell turnover, helping to address skin tone and texture. It works to help unclog the pores, prevent breakouts, and improve the appearance of hyperpigmentation and discoloration while also helping to improve the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles,‚Äù says Dr. Marisa Garshick, board-certified dermatologist at MDCS Dermatology: Medical Dermatology & Cosmetic Surgery and assistant clinical professor of dermatology at Cornell New York Presbyterian Medical Center. 
Chances are you‚Äôve seen a few drugstore retinol products but had doubts about their effectiveness and cost. Allow these 15 best drugstore retinol products to change your mind. We polled several dermatologists and online customer feedback to find the best drugstore retinol formulas money can buy. Your skin (and wallet) will thank you. 
There‚Äôs no need to second guess if you're using too little or too much retinol each week. With RoC's retinol capsules, you‚Äôll give your skin the right amount every time. Each capsule has retinol and antioxidants to address fine lines and wrinkles.

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

Our expert says: ‚ÄúContaining adapalene, a prescription retinoid now available over-the-counter, this [gel] can be a great option for someone dealing with breakouts and blemishes.  By helping to regulate skin cell turnover, it helps to prevent clogged pores and is especially good for those with oily skin,‚Äù says Dr. Garshick. Fellow dermatologist Dr. Brendan Camp is also a fan of the over-the-counter gel. ‚ÄúThe active ingredient in Differin is adapalene, which is a retinoid. It used to be available only by prescription but is now available over the counter. Primarily marketed as an acne treatment, products with adapalene can address concerns like fine lines, wrinkles, and dark spots,‚Äù he says. 
Another RoC drugstore gem, this formula was designed to improve the lines and wrinkles that emerge under your eye, as well as dark circles that may form over time.

Our expert says: ‚ÄúThis retinol eye cream is gentle enough to use on the skin around the eyes and helps tackle concerns like crow‚Äôs feet, dark circles, and puffiness.‚Äù‚ÄîDr. Brendan Camp

I‚Äôm struggling with hormonal acne as I turn 30 and this stuff is the only thing that keeps it at bay. There is an instant improvement overnight, every single time. As with all retinols, this will cause some irritation when not introduced to your skin slowly. But it is completely worth it for the results you get.‚Äù
When using retinol, the key to protecting your skin is to sandwich it with a hydrating moisturizer as a protective barrier. Good thing Eucerin did the hard work for you. The anti-wrinkle cream gradually fades wrinkles with pro-retinol and nourishes the skin with vitamin E and macadamia nut oil. 
Key ingredients: Pro-retinol, vitamin E, macadamia nut oil
Size: 1.7 fl oz
Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve used this, along with other Eucerin skin products, for several years. You can‚Äôt talk about staple drugstore skin care without mentioning Olay. The Regenerist Retinol24 Night Moisturizer is the superhero your routine has been missing; its powers include brightening, lifting, and firming, in addition to wrinkle and pore reduction.

You can always count on E.L.F for your makeup needs, but the brand also has your skin care covered. Featuring a blend of retinol, antioxidants, and hyaluronic acid, this serum plumps and hydrates the skin while improving texture. 
Key ingredients: Retinol, hyaluronic acid 
Size: 2.15 fl oz 
Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars 
An Amazon reviewer said: ‚ÄúThe serum has a lightweight, non-greasy texture that glides smoothly onto the skin. I appreciate that it doesn‚Äôt leave a sticky residue or cause any discomfort upon application. It‚Äôs also fragrance-free, which is a plus for those with sensitive skin. I‚Äôve been using the e.l.f. SKIN Youth Boosting Advanced Night Retinoid Serum for about eight weeks now, and I‚Äôve noticed some positive changes in my skin. My complexion appears smoother, and fine lines around my eyes and mouth have become less noticeable. I did experience some mild peeling and sensitivity during the first two weeks, but it subsided as my skin adjusted to the retinoid.‚Äù
Wrinkles, scars, and crepey skin don‚Äôt only appear on the face‚Äîthe body gets its fair share, too. Thanks to this firming cream from Advanced Clinicals, your body can be as smooth and blemish-free as your face. 
Key ingredients: Retinol, ferulic acid, green tea, aloe vera 
Size: 16 fl oz 
Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars 
An Amazon reviewer said: ‚ÄúI was skeptical at first but after using this product I have to admit it works. I have extremely dry skin on my legs and after using the lotion for less than a week my skin looks so much better. You‚Äôd never know there was a problem. I definitely recommend it for others.‚Äù
While drugstore retinol products may have great benefits, Dr. Marisa Garshick says not all formulas are made equally. 
‚ÄúRetinol may exist in different concentrations, which may impact both efficacy and tolerability. However, some retinols may also be combined with other ingredients to help maximize benefits and enhance tolerability. Additionally, prescription retinoids tend to be more effective than over-the-counter retinols, but ultimately it comes down to tolerability,‚Äù she explains. If over-the-counter products aren‚Äôt yielding the results you desire, Dr. Garshick advises visiting a dermatologist for a more effective treatment plan. 
‚ÄúWhen considering a drugstore retinol, it is important to not only look for a brand and product that is backed by clinical studies, but also to consider the type of retinol, the concentration and any other ingredients in the formulation, such as ceramides, niacinamide, hyaluronic acid to help minimize irritation,‚Äù Dr. Garshick offers. 
Dr. Marisa Garshick is a board-certified dermatologist at MDCS Dermatology: Medical Dermatology & Cosmetic Surgery and assistant clinical professor of dermatology at Cornell New York Presbyterian Medical Center. 
Dr. Brendan Camp is a double board-certified dermatologist at MDCS Dermatology: Medical Dermatology & Cosmetic Surgery.
Dr. Lauren Penzi is a board-certified dermatologist at MDCS Dermatology: Medical Dermatology & Cosmetic Surgery.

Think: lack of definition, bounce, and less volume. If you want to achieve a bouncy blowout‚Äìbig, ‚Äô90s hair is back‚Äìor accentuate your natural texture without all the frizz, the best diffusers for curly hair can make a big difference. 
‚ÄúA blow dryer diffuser directs the airflow, so it does not disturb the curl pattern,‚Äù explains Todd Faul, senior cosmetology educator at Aveda Arts & Sciences Institutes-Dallas. ‚ÄúDiffusers can be used on hair that has been permed to enhance the curl, or on naturally curly hair to enhance your God-given curls.‚Äù 
As you begin your journey to find your diffuser match, it isn‚Äôt always as simple as picking up the most affordable or prettiest option. Not every diffuser will fit every hair dryer, so that‚Äôs something to look out for. If you‚Äôre not crazy about your current hair dryer, now may be the time to purchase a dryer and diffuser combo so that you know that they‚Äôre compatible. It‚Äôs also key to have your goals in mind. Looking for extra volume? More definition? Those factors can help guide you toward the right diffuser. 
We tapped top hair stylists for their favorite diffusers, scoured customer reviews, and included a few options we‚Äôve tested and love to find the best diffusers on the market. Whatever your curl wishes are, here are the 16 best diffusers for curly hair that really wowed us.
If you want to add volume but keep definition, this diffuser is gentle enough to do both. The hand-like tool gently cups hair, instead of disturbing it, so you can get the best of both worlds. Want to see if it will fit your hairdryer? See specs and measurements here.

For curls that look just as good as what you can get in a salon, try the GHD diffuser attachment. It makes quick work of even long, thick curls, without using too much heat. This diffuser can be used with the GHD Helios dryer, or their Air Professional dryer.

An expert reviewer says: ‚ÄúWhen I travel, trying to decide which hair products to bring is always the hardest part of packing. For my curls, a diffuser is absolutely essential, but most are so bulky. I love that this tool collapses so I can easily pack it use it with hotel hair dryers.‚Äù ‚ÄìTatjana Freund, Fashion & Luxury Commerce Editor
If you‚Äôre trying to speed up the drying process, opt for a diffuser like this one. It has 360-degree airflow, meaning your hair will dry evenly. It‚Äôs also very large, so you can scoop up a big bundle of curls and dry them super fast. Note: This diffuser doesn‚Äôt fit all hair dryers! From Tracee Ellis Ross‚Äô curl-specific brand, this blow dryer took two years to get right and features four attachments including a diffuser that offers much more than meets the eye. For a customized blowout that‚Äôs tailor-made to your unique curls, there are three heat and two speed settings to choose from. You can read ELLE‚Äôs full review of Pattern for more information.

An expert reviewer says: ‚ÄúI love that Pattern‚Äôs heat system has an attachment for all, well, hair patterns and textures.‚Äù ‚ÄìNerisha Penrose, ELLE.com Beauty Commerce Editor
 Whether you‚Äôre traveling, sharing a hair dryer, or simply on a budget, this fabric diffuser can be tightened onto your classic blow dryer to create a diffusing effect. ‚ÄúThe sock diffuser will fit on pretty much all hair dryers,‚Äù says Faul. ‚ÄúMade from a lightweight, heat-resistant fabric instead of plastic like most diffusers, it‚Äôs perfect for people that travel as it is easy to pack in your suitcase and will fit on any hair dryer that is provided by the hotel that you‚Äôre staying at.‚Äù

An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúThis little diffuser is perfect. The picture doesn‚Äôt show the elastic strap that holds it to the dryer, but it does have one. My other diffusers leave me with lots of frizz or constantly pop off the dryer during use. I now keep this one permanently attached to my dryer. I have lots of curly 3A hair and this product dries it without frizz and lots of shine. A truly great product for curly hair!‚Äù
Searching for a bit more bounce? That‚Äôs what the Drybar diffuser is best at. It helps lift curls off the scalp, giving you tons of volume without adding frizz. Plus, while this diffuser works with Drybar‚Äôs hair dryers, it also fits most other blow dryers, too! The proof is in the pudding.
Ulta rating: 4/5 stars
An Ulta reviewer says: ‚ÄúMy hair dryer worked fine, but I needed a diffuser attachment. This one fits my Rusk CTC hair dryer perfectly, and it actually dries my hair faster than the one that came with my blow dryer. I‚Äôd recommend!‚Äù
This tool was created to help accentuate your natural texture. It‚Äôs great for people with wavy hair who are looking to keep a natural bend in their hair. This dryer and diffuser are super lightweight, which means your styling routine can stop being your workout routine, too.
Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúThe best method for my own head of curls is to wash it as normal, put a small amount of leave-in conditioner on my hair to maintain moisture, and finger twist with Mop Top custard. After finger-twisting, I just gently diffuse with this dryer upside down first, then left and right before finally upright, until hair is dry.‚Äù
This brand has taken notes and created the diffuser of our dreams. Not only does this fit almost every hair dryer on the market thanks to some clever design, but it also has a huge barrel, so even people with the thickest hair can style and dry their hair quickly.
Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúI love that this diffuser is adjustable to fit on many hair blowers. It works well and I‚Äôve had no issues with anything melting or overheating.‚Äù
Whether you‚Äôre looking to rock your natural texture or give yourself a sleek blowout, this hair dryer and attachments can make all your hair dreams come true. With a diffuser, smoothing attachment, and comb attachment, you‚Äôll never need to step foot in a salon again.
Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars
 An Amazon reviewer says:‚ÄúNo frills, but it had everything I needed with the cool setting being perfect and the absolute best part was how crazy lightweight it is!‚Äù
 ‚ÄúDiffusers essentially diffuse the air coming out of the dryer, so it reduces the velocity and spreads it out further, which is great for mimicking air-drying,‚Äù says David Lopez, New York-based celebrity hairstylist and curl expert. While a traditional blow dryer pushes air out and causes frizz, a diffuser will just gently dry hair without any friction. 
‚ÄúI would say anyone who wants to mimic air-drying, or perhaps encourage some volume in their natural waves or curls, and of course, someone with curly hair,‚Äù says Lopez. Diffusers are great for anyone who wants to add a bit more volume to their styles as well. ‚ÄúEven people with straight hair can use a diffuser,‚Äù adds Faul. ‚ÄúThey will be surprised to see how much body and wave they can get out of diffusing their hair.‚Äù
‚ÄúFirst, I just really rotate the diffuser around the head and around the hair, without touching or manipulating the hair at all until a cast starts to form from the product that you use,‚Äù says Lopez. ‚ÄúThen, once a cast starts to form and you want to start building volume, you can tilt your head side-to-side or flip upside down gently and then encourage some volume and some more curl.‚Äù
‚ÄúWait until your hair is completely dry before you start cupping it to encourage the curl,‚Äù says Lopez. ‚ÄúThe more you touch your hair while it‚Äôs drying, the more you are going to encourage frizz. So, I always tell people to let the hair dry first to at least 85 to 90 percent, basically almost completely dry, before you start cupping it and encouraging volume, so you don‚Äôt have as much frizz.‚Äù

title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This September
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Back to school, back to reality, back to fall fashion! 
We can‚Äôt help but think of fall as September rolls around. The energy is fresh, fashion month is upon us, and with that, a slew of new fashion drops, collaborations, and special moments that you won‚Äôt want to miss, like John Hardy‚Äôs reimagined New York store, Swarovski‚Äôs latest assortment of lab-grown diamonds, and more. Keep checking back for all the latest and greatest in fashion news. 
Who: John Hardy
What: Reimagined New York store
Where: 118 Prince Street, New York City
Why: John Hardy‚Äôs new direction under Reed Krakoff is positively refreshing, with a bold new take on the classic woven pieces fans of the brand know and love. To commemorate this change, the Soho store has been renovated and given a breath of new life, with a bold marigold and yellow color palette and Balinese artwork. The two new collections, Spear and Surf, are available to purchase, plus a tea bar in the back for when you need a quick refresher. ‚ÄúI wanted to honor the essence of John Hardy‚Äôs foundational designs, fusing the brand‚Äôs rich Balinese heritage with a contemporary vision,‚Äù Krakoff exclusively tells ELLE.com. ‚ÄúThe reimagination of our flagship store was conceived through the same perspective. Our goal was to create an immersive environment that offers our clients the best of the new brand vision as well as the enduring legacy of craftsmanship that has always defined our brand.‚Äù 
Who: Luar and Emcee
What: Ana bag collection
Where: Exclusively online at emceestudios.com
Why: For the uninitiated, Emcee is a unique e-commerce site that harnesses the power of content creators to partner with brands and expand the way we shop in 2023. It makes sense, then, why it co-sponsored Luar‚Äôs knockout runway show at NYFW, and subsequently asked Raul Lopez and three Emcee creators to collaborate on the brand‚Äôs signature Ana bag. Uniekue (@uniekue), Valerie Zhang (@valslooks), and Anna Molinari (@annamolinstinct), pictured here, all brought their creative expressions to life by riffing on Lopez‚Äôs design.
Who: Veronica de Piante
What: Fall collection 
Where: Exclusively online at net-a-porter.com 
Why: Following the initial launch of her debut collection in fall 2022, designer Veronica de Piante garnered a swath of critical acclaim, including a nod from Net-a-Porter, who called her ‚Äúa name to know.‚Äù The luxury retailer is now doubling down on this claim, announcing they will be the designer‚Äôs exclusive retail partner. The 10-piece offering showcases de Piante‚Äôs range, spotlighting expertly tailored trousers, a leather trench coats, and a beautifully draped georgette gown. One notable standout: a duchess silk jacket trimmed with her signature embroidery, hand-sewn by Palestinian and Syrian artists in Jordan in an effort to foster economic independence among refugees. 
Who: Monica Rich Kosann and Gracie Wiener
What: The MRK x Ironic Boat and Tote collection
Where: Online at monicarichkosann.com
Why: Monica Rich Kosann has partnered with Gracie Wiener of @ironicboatandtote, known for popularizing unexpected monograms on classic L.L.Bean tote bags, on a capsule collection of six internet-y phrases (IYKYK, subtle, yikes, LOL) engraved on pendant necklaces in sterling silver and 18K yellow gold. ‚ÄúI live for personalized pieces that are playful and fun, so it‚Äôs been a dream to transform a timeless modern heirloom into something a tad cheeky and unexpected‚ÄîIYKYK,‚Äù Wiener says in a press release. (We know.)
Who: The SIL and The Beverly Hills Hotel
What: Capsule collection and residency
Where: Exclusively online at thesilshop.com and at The Beverly Hills Hotel later this month
Why: Editor-loved e-commerce site The SIL, founded by Natalie Bloomingdale as a platform for independent designers creating one-of-a-kind pieces (it‚Äôs an acronym for Stuff I Love), has partnered with The Beverly Hills Hotel on an exclusive capsule that pays tribute its legendary original owner, Margaret J. Anderson. To do so, Bloomingdale tapped six talented women in the fashion space to each create a piece, which are all available to shop online now and will be displayed at a trunk show later this month in one of the property‚Äôs bungalows. We‚Äôre calling dibs on this sequin-lined robe coat.
Who: Swarovski
What: Created Diamonds Galaxy Collection 
Where: Online at swarovski.com and at Swarovski stores
Why: Swarovski‚Äôs creative director Giovanna Battaglia Engelbert took inspiration from the cosmos for her first collection of Created Diamonds, entitled Galaxy, naturally. The starburst studs, earrings, and necklaces combine her unique eye for luxury with lab-grown diamonds for a result that looks like the real thing.
Who: Zegna and The Elder Statesman
What: Collaborative collection
Where: Online at zegna.com and elder-statesman.com
Why: Zegna‚Äôs Oasi Cashmere program is on its way to becoming a fully traceable operation, bringing transparency to a usually murky process of cashmere production. The brand remains committed to using the finest textiles in the world, which makes its first Oasi creative partnership with Los Angeles-based cashmere purveyors The Elder Statesman so fitting. The Elder Statesman‚Äôs focus on craft and easy-going, colorful L.A. vibe finds a match with Zegna‚Äôs Milanese sensibilities, resulting in a unisex collaboration that is deadly soft and ready for the streets...or sofa.
Who: Mother Denim
What: Petite sizing
Where: Online at motherdenim.com
Why: Calling all short girls: Mother Denim is rolling out petite sizing for fall with the aptly named Lil‚Äô Mother collection. The five-piece capsule includes adjustments of some the brand‚Äôs key styles (higher knee placement, shorter inseam and rise), including The Hustler Ankle Fray (pictured here with an oversize comb for scale).
Who: Port Tanger and Renell Medrano
What: Sunglasses collaboration
Where: Online at porttanger.com
Why: Port Tanger is the freshest eyewear brand on the market, bringing a global vision and world-class craftsmanship to effortlessly cool pieces you simply can‚Äôt find anywhere else. For the latest in its ‚ÄúVisited By‚Äù series, it invited photographer and New York cool girl Renell Medrano to bring her Dominican heritage and street sensibility to a group of shades ranging from the smaller Mektoub  to the wrap-around Nunny (pictured here) in the greatest eggplant purple hue.
Who: Mulberry and Stefan Cooke
What: Limited-edition capsule
Where: Online at mulberry.com 
Why: Mulberry is putting its money where its mouth is‚Äîbringing sustainability and circularity front and center while also supporting emerging designer Stefan Cooke, who was invited to rework 27 Mulberry vintage bags for his London Fashion Week runway show. The result is a mix of Mulberry‚Äôs signature shapes imbued with Cooke‚Äôs trademark cutouts and color combinations for something that‚Äôs borrowed, and also new. 
Who: Thom Browne
What: Brand takeover at Nordstrom
Where: Online at nordstrom.com and at a pop-up shop, plus at a restaurant takeover at Nordstrom‚Äôs NYC flagship through early November
Why: Thom Browne‚Äôs high-fashion prep universe has docked at Nordstrom NYC. The retailer is celebrating the designer‚Äôs fall 2023 collection with an in-store installation of a beach house to set the tone for getaways to come, plus a takeover of the Broadway Bar on the flagship's 3rd floor. Customers and fans will find his take on boarding school-chic tailoring, and his beloved Hector bags in the shape of his dachshund, and more.
Who: Mansur Gavriel
What: Anniversary Collection
Where: Online at mansurgavriel.com
Why: It‚Äôs hard to believe that it‚Äôs been 10 whole years since Mansur Gavriel first introduced its iconic bucket bag and tote, sending fashion girls everywhere into a collective tizzy. Now, the New York-based accessories brand helmed by Rachel Mansur and Floriana Gavriel is paying homage to its roots with an Anniversary Collection of the designer duo‚Äôs favorite archival styles‚Äîin tandem with a NYFW block party on Orchard Street, because why not?
Who: Ganni and Kim Nguyen
What: Exclusive collaboration
Where: Online at ganni.com 
Why: Danish cool-girl brand Ganni has joined forces with New York-based Vietnamese designer Kim Nguyen of Nguyen Inc for a six-piece collection that combines sustainability, wearability, and creativity. The two previously collaborated twice before on a collection of upcycled T-shirts; now, they reworked some Ganni classics with leftover fabrics, inspired by her upbringing. ‚ÄúGanni proves that even at a scale like theirs, designing responsibly can still be prioritized and achievable,‚Äù Nguyen tells ELLE.com.
Who: Chanel
What: Lucky Chance Diner opening
Where: 225 Wythe Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
Why: Chanel is putting down roots in Williamsburg, at least temporarily. The luxury brand has debuted its new pop-up concept, the Lucky Chance Diner, a unique fragrance experience that‚Äôs conveniently located steps away from Chanel‚Äôs new fragrance and beauty boutique. Fittingly, the house celebrated the opening with hordes of its closest friends, including Chase Sui Wonders, Lil Nas X, and Molly Gordon. On the menu? Fragrances, vending machines, and a life-size Chance bottle photo-op. The diner is free and open to the public from September 8 through September 10 from 11 A.M. to 7 P.M. Walk-ins are welcome!
Who: Jonathan Cohen and Larroud√©
What: Shoe collaboration
Where: Online at larroude.com and jonathancohenstudio.com
Why: Two of the buzziest brands in fashion today, Jonathan Cohen and Larroud√©, have come together to create a collection of shoes and boots adorned with the ready-to-wear designer‚Äôs signature prints, which were shown at his SS24 presentation during New York Fashion Week. ‚ÄúCombining Marina‚Äôs classic shapes and craft with our signature prints and upcycled components feels like a full-circle moment,‚Äù Cohen tells ELLE.com exclusively. ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to share it with the world!‚Äù
Who: Ba&sh
What: Knitwear pop-up shop through the end of September
Where: 61 Crosby Street, New York City
Why: A little slice of Paris in the heart of Soho? Why not? Just in time for NYFW, ba&sh, the French brand known for classic staples with a certain je ne sais quoi, has unveiled an immersive pop-up shop in Soho dedicated to knitwear, including its popular Gaspard cardigan.
Who: Sacai and Carhartt WIP
What: Collaborative capsule
Where: Online at carthartt-wip.com, sacai.com, and at Sacai retail locations
Why: Sacai‚Äôs take on utilitarian staples has gained the brand a cult following for its artful take on workwear basics. Fitting, then, that for FW23, it debuted a collaboration with Carhartt WIP on the runway that includes knit cardigans, pleated skirts, and, of course, a chore jacket that is anything but basic. 
Who: Farrow & Ball and Christopher John Rogers
What: Paint and wallpaper collaboration
Where: Online at farrow-ball.com and at Farrow & Ball stores
Why: Christopher John Rogers is slowly becoming a global lifestyle brand, on his own terms. As perhaps the greatest colorist working in American fashion today, Rogers knows what shades complement each other (or clash just so), so it‚Äôs fitting that he took his vision to the world of interiors. British paint and wallpaper authority Farrow & Ball worked with the designer on a range of 12 bold colors and three wallpaper prints that mix and match as well as Rogers‚Äô ready-to-wear pieces. The pale yellow pictured here, named Hog Plum, is fit for complementing darker colors or adorning a powder room on its own.
Who: AG Jeans and Emily Ratajkowski
What: The EmRata x AG Capsule collection
Where: Online at agjeans.com
Why: Just in time for fall, a.k.a. denim‚Äôs reigning season, AG Jeans has partnered with none other than EmRata on a capsule collection of mix-and-matchable pieces that are effortlessly casual yet put-together (think: denim cargos, crop tops, and a vegan leather trench coat).
Who: Paul Smith and Mulberry
What: Handbag capsule
Where: Online at paulsmith.com and mulberry.com
Why: Brits are better together. Case in point: Two stalwarts of the industry, Paul Smith and Mulberry, joined forces for a collaboration of 10 handbags in wonderfully unexpected color combinations, featuring Mulberry finishes and Paul Smith‚Äôs trademark sense of wonder. We‚Äôre adding the hands-free mini Antony bag to our fashion month wish list.
Kevin LeBlanc is the Fashion Associate at ELLE Magazine. He covers fashion news, trends, and anything to do with Robyn Rihanna Fenty.
Claire Stern is the Digital Director of ELLE.com. Previously, she was Deputy Editor of ELLE.com. Her interests include fashion, food, travel, music, Peloton, and The Hills‚Äînot necessarily in that order. She used to have a Harriet the Spy notebook and isn‚Äôt ashamed to admit it.

title: The 13 Best Root Touch-Ups to Buy You Time Between Salon Visits
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
For every hair type, texture, and color. 
Hair color trends come and go‚Äìred hair is particularly hot right now‚Äìbut even when grown-in roots are trending (as they currently are), there‚Äôs still a camp that wants their hair to remain one shade. As a fake blonde with dark roots, I get it. As I approach the two-month mark after a blonde-ing sesh and my brunette base starts to creep down my strands, it‚Äôs all I can see when I look in the mirror. But going to the salon every eight weeks just isn‚Äôt in the cards for me. That‚Äôs where the best root touch-up products come in. 
If you don‚Äôt have a balayage dye job or something similar that‚Äôs meant to be root-heavy, ‚ÄúA root touch-up product is a good way to help your color last longer in between salon visits,‚Äù explains Samantha Denis, a former hair colorist and founder of haircare brand, allyoos. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd use a root touch-up product when you're not quite ready to see your colorist, but your roots are starting to show and you start noticing a line of demarcation.‚Äù Beyond covering grays or other root growth, root touch-ups can also be used to play around with your hair color in a quick, temporary way in lieu of going for a major color change or daring chop. Say, you have natural blonde hair but want to try the smudge-y root trend without actually dyeing it, simply use a root touch-up in a darker shade to achieve the look. 
Whatever your reason for using a root touch-up might be, there‚Äôs a product for you. I‚Äôve rounded up some of my personal favorites, along with top-reviewed products. Pro colorists Denis and balayage expert Abby Haliti also weighed in to share their thoughts on these 13 root touch-ups.  From brush-on powders and crayons to sprays and even temporary dyes, here, find the formula that will best suit your hair needs.
Looking for a more permanent option that you don‚Äôt have to worry about rinsing or sweating away? ‚ÄúThis option offers a higher level of saturation, resulting in a deeper and more comprehensive coverage,‚Äù says Haliti. ‚ÄúAdditionally, it features a more liquid base and lower levels of ammonia, making it an ideal choice for those seeking even greater depth of color.‚Äù Available in 15 shades, this DIY coloring kit has everything you need to cover your roots in as little as ten minutes and will last you several weeks. They have great coverage and wash out well, which is important because you don‚Äôt want to block your real root touch-up from penetrating when you finally do head back to the salon.‚Äù Note: there are only two shades to choose from as they're mostly intended for blending and covering grays.

You might expect the same out of a root cover-up product, and while some of them might not be the neatest to apply, that‚Äôs not the case with this targeted mist. ‚ÄúThe spray-on application of this product makes it incredibly easy to use, allowing you to quickly and accurately apply it to your desired area,‚Äù says Haliti. It also comes in nine different shades to effectively blend in with a range of hair colors.
Target rating: 4/5 stars
A Target reviewer says: ‚ÄúI absolutely love this product. The coverage is amazing with such a light coat. The color blend is perfect. It last all day. I wish these products were less transferable, but it‚Äôs way better than other brands I‚Äôve tried. This is my new must have.‚Äù
Essentially like an eye shadow, but for your hair, root touch-up powders are a staple in most hair stylists‚Äô kits‚Äîand not just because they have a lot of clients who color their manes. Although this powder is great for covering grays, it can also be used directly on your scalp in your part, at your temples, or in other areas of sparseness as a hack to help your hair appear thicker and fuller. With the accompanying brush, it‚Äôs easier to apply exactly where you want it, rather than using a messy aerosol. You could also apply it with your fingers if you were really in a pinch. 
Sephora rating: 4/5 stars
A Sephora reviewer says: ‚ÄúThis product is amazing, it covers my gray hair a lot and is perfect for a touch-up. The best thing is I don‚Äôt have to color my hair every three to four weeks to cover my grays.‚Äù
Efficient, yes. Effective, yes. Pricey, also yes‚Äìyou need to purchase the spray gun in order to dispense the formula and each refillable pod will cost you $39. In fact, each pod can last up to 120 uses, so if you‚Äôre going to be using this kit a lot, it‚Äôs a more justifiable purchase. A TEMPTU reviewer says: ‚ÄúThis root touch-up stays on for days when I skip washing. It‚Äôs nice because I don‚Äôt have to apply hair spray. It washes out with the next wash and I start over. I am able to extend my salon color treatment from every four weeks to every seven or eight weeks because 0f this product.‚Äù
I have a love-hate relationship with my blonde hair. I swore I would never go all the way to the root with my highlights because my hair grows way too fast (a good thing, I know!), but alas, I have gone blonder and blonder. Now that my highlights start closer to the scalp, root growth is a real problem for me. But this little brush-on product is my permanent solution. Formulated by celebrity colorist Justin Anderson, the heat-activated product is packed with hydrogen peroxide, lemon juice, and purple pigments to lighten and brighten for a fresh blonde effect when I need it. I simply apply it to areas that need a little boost, then blow dry to activate the formula. 
Ulta rating: 3.3/5 stars
An Ulta reviewer says: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm shocked this works so well. I‚Äôve had natural light blonde hair for 41 years, then it started fading. My roots were getting a little darker, a little gray/silver. I want my blonde hair, but I‚Äôm not willing to go to the salon every six weeks to keep it up. This product is AMAZING! I brush it into my wet hair, blow dry, and instant highlights. I‚Äôm a huge fan.‚Äù
Similar to the brand‚Äôs other styling products, the R+Co Bright Shadows Root Touch-Up spray has a lovely uplifting scent called Rosy Eyed, which is comprised of bergamot, wild fig, and tonka beans. A Dermstore reviewer says: ‚ÄúLooking at my roots is frustrating because my hair grows rapidly. I have long hair, so root touch-ups and refresh coloring is a time-consuming process for me. Sephora rating: 4.6/5 stars
A Sephora reviewer says: ‚ÄúI have very fine, thin, light blond hair. This is the first dry shampoo I‚Äôve ever repurchased, and I‚Äôve tried them all. I will be sticking with this one for sure.‚Äù
Madison Reed is known for their at-home hair color products, phenomenal customer service, and helpful tutorials and video consultations to help you navigate the process (the latter being a game-changer for me during quarantine) And chances are, if you're covering gray hairs on your head, you might see a few sprouting throughout your brows, too. Ulta rating: 4.7/5 stars
An Ulta reviewer says: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been using another brand of root touch up powder and thought I‚Äôd try this since I use Madison Reed hair color. This color was suggested for my hair, and it matches perfectly! I was using another eyebrow powder, but this one is perfect. So happy I ordered it!‚Äù

We like this one for covering grays in particular versus dark root growth. Because it‚Äôs a two-in-one product, it‚Äôs a great option for travel to maximize space in your toiletry bag.
Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúMy hair is thin, so I try to stretch out my color as long as possible. When the roots start showing gray, I can get a few more days by using this. Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer say: ‚ÄúThis product is awesome! I have some thinning at the top of my head near my forehead, and it covers my scalp perfectly. You would never know. Plus, it also covers the gray, and gives you a little more time before it‚Äôs time to have it colored. I highly recommend this product. I will never be without it, and it lasts a very long time.‚Äù
‚ÄúRoot touch-up products are specially formulated to help cover up or blend in new hair growth at the roots between salon visits,‚Äù says Haliti. ‚ÄúThese products are designed to temporarily conceal gray hairs or visible roots, providing a quick and convenient solution for maintaining a polished look.‚Äù They come in spray, stick, and powder form, along with some permanent formulations.
According to Denis, ‚Äúthe best way to choose your color is to ask your colorist if they recommend a root touch-up product for you. If you are browsing and come across one, the best way to match on your own would be to do a strand test and see if it blends into the rest of your strands after smudging and blending it in a bit with your fingers or a brush,‚Äù she adds. 
The answer is that it really depends on what type of root touch-up product you‚Äôre using. Naturally, the best way to apply each formula is by following the usage directions. If you‚Äôre using a stick, Haliti advises ‚Äúdrawing it onto your root area, then using your fingers to smudge and blend it in.‚Äù If you‚Äôre using a spray, generally, you should hold the can about six inches from your head, then spray. You can distribute the product and allow it to settle into strands by brushing it through with a bristle brush. Meanwhile, powders tend to come with an application tool like a brush, sponge, or spoolie to apply the product directly to your roots.
No matter which type of product you‚Äôre using, though, ‚Äústart with clean, dry hair and section your hair before applying the product according to the instructions," says Denis. ‚ÄúThen, blend it in and style as desired.‚Äù 
In most cases, root touch-ups are just a temporary solution, so they‚Äôll ‚Äúlast until you wash your hair,‚Äù says Denis, who adds that ‚Äúa good formula will wash out easily with shampoo.‚Äù But, if you‚Äôre using a permanent touch-up like the L‚ÄôOr√©al Magic Root Rescue, then you‚Äôll buy yourself a bit more time.  
‚ÄúAll shades can probably get away with using some form of root touch-up, but it might be harder to match blonde and red shades since they vary so much,‚Äù says Denis. Blondes and reds can be cool, warm, or somewhere in between, so ‚Äúdarker shades will be the easiest to blend and match,‚Äù Denis adds. Some brands might not even offer red shades at all, so red-haired folks may also need to do a little more legwork to find a good match. 
‚ÄúThe frequency of root touch-ups varies based on factors like hair growth rate, desired coverage, and personal preference,‚Äù explains Haliti. ‚ÄúDarker hair colors may require more frequent touch-ups due to noticeable regrowth, while lighter hair colors may have longer intervals between touch-ups.‚Äù
Samantha Denis is the founder of allyoos and former hair stylist, colorist, and product developer.
Abby Haliti is a celebrity colorist and a master of the French Balayage technique. She is also the founder of Abby Haliti Color Studio in New York City.

Do biotin shampoos really work? A dermatologist weighs in.  
Not all of us have the luck of being born with Cindy Crawford‚Äôs luscious locks. Most of us must work harder to achieve the voluminous hair we dream of. Of course, an easy fix may be to ‚Äújust get extensions,‚Äù but it‚Äôs not as simple as it seems. Extensions often weigh down your scalp and, even worse, cause permanent hair damage. Here's where biotin shampoos come in. 
‚ÄúBiotin is a water-soluble B-complex vitamin (vitamin B7) that has important roles in cellular metabolism and signaling,‚Äù New York-based board-certified dermatologist, Dr. Tiffany Libby, tells ELLE.com. Simply put, biotin has long been touted for its hair-strengthening properties. ‚ÄúIt is used in biotin shampoos as it is believed to strengthen hair follicles and increase scalp circulation and hair density. While there is limited clinical data that points to the use of oral or topical biotin for promoting hair and nail growth in healthy patients, some patients find it helpful in helping to thicken and strengthen hair,‚Äù she explains. 
The shower is where your hair gets all the attention it‚Äôs craving. If you are someone who has been bleaching and coloring your hair since the beginning of time, your hair probably needs some extra TLC. For biotin shampoo to give you the results you desire, you must keep an eye out for some key ingredients that support your hair in every way, such as vitamins and natural oils‚Äîboth promoting hair growth. Luckily, we polled experts and perused dozens of customer reviews to find the eight best biotin shampoos to start your hair care journey.

title: The Best Looks From Paris Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2024
text:
The fashion month calendar culminates in the City of Lights.
Kiko Kostadinov‚Äôs spring collection made me want to be more bold. It made me want to wear orange and black stripes, colorful furry wrap coats, and tunics over pants. Black, light grey, and cargo hues were offset by chartreuse green, cobalt blue, and candy pink. Hem and neck lines were equally asymmetric, and jackets were purposefully buttoned askew. Patterns, colors, and styles were unconventionally paired in ways that might have seem haphazard to an untrained eye. The lesson: stop getting dressed and start playing dress-up.‚ÄîMeg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editor 
Miuccia Prada's finger has been on the pulse of youth culture and its future for the last few seasons, and this preppy-beachy collection is no different. She continued with the multiple layers exploration, this time with prep school blazers, oxford button downs, bikini bottoms and surf shorts in varying shades of navy, orange, and yellow. She countered the more encumbering looks with fresh bandana-style leather tube tops and matching skirts, plus a healthy dose of jacquard. With another all-star cast including Troye Sivan and Cailee Spaeny, Mrs. Prada closed out fashion week showing she may be generations away from the youth in her cast, but she's all too aware of how we dress, and how we want to dress, and how we should dress. ‚ÄîKevin LeBlanc, fashion associate
John Galliano is a master of character study and development, and his co-ed Margiela collection brought the most excitement to the runway all week. Every look, deconstructed, repinned, and held just so, told a story with each gesture, whether with the intentional removal of a shoulder pad or the exaggeration of a skirt's hem. Galliano's inspiration was of inheritance, and how that translates through clothing passed through generations. One can't help but to think of a daughter throwing on her father's massive blazer, or a child ensconced in their grandmother's corseted dresses. With Galliano, the possibilities for imagination and stories is endless. ‚ÄîKevin LeBlanc, fashion associate
First and foremost, the Mugler runway was star-studded. Models included Angela Bassett, Paris Hilton, Helena Christensen, Irina Shayk, Amber Valletta, and Fan Bingbing. The collection was, as expected, full of sex appeal, exposed flesh, and geometric cut-outs. The shapes and hyper-structured silhouettes signature to the brand were, of course, present, as were de-constructed thigh-high boots, colored fringe, and tinsel. There were more than few freed nipples and one entirely translucent, hard-sided breastplate (glass?) that might have stolen the show if it weren‚Äôt for Angela Bassett. Did I mention her?‚ÄîMeg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editor 
Rokh‚Äôs spring/summer 2024 collection proved that the utilitarian trend can still be chic. Sleek tailoring paired well with doily-like white lace, and otherwise classic workwear pieces ‚Äî trench coats, button downs, and slacks ‚Äî were reimagined to be slightly twisted. Cropped jackets, elongated belt straps, and weird proportions made the collection semi-normal looking to the naked eye, but up close, you can see the ‚Äúoff‚Äù features and oddities that make it interesting. A mostly black and grey color palette and a mostly sleek, sturdy primary fabric were accented with a subtle pop of color & touch-worthy textures: a latex mustard yellow top here, a muted pink and yellow shag dress there. The collection as a whole felt dark, but not heavy or suffocating, perhaps a response to the ultra-loud, gimmicky trends of seasons past that frankly, Rokh has never participated in anyway.‚ÄîMadison Rexroat, fashion & accessories assistant
Nicolas Ghesquiere took a turn down a flowier, lighter path this season with lots of flouncy maxi skirts pair with lush silk bombers and tops. He's at his best when he's looking at architectural aspects of clothing and subverting them, pushing them towards the future. This was most brilliantly exercised in his reworking on padded swing coats, one in butter yellow that was divine, and his reconfiguration of the tweed tailcoats towards the end of the show, which were fringed, sequined, and checkered to great effect. ‚ÄîKevin LeBlanc, fashion associate

title: Our Favorite Fragrances Will Have You Smelling Like A Dream
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Meet your new signature scent. 
When you meet someone, your fragrance is the first thing to introduce you before words leave your mouth. What do you want your scent to say? Are you a burst of energy fueled by bright citrus and fruits? Or maybe you like to be mysterious with sultry tonka beans and woods tickling the noses of every passerby.
A signature scent is also deeply personal; it can evoke particular memories, elicit a sense of comfort or nostalgia, and even help tell the world about your unique personality. Plus, fragrances can smell quite different on different skin types, which makes finding the best perfumes for women a personalized experience. 
‚ÄúFragrance is about the way it makes you feel,‚Äù explains Joan Tanis, national training and events director at Maison Francis Kurkjian. ‚ÄúWearing a scent that works with your specific body chemistry can also enhance your mood and even change behaviors. Fragrance encourages the release of endorphins, which makes us feel good.‚Äù
If you‚Äôre not sure exactly where to start on your scent journey, don‚Äôt fret. We‚Äôve scoured customer reviews and tested dozens of buzzy formulas to bring you some of the most exciting perfumes. From summer-centric lavender perfumes to mature vanilla and rich gender-fluid scents, we made it easy to uncover timeless classics or intriguingly unconventional blends‚Äîno matter your preference. And the best part? You can order a few samples to compare and contrast your favorites while still deciding, or go all-in on a full-size bottle that doubles as d√©cor once you‚Äôve nailed down your signature fragrance.Also worth noting: Many of these brands offer some amazing perfume gift sets, so you can treat your loved ones to the magical experience of (hopefully) finding their new go-to scents, too. 
Smells like: A sunny Italian vacation 
Key notes: Mandarin, neroli, orange blossom, jasmine, myrrh, musks 
Summer doesn‚Äôt seem too far away when you have this scent on hand. Orange Smoke smells exactly like its name‚Äîa toasty, citrus scent that's as sweet as it is smoky. 
‚ÄúIf I could bottle up what my vacation on the Amalfi Coast smelled like, it would be eerily similar to Orange Smoke by Dries Van Noten. The mandarin, orange blossom, and neroli notes are warmed up under the sun and deepened with musks to create a bright and warm aroma.‚Äù‚ÄîNerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor
Smells like: Salty citrus
Key notes: Salted Lemon, pink pepper, musks
A little bit spicy, citrusy, and woodsy all in one, this super-affordable fragrance has the depth of a much pricier top-shelf perfume. The scent leans neither too masculine nor feminine, meaning it‚Äôs one your BF might just be tempted to use, too. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been a sucker for men‚Äôs cologne, but have never actually added any to my routine because I don‚Äôt want to smell like a full-on dude.  However, this Le Monde Gourmand scent strikes the perfect balance. Described by the brand as evoking the ‚Äòcomforting embrace of an oversized hoodie stolen from your crush,‚Äô it has an effortlessly musky scent without being too rich or overpowering. It‚Äôs so good, in fact, I love to spritz it on every few hours for a fresh whiff.‚Äù‚Äî S.P.  
Smells like: Creamy woods
Key notes: Almond, coffee, bergamot lemon; jasmine, orange blossom, tonka bean, cacao, vanilla, sandalwood, patchouli and cedar
Starting bright and surprising with whiffs of jasmine, this perfume soon turns dark and seductive with traces of coffee and cocoa. A must-have for any wild night in or out. 
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúThe bottle is what immediately caught my attention, but after I sampled it, I needed to have it. It goes very well with my natural scent; it‚Äôs warm and sweet, yet sexy. It‚Äôs perfect for everyday wear as well as special occasions.‚Äù
Smells like: Soft, tangy florals
Key notes: Grapefruit, rose accord
A fruity, floral fragrance as traditionally feminine as its color, this is a non-fussy pick for day wear.
‚ÄúOf all the perfumes I‚Äôve tried over the years, Chanel's Chance has remained a constant in my lineup. It‚Äôs lighter and more modern than the brand‚Äôs iconic N¬∞5 scent, yet is still just as effortlessly classic and long-lasting. In fact, I‚Äôve found it to be such a universal crowd-pleaser that even an Uber driver once asked me what I was wearing.‚Äù‚ÄîS.P.
Smells like: Marshmallows and ice cream
Key notes: Lavender blossom, juicy pear, bergamot, coconut, vanilla orchid, woods, cashmere 
Even if your name isn‚Äôt Ari, you can still smell like the superstar with this flirty, feminine perfume. With sweet floral and fruity scents of lavender blossom, pear, coconut, and vanilla, this is a bright, young fragrance, in the best way.
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it. Steamy cotton candy. I smell like a sexy cavity. Ten out of 10.‚Äù
Smells like: Florals deep in the woods
Key notes: violet leaves, jasmine, vetiver.
Created by the brand that brought us the chicest, most enviable lingerie in the market, the perfumes by La Perla are just as desirable. This scent is citrusy enough to invoke a bold, wide-awake feeling, but countered with dark notes of neroli, too.
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúVery beautiful, fruity violet perfume. This smells like a rich French woman. Oozes elegance, and the bottle is just oh-my-god stunning.‚Äù
Smells like: A floral boutique
Key notes: Jasmine, rose essence, chypre accord
With ambassador Zendaya as its leading lady, Lancome‚Äôs Idole already has a lot going for it. But with its burst of fresh florals‚Äîrose and jasmine, in particular‚Äîthis makes for a fully feminine, but never overpowering, scent.
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúBeautiful scent of flowers that lasts on your clothes and wherever you spray it on yourself for well over a day! Plus, you only need a little bit, because it most certainly goes a long way.‚Äù
Smells like: Spicy amber
Key notes: Jasmine, saffron, cedarwood, ambergris accord 
Baccarat Rouge 540 is another woodsy scent with a sweeter edge. That first whiff is sweet, then it evolves into spicy, earthy notes of jasmine, cedar, and saffron.
‚ÄúThis perfume is a guaranteed conversation starter. The distinct smell either evokes the response of 'Ahh, I love 540,' amongst knowing individuals or 'What is that smell?!' to those that are about to be introduced to the reigning king of the perfume occult. It seems more genderless at first spritz, but then dries down to a sweet, woody, sexy aroma.‚Äù ‚Äî Danielle James, Beauty Director, ELLE.com 
Smells like: Honeyed florals
Key notes: Ylang ylang, Damascus rose, jasmine
There‚Äôs a reason you see this iconic bottle in practically every magazine you‚Äôve ever opened. It‚Äôs a classic, and the fruity, floral ingredients never weigh down the luscious elegance of the ylang-ylang, jasmine, pear, melon, peach, and lily. 
A Sephora reviewer says: ‚ÄúLovely floral scent, not too warm or heavy but still has good lasting power. Would recommended this to all ages and seems appropriate for both day and night. Gorgeous bottle.‚Äù
Smells like: Early summer morning by a beach
Key notes: Bergamot, pink pepper, primofiore lemon, neroli oil
Even if you don‚Äôt live near the coast, this effervescent summer perfume will instantly transport to warm, sandy shores with notes of bergamot, coconut milk, and aquatic-inspired transluzone. Also, what‚Äôs not to love about its striking apothecary-style bottle? 
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúLove this scent, takes me to holiday in my head in one spritz. All the best bits‚Äîsun cream, salty skin, fruity cocktails, and tropical flowers. Delicious. The scent really lasts well, too. Great for every day!‚Äù
Smells like: Spicy florals
Key notes: Black Coffee, white flowers, vanilla
For those who crave a little danger in their dress-up, this sexy concoction smelling of coffee, vanilla, and pear is a feast for the senses. A little smooth, a little edgy, this is a fantastic fragrance for evening wear.
A Sephora reviewer says: ‚ÄúOne of my favorite scents. Very mature but not like an old lady scent. It‚Äôs sophisticated and warm. I wear this year-round but suggest wearing it in the winter.‚Äù
Smells like: First bloom of spring flowers
Key notes: Bergamot, lychee, peach, jasmine, peony, orange blossom, moss, musk
This luxurious and fruity perfume is like summer in a bottle. Featuring unique traces of lychee, peony, orange blossom, and peach, with a little musk mixed in for good measure, this is like a well-made cocktail‚Äîworth the extra cost. 
A Saks Fifth Avenue reviewer says: ‚ÄúAs a perfume hoarder, I can say that I have nothing like it in my collection, and it smells amazing! It‚Äôs a citrusy floral that settles in very beautifully.‚Äù
Smells like: Fancy flowers
Key notes: Calypso orchid, mandarin, Bulgarian rose, almond milk, ylang ylang, iris, white musks, sandalwood
Buckle up tight because this fragrance takes you on a ride. The yin-yang scent composition unfurls a delicate composition of sensual citrus and florals, then comes the dip: warm almond milk, sandalwood, and white musk.
‚ÄúAs someone with over 100 fragrances, my signature scent changes daily. However, I almost always begin most of my scent layers with Yin Transformation, which bursts with creamy florals that feel like a balmy spring morning.‚Äù ‚Äî NP
Smells like: Freshly squeeze berries over florals
Key notes: Schisandra berry, mulberry, lily of the valley, plum blossom, honeysuckle, white amber, sandalwood, musk
Drawing inspiration from the Korean word songari, which means an array of flowers or fruit on a single stem, this enticing fragrance is at once familiar and unexpected. Top notes of mulberry and Korea-native Schisandra berry open up to plum blossom and honeysuckle, followed by subtly grounding base notes of amber and sandalwood.
‚ÄúElorea‚Äôs genderless perfumes are quickly becoming some of my new favorites. The burgeoning K-beauty brand looks to nature and its founders‚Äô shared heritage to create some undeniably divine scents, like the soft yet not overly sweet Inflorescence. If you‚Äôre unsure which Elorea perfumes will best suit you, I also love that the label offers a discovery set, which comes with a voucher of equal value that can be applied to any purchase of a full-sized scent.‚Äù‚ÄîSam Peters, ELLE.com contributor
Smells like: Fresh-out-of-water peonies
Key notes: Black pepper, raspberry accord, peony accord, geranium, freesia accord, Turkish rose, patchouli, musk
If all you want for your birthday is a bushel of peonies, this perfume should be a runner-up. It‚Äôs a beautiful floral fragrance with notes of raspberry, geranium, Turkish rose, and peony. Basically a wearable bouquet.
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúThis is a lovely perfume with so many enticing scents‚Äìuplifting citrus, woodiness, and unusual florals. I found this to be really lovely, with good staying power.‚Äù
Smells like: Spices and woods
Key notes: Davana, tonka beans, coffee, labdanum, agarwood, sandalwood
Another fragrance that owes its influences to a city‚Äîin this case, bustling Mumbai‚Äîthis perfume contains notes of davana, tonka bean, coffee, and sandalwood, to name a few. It‚Äôs a rich and slightly spicy perfume that‚Äôs perfect for the chilly winter months ahead.
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúI generally find Byredo‚Äôs combinations to be impressive, unusual, and long-lasting. Mumbai Noise is no exception‚Äîit has terrific staying power. I love the woody and spicy notes, but it‚Äôs not too dark or heavy. The davana definitely lifts the blend! This is up there with my favorite, Bal d‚ÄôAfrique!‚Äù
Smells like: Sugary florals
Key notes: Cattleya orchid, freesia, centifolia rose
It‚Äôs all in the name, folks: This perfume is like spritzing on the feeling of a sunset soir√©e in a romantic palace garden. With orchid, patchouli, tea leaf, jasmine and rose, wearing Flowerbomb is the next best thing to carrying a bouquet wherever you go.
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúFlowerbomb, in my opinion, has to be the most beautiful and comforting fragrance ever created. Sweet-soft-romantic-powdery. It‚Äôs heaven in a bottle.‚Äù
Smells like: Luxurious after-shave
Key notes: Peppermint, geranium, patchouli
For a slightly more masculine, aftershave-inspired perfume, this minty fragrance is fresh and delightful. Along with mint, it has notes of geranium and patchouli for a complicated but delectable fragrance. 
A Nordstrom reviewer says: ‚ÄúPraise for this scent with not a single flower petal in sight. It makes me think of a classy wizard who relishes a good gin. It‚Äôs mystic and unusual, and I‚Äôm here for it.‚Äù
Smells like: Dark, powdery fruits 
Key notes: blackcurrant, musk blonde wood
A classic in the Armani collection, S√¨ is the ideal bottle for anyone pining for an earthy scent that doesn‚Äôt smell like, well, earth. With rose and freesia mellowing out this seductive fragrance, it‚Äôs a great transition perfume from day to evening.
‚ÄúWhen I heard rumors that this was Rihanna's original 'signature scent,' I had to try it. And now I see exactly why everyone says she smells so good. This perfume is the perfect scent to take you from summer into autumn.‚Äù ‚Äî Danielle James 
Smells like: Peppery florals
Key notes: Pink pepper, iris, ambrette
The whole point of this perfume is that it smells like the best version of you. That is, a you that showers with expensive body wash, and that inspires people to come up to you gushing, ‚ÄúWhat are you wearing?‚Äù It contains bright notes of pink pepper, warm amber, and a hint of fresh iris.
A Glossier reviewer says: ‚ÄúI agree, it is a slightly more mature scent, but it‚Äôs such an elegant soft smell that I even put it on before bed and after showering. Definitely my new go-to. :) A few of my friends have bought it after smelling it on me at work. It‚Äôs such a unique but familiar scent at the same time. I love, love, love this perfume.‚Äù

Eager to have luscious locks? Look no further. 
There‚Äôs nothing more upsetting than looking in the mirror and noticing sparse areas of hair on your scalp‚Äî dare we say bald spots. For those of you who have dealt with hair loss or hair thinning, you've probably gone down a rabbit hole of research, attempting to discover the best ways to restore your beloved strands. While desperately scouring the internet for answers, we're guessing that you came across a variety of hair growth shampoos and hair growth oils . And perhaps you found a thing or two about collagen.
On a basic level, collagen is one of the most abundant structural proteins found in the body. Composed of several types of amino acids, this powerful protein helps to promote skin elasticity, support muscular health, and encourage hair growth. ‚ÄúThe most abundant amino acids in collagen are glycine, proline, hydroxyproline, and arginine, which are crucial for maintaining the health, elasticity, and strength of skin and hair,‚Äù says Dr. Dusan Sajic, board certified dermatologist. Thus, it comes as no surprise that many of us rely on collagen supplements to foster thriving hair.  
Consuming collagen supplements can be a great after-the-fact solution, but it should also be considered as a preventative measure, especially as we get older.  ‚ÄúAs we age, not only do we produce less collagen, we also lose excessive collagen due to environmental stressors like UV exposure, smoke exposure, and poor health habits,‚Äù says Shannon Augustine, board certified aesthetic nurse practitioner. But fear not, because luckily, there are plenty of collagen supplements that exist‚Äî from capsules to powders, and even liquids. Dr. Sajic tells ELLE.com that collagen is a protein formulated with amino acids that provide structure, elasticity, and strength to both skin and hair. ‚ÄúAltogether around fifty-six percent or more of the amino acids in collagen are foundational for skin and hair proteins, and thus has a great ratio that will contribute directly to hair health and vitality,‚Äù Dr. Sajic explains. 
However, it‚Äôs essential to understand that while collagen can certainly help to solve some of your hair problems, maintaining a healthy diet is equally important. ‚ÄúOptimal hair health also requires a more comprehensive approach, including other proteins, vitamins, minerals, and care practices,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. 
Although collagen is widely recognized for its ability to promote healthy hair and skin, this abundant protein also plays a crucial role in other bodily functions including joint health and bone health. ‚ÄúCollagen assists in maintaining the integrity of cartilage, which is essential for healthy joints, and it helps to maintain bone density, which is crucial for preventing age-related bone issues like osteoporosis,‚Äù Dr. Sajic explains. 
If you‚Äôre looking to target these areas of your body, or simply interested in a supplement that provides a cohesive approach, it‚Äôs worth incorporating collagen supplements into your daily wellness routine. 
Also to note, some collagen supplements are infused with additional nutrients that help to nourish the body. ‚ÄúCollagen supplements may also include vitamins like vitamin C, zinc, vitamin B, and omega-3s which further support your body and health,‚Äù Augustine says. 
So, we‚Äôve heard about all the wonderful benefits of collagen but are there any side effects? Dr. Sajic shares that although collagen is generally safe for most individuals, there are a few things to note. ‚ÄúSome may experience side effects like stomach discomfort, a bad taste or possible allergic reactions,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs essential to choose high-quality collagen supplements and consult with a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement regimen,‚Äù he adds.
To avoid allergic reactions, or any added ingredients that might not sit well with your body, Augustine also suggests taking the time to thoroughly read the ingredient labels.  
‚ÄúYou should always talk to your health care provider before taking any oral supplements or medications,‚Äù says Augustine. She also explains that consulting a healthcare professional is especially important if you are taking daily medications or have serious drug or food allergies.
Dr. Sajic shares that those with fish, pork, or bovine allergies should avoid collagen, as many collagen supplements are derived from these animal sources. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs also important to talk to your doctor if you have liver or kidney disease, as the excess protein may put extra stress on these organs,‚Äù he adds. 
Collagen supplements exist in many forms‚Äî including liquid, powder, and capsules‚Äî but they all have relatively equal effects. "There are not enough non-bias studies to suggest that one is better than the other,‚Äù Augustine shares. 
At the end of the day, it simply boils down to your personal preferences, lifestyle, and dietary restrictions. ‚ÄúLiquid collagen can be consumed directly or mixed into beverages, while powder can be added to smoothies, coffee, or baked goods,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. If you would prefer not to mix collagen with your food or drink, you can always take a capsule. However, Dr. Sajic notes that depending on the capsule, it might not be absorbed as efficiently as other forms of collagen. 
‚ÄúFor most people, collagen should be taken once daily,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. ‚ÄúDosage can range from 2.5 to 15 grams daily, depending on the individual‚Äôs age, health, and specific skin or hair concerns.‚Äù And as with anything, patience and consistency is key, so make sure that you keep track of your collagen intake. ‚ÄúIt may take several weeks, if not three to four months, for you to start noticing the benefits of collagen supplements,‚Äù Dr. Sajic adds.

title: Spring 2024 Makeup Trends We Love from Fashion Week
text:
Fresh off the runway. 
It‚Äôs the most wonderful time of the year‚Äîno, it‚Äôs not the holidays (yet); however, it is a fashion holiday: fashion month. And while you may be eyeing the celebs sitting front row or dreaming of your next outfit, the runway is the perfect place to discover what‚Äôs next in beauty. 
This season, the crystal ball, er, runway, proved that even though we‚Äôre not masking up as frequently (rethink that: Covid cases are rising), eyes are a major focus and using color as a way of expression. Skin is in‚Äîwith fresh faces and dewy skin taking priority on the runway. In fact, this season, many skincare brands, prepped models‚Äô skin for the runway. After all, if you want great looking makeup, you must take care of its base: Your face. Brandon Maxwell leaned into a skin-focused beauty look, utilizing Noble Panacea products for a hydrated, fresh glow. 
Do you want to peek into the future to see what‚Äôs in store for 2024? Katie Jane Hughes, celebrity makeup artist and founder of KJH.brand whose clients include Hailey Bieber and Karlie Kloss as well as Kim Baker, celebrity makeup artist and founder of Glamazon Beauty divulge to ELLE.com all top Spring 2024 makeup trends, fresh off the runway!
Graphic liner, floating eyeliner‚Äîwhatever you want to call it, it‚Äôs a vibe and you will see it all Spring/Summer 2024. This graphic liner look on Paloma Elsesser at Eckhaus Latta gives a butterfly wing effect and plays up her high cheekbones. 
‚ÄúI love how a graphic eye can be an accessory to your look,‚Äù shares Katie Jane Hughes in response to the Jil Sander show at Milan Fashion Week.
Celebrity makeup artist and Lanc√¥me Global International Makeup Artist Sheika Dailey took us to the year 3000 with this futuristic cat eye. Playing with negative space and floating lines in the inner eye, ups the sex appeal of this sultry look. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs editorial yet still super wearable and sexy,‚Äù says Hughes. You can read more about the look, here.
‚ÄúI predict that the Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 makeup trends are going to be all about vibrant, bold, color eyeliners,‚Äù shares Glamazon Beauty founder and celebrity makeup artist Kim Baker. Curious as to which colors? Baker says, ‚ÄúEyeliner in bold over the top shades such as Periwinkle, royal blue, vibrant red, and shocking pink‚Äù will be all over the lids of trendsetters and beauty girlies next spring.
Hughes also agrees that color eyeliner is a big Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 trend. ‚ÄúI love how they matched the eye look to the fashion at Helmut Lang,‚Äù says Hughes. ‚ÄúIn 2024, the vibrant color lined eye will dominate the street and our makeup bag,‚Äù adds Baker.
Don‚Äôt have colored eyeliner? You can fake it with eyeshadow. ‚ÄúWe saw royal blue being used at shows such as Altier Ndigo. Makeup artist T. Cooper used the shade ‚ÄòOshun‚Äô featured in the Supreme Being Palette by Glamazon Beauty to create a killer eye look that works for runway to real-way,‚Äù says Baker.
For Spring/Summer ‚Äô24, imperfection is perfection. And while we normally see this trend with the hair, this season, it‚Äôs visible with makeup in a bold, bright way. The mismatched eyeshadow seen at Chopova Lowena was a favorite for Hughes. She shares, ‚ÄúI think this is a really cool and fresh take on how to do eyeshadow that is unusual and out of the box.‚Äù
At Phillip Lim 3.1, this neon, one shadow look plays up negative space in opposite accords.
‚ÄúThe look I kept seeing across the board was glowing skin. Everyone had dewy, glowing skin and I can‚Äôt think of a better feature to play up for Spring and Summer,‚Äù says Baker. At Retrofete, it was all about sexy, glowy, and hydrated skin. Elyse Reneau, Executive Director of Global Beauty at Too Faced states, ‚ÄúHumidity has never looked so sculpted!‚Äù 
At Altuzurra, celebrity makeup artist Diane Kendal showcased her famous ‚Äúflawless face‚Äù technique that she developed early in her career. It focuses on making skin look as radiant and perfect as possible, using minimal makeup.
Mermaidcore gets an update for Spring/Summer ‚Äô24. At Sandy Liang, rhinestones were placed haphazardly around the eyes to mimic barnacles. Into this look? You can read our full take on it, here.
Mermaidcore is more than just rhinestones and shades of blue and green. Jason Wu‚Äôs interpretation highlights healthy skin. ‚ÄúInspired by Jason‚Äôs vision of experiencing rebirth after a shipwreck, we crafted a cohesive makeup look that exuded a dewy, aquatic allure,‚Äù shares Kendal, who was the Lead Makeup Artist. Wu‚Äôs Kindness For Your Lips Lip Oil was applied on the high cheekbones for a luminous glow.
If a sensual siren decided to attend a rave, this look is how I envision their makeup. The amalgamation of blue, green, and yellow mimics underwater coral reefs and is a festival of color for the eyes. Somewhere, somehow, I think Ariel would approve. 
Danielle James is the Digital Beauty Director of ELLE.com. Previously, she was the Fashion and Beauty Director of HelloBeautiful.com and MadameNoire.com. She‚Äôs written for The Cut, InStyle, Allure, The Business of Fashion, Nylon, Essence, Good Housekeeping, and more. She enjoys sailing, thrifting, Japanese whiskey, Naomi Campbell‚Äôs runway walk, and Rihanna in the comment section.
