title: Virgo Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(August 23 - September 22)
Sweet stability at last! October will be eventful, but it still holds plenty of opportunities to get settled and centered. Prune your plans and prioritize your options. Focus on one or two key items, especially during the first three weeks while the Sun is in Libra and your sensible second house. Better to do less but do it well!
As a Virgo, you like feeling that you‚Äôre making progress toward a goal, even if your process is all over the map. That hasn‚Äôt been easy for the past couple months, which were wildly unpredictable for you. First, creative Venus was retrograde for six weeks starting July 22, making your mind foggy and your load too burdensome. Then your ruler, Mercury, joined the retrograde brigade, back-spining for nearly the entire Virgo season, from August 23 to September 15. Talk about a buzzkill! One Virgo friend of ours wisely took the month off to travel through Europe. Well-timed indeed.
Now, after feeling a bit like a helium balloon with the air let out of it, you can get yourself grounded. Or at least, begin the process. Because, as we hinted, October has a few more plot twists in store. Two, to be exact: a solar eclipse on October 14 and a lunar eclipse on October 28.
The first one is in Libra, which could bring new revenue streams and moneymaking opportunities. If you need to ground yourself with regular routines and healthy habits, this October 14 eclipse gives you a giant boost. The October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse touches down in your ninth house of travel, study and personal growth. It‚Äôs the grand/finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled over the Taurus/Scorpio axis for the past two years, revolutionizing your approach to communication, learning and social connections.¬†
While Libra season will keep you busy and productive, your social life picks up speed on October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your interactive third house. With energizer Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, a fun and flirty fall awaits. Step away from your duties and go mingle with kindred spirits and fellow innovators. Exchanging ideas (and contact info) will do more for you now than being chained to your workspace.
RSVP ‚Äúyes‚Äù to that Halloween party, especially if there‚Äôs a networking component. With the moon in Gemini and your career corner on October 31, mixing business with pleasure‚Äîand costumes!‚Äîcould put some extra goodies in your basket.
Productivity returns! We‚Äôre in the fourth quarter of 2024, meaning it‚Äôs time to make a plan. Music to your Virgo ears! With the Sun in Libra and your sensible, sensual second house, the stage is set for you to get ‚Äòer done. Unleash your inner project manager, and you‚Äôll soon feel back on track.¬†
Normally, you‚Äôre on top of your game every fall. But thanks to Mercury‚Äôs long retrograde in your sign from August 23 to September 15, motivation and focus went MIA. Don‚Äôt worry if you‚Äôre making up for lost time. You can accomplish a lot now‚ÄîAND treat yourself to a few luxe rewards along the way.¬†
This year, you get a bonus bottom-line boost from energetic Mars, which is making its biennial blaze through Libra until October 12. As the red planet revs up your revenue, a project or plan could heat up fast. Be careful what you wish for, Virgo. You could end up with your hands in many different pots (of gold, but still‚Ä¶) or juggling an accelerated schedule. Be extra discerning about what you take on. Before you say yes, make sure it‚Äôs both profitable AND pleasurable for you!
You normally keep a level head, Virgo, but even your even-keeled sign can lose it from time to time. Make an extra effort to hold your fire on October 8 if you can. That day, a volatile square forms between hotheaded Mars in your security-seeking second house and intense Pluto in your dramatic fifth.
One part of you wants to stir the pot just to see if you can get a rise out of someone. Maybe you‚Äôre craving attention or feeling insecure and needing to test whether they care about you. But instead of pushing THEIR sensitive buttons, how about just asking point-blank where you stand? Being overly direct may not work, but taking a back-door approach won‚Äôt either. (And don‚Äôt even THINK about snooping, Virgo.)
Your desire to share your gifts returns with a vengeance on October 10 as transformational Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that began on May 1. For the majority of the retrograde (since June 11), Pluto‚Äôs been reverse-commuting through Capricorn and your fifth house of creativity, passion and self-expression.¬†
Over the summer, you may have dipped below the radar, hiding your radiance while feeling self-conscious. If you were struck with a bout of stage fright or performance anxiety, Pluto‚Äôs return to forward motion reminds you that you have something meaningful to offer to the world! Instead of worrying about doing it ‚Äúperfectly,‚Äù focus on the lives you‚Äôll improve with your gifts and talents.
A love affair or relationship may have gone through intense cycles during Pluto‚Äôs retrograde. Perhaps an ex surfaced, or you had to work through some old fears and baggage in your current union. That old ‚Äúcome here, now go away‚Äù dance gets exhausting! You deserve a break from that confusion, Virgo, and as Pluto corrects course, clarity returns. Should you cut ties or stick around and work through a difficult dynamic? That answer will soon become clear.
Did someone say abundance? Get ready for some money moves as the October 14 Libra new moon‚Äîa potent solar eclipse‚Äîkicks off a prosperous six-month cycle. This boldfaced eclipse in your second house of financial security could start changing everything from how you make a living to your daily routines. If you‚Äôre thinking of initiating a new regimen, like eating cleaner or going to a sunrise boot camp, this lunar lift is a perfect start date.¬†
This is also the very first Libra eclipse the skies have seen since 2014 to 2016, so you might look back to nearly a decade ago when the eclipses were last in Aries and Libra. That was a powerful time of transformation for your money, investments, intimate partnerships and spirituality, Virgo. And from March 2023 until March 2025, you‚Äôre going through another cosmic cycle that will not only rev up your revenue streams but revolutionize them too.¬†
Got money wounds lingering? This solar eclipse will be opposite healer-feeler Chiron, giving you a chance to dive deep into your past and explore what might still be there. While that won‚Äôt necessarily be comfortable, it‚Äôs important to clear those blocks out of your path. Just because you don‚Äôt acknowledge them doesn‚Äôt mean they don‚Äôt exist! But fear not: You‚Äôll have a couple years of rich and eye-opening experiences that will remind you how powerful you truly are.
Step away from your work and get out among the people again! On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio, heating up your third house of communication and community. Your brilliant ideas could find a solid fan base and an eager audience. Kindred spirits can pop out of the woodwork, and everything will be more enjoyable when you make it interactive rather than isolating yourself.¬†
Got an important message to share? With bold Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, you‚Äôll have the planet-powered confidence and courage to speak your truth. Use all the social media and in-person channels you can to connect with like-minded people. RSVP ‚Äúyes‚Äù to events where you can meet more of them. But pace yourself a little bit as you‚Äôre unlikely to know your limits and could easily overdo it!
No limits! On October 28, the year‚Äôs only Taurus full moon arrives as a partial lunar eclipse, illuminating your expansive and adventurous ninth house. This is an especially big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021.¬†
The way you think, view the world and express yourself have been indelibly impacted by these eclipses. You‚Äôve grown bolder in your expression, more willing to take a chance in business and life. Your adventurous spirit got a chance to flap its wings and fly!
Since the ninth house rules global connections, risk-taking and growth, this lunar eclipse could bring an utterly magical moment in which one of your gambles pays off or a visionary idea springs to life‚Äîand spreads like wildfire. Your hunger for knowledge could be sated by a mind-blowing realization that helps you see a situation from a new perspective. Suddenly everything makes sense.¬†
With worldly Jupiter in Taurus opposing dynamic Mars in your third house of local events today, you might have a real itch to get out of city limits. An opportunity to travel could arise out of the blue. Don‚Äôt overthink it. Two words: Wheels up!
At last! Your long-overdue time to shine is about to be here, Virgo. We‚Äôre gonna come out and say it: You‚Äôve weathered insult to injury the entire summer and into fall, and your love life was one of the casualties. Not only was your ruling planet Mercury retrograde in your sign from August 23 to September 15, but love planet Venus has been in Leo and your foggy, fumbling twelfth house for FOUR months (since June 5)‚Äîwith the audacity to go retrograde from July 22 to September 3.¬†
So‚Ä¶drumroll. On October 8, Venus FINALLY wraps her off-duty summer and enters the realm of Virgo! For one solid month, the love goddess will dance with silk scarves and resume her sultry moves on your behalf. Great ready for an amorous awakening! Freedom is your aphrodisiac this month, so revel in all the admiration that comes your way. And with Venus in your self-empowered first house, you can have a lovingly honest conversation about what you need to feel happy and NOT claustrophobic.
But for the first week of October, you may have to wade through a few lingering insecure and vulnerable moments. And with Mars in Libra and your security-seeking second house until October 12, you could be a bit preoccupied with ‚Äúwhere things are going‚Äù and ticking off the requisite boxes.¬†
Try NOT to give into those concerns too much, Virgo, because from October 12 to November 24, Mars will blaze through Scorpio and your social, interactive third house. You‚Äôre about to lighten up in a huge way. This will make for a flirtatious and festive lead-up to the holidays.
With bold and fiery Mars in your communication zone until November 24, you‚Äôll be quick with a clever quip and a sassy retort. Warning: Mars adds a bite to your communications. This might come in handy when you have to stand up for yourself, but it could burn some bridges if you keep it up 24/7.¬†
Friendships will be lively, but you‚Äôll be clear about who you can stand and who works your nerves. One of those platonic peeps could turn into something more under the spell of impulsive, randy Mars. Don‚Äôt rush to make it more than it is, though. If it‚Äôs a fall fling, let it be just that. There‚Äôs no harm in having a little fun‚Äîand if anyone‚Äôs earned the right to a frisky free ride now, Virgo, it‚Äôs you!
October could be one of your most profitable months of 2023 if you play your hand right. The Sun is in Libra and your second house of work and money until October 23 while motivator Mars is revving up your revenue through October 12. There might be a few aggravating expenses thanks to Mars, but there are twice as many chances to multiply your money-making. Don‚Äôt overthink it: get moving!
With the October 14 Libra solar eclipse delivering fresh-start energy to your finance sector, a new opportunity or income stream could appear. Eclipses bring surprises and this one might come with dollar signs attached. Your efforts could pay off quickly and build up momentum over the next six months.¬†
The October 28 lunar eclipse in Taurus could bring an exciting opportunity to launch a business, publish your work or teach your subject matter expertise at a university or continuing education level. A sudden travel invitation could also arrive that‚Äôs related to sharing your big ideas with the wider world. Keep your suitcase and jetsetting accouterments ready!

Money Days: 3, 13
Luck Days: 2, 11
Off Days: 27, 9, 23

title: Capricorn Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(December 22 - January 19)
The waiting game is coming to an end, Capricorn! This month is filled with gutsy moves and powerful networking opportunities as the Sun travels through the top of your chart, heating up your most public sectors. Not only is the Sun in Libra and your professional tenth house until October 23, but energizer Mars is also making its biennial blaze through this zone until October 12.¬†
Two days later, on October 14, eclipse season begins with a potent solar (new moon) eclipse in Libra and this same ambitious sector. And on October 28, a second eclipse, this one a lunar (full moon) version, beams into your fifth house of fame and self-expression. Lights, camera, Capricorn! Your solo moment is coming. No need to wait for Halloween to put on a show and turn some heads.
The good news rolls in all month, really. On October 10, powerhouse Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that started on May 1, splitting time between Aquarius and Capricorn. Since June 11, Pluto‚Äôs been backsliding through YOUR sign, making it hard for your ideas and personal projects to gain proper traction. That will change as Pluto rockets into direct motion again, rounding out a 16-year, once-in-a-lifetime tour of your sign that ends in 2024.¬†
All four of the other outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde this month, but you might be grateful for a little slowdown to the action. Saturn and Neptune are reversing through Pisces and your third house of communication and ideas. Take your time before unleashing all of your best material on the interwebs, Cap! Jupiter and Uranus are retrograde in Taurus and your passionate fifth house, tempering that eclipse a teensy bit. So maybe you won‚Äôt let it ALL hang out just yet‚Ä¶but start warming up the mic anyhow.
On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio and your eleventh house of groups, teams and networking. Unchain yourself from command central and go circulate! This social season lightens your spirits and attracts like-minded people who could become great collaborators. Get to the Halloween parties and set up those lunches before everyone gets too busy with year-end and holiday mania. You‚Äôve got places to go and people to meet!
Get to work, Capricorn! Your marching orders come direct from the cosmos while the Sun makes methodical steps through Libra and your structured, ambitious tenth house until October 23. As the natural ruler of that realm, Capricorns should truly feel ‚Äúin the zone,‚Äù ready to take last month‚Äôs lofty ideas and plug them into concrete goals.
This year is even more ambitious because you‚Äôve got energizer Mars burning through Libra until October 12, making you resemble every hard-working, hustling Capricorn stereotype. No shame in that, though! The tenth house is the zone of leadership and public image, and with Mars here, you can rise to a new level of prominence.¬†
If you‚Äôre not plotting your meteoric rise at the moment, it‚Äôs still an excellent month to clarify a few ‚Äúpillars‚Äù that you‚Äôd like to focus on achieving for the remainder of 2023. Close your eyes and imagine it‚Äôs New Year‚Äôs Eve: What would you like to say you accomplished and raise a toast to yourself for, Cap? Prioritize THAT and make some bold moves. The October 14 Libra solar eclipse could open a huge portal for your efforts, perhaps one you didn‚Äôt even imagine or anticipate!
Some career chaos could erupt on October 8, when hotheaded Mars, which is in Libra and your professional tenth house until October 12, clashes in a stressful square with powerhouse Pluto in Capricorn. Your own vision could be at odds with the group‚Äôs, or you may lock into a power struggle with a person in a position of authority.¬†
Where are YOU feeling trapped by rules, roles and responsibilities? Your soul might be longing for some freedom of expression, yet crushing demands and deadlines are thwarting that. Instead of having a meltdown (if that‚Äôs avoidable), use this jarring come-to-the-light moment to STOP doing things that sabotage you personally and professionally. Saying no to what doesn‚Äôt work might be the simplest first step. You don‚Äôt have to carry the weight of the whole world, Capricorn!
Your call to greatness gets amplified by transformational powerhouse Pluto, which wakes up from a five-month retrograde on October 10, powering forward in YOUR sign. As karmic Pluto shifts into direct motion, you‚Äôll emerge from the shadows and step back into the spotlight. Didn‚Äôt see that coming, did they?¬†
If you‚Äôve been hiding out or dimming your lights, Pluto‚Äôs course correction turns up the intensity again. A personal project could speed up, especially if you‚Äôve been blocked by a few obstacles or resistant people who seemed to be undermining your efforts. Have you been considering a style revamp or a major life change? The soul-searching you did over the spring and summer could now pay off, inspiring you to make decisive moves.
Ready for a change to your professional path? Ready or not, one could be en route. The October 14 Libra new moon is the perfect day to start something new professionally or to get going on a major goal.¬†
Don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôve got the wind at your back in a major way. Today‚Äôs new moon is also a boldfaced solar eclipse, the first one in Libra and your career zone since 2016. It‚Äôs part of a two-year series that will ripple across the Aries/Libra axis, transforming your personal and professional lives. If you‚Äôve felt polarized between the two, these eclipses, which are occurring between March 2023 and March 2025, can help you become a better-integrated person.¬†
With today‚Äôs new moon sitting opposite healer-feeler Chiron, you may have some deep insights into childhood wounds that you‚Äôre still carrying with regards to your work. Perhaps you‚Äôve avoided pain by immersing yourself in a sense of duty, both at home and the office. Maybe you feel locked into an uber-responsible persona, carrying the weight of the world and your loved ones but never letting yourself have any fun!¬†
Untangling this will be a process, but today‚Äôs eclipse will push you into a place where you‚Äôll consider what happiness and professional fulfillment could look like for the person you‚Äôve become. Stay open: It could be wildly different from anything you‚Äôve done so far.
Levity arrives on October 23, when the Sun shifts gears, moving into Scorpio and your eleventh house of groups, teamwork and technology. Step away from your workspace and go mingle. You‚Äôll accomplish more when you focus on ‚Äúwho you know‚Äù rather than ‚Äúwhat you do.‚Äù¬†
With Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 through November 24, teamwork will be catalyzed. Between now and mid-December, a splashy launch, especially of any digital projects, could grab hold of public attention!
Your passionate side ignites as the October 28 Taurus full moon‚Äîa powerful lunar eclipse‚Äîblooms in your fifth house of self-expression, romance and fame. This once-a-year lunation brings out your full-bodied, perhaps lesser-seen, side.
Today‚Äôs full moon is a big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. You‚Äôve been learning to navigate between head and heart, to figure out when to be the star and when it‚Äôs better to be a team player. With expansive Jupiter in Taurus opposite Mars in Scorpio today, you could feel this stretch even more acutely. Should you dive in with your whole heart or hold back a little and play it cool? That‚Äôs the equation you‚Äôve been working out.
You‚Äôve had a few spotlight moments during these past couple years, Capricorn, and this one is your encore. What passion, talent or message have you not expressed? Leave it all on the dance floor‚Äîthis full moon invites you to put it all out there!
Not that you have to go overboard to turn heads now. You could attract attention, possibly without trying, and la luna invites you to unleash the glamorous or showy parts of your personality. Let that inner performer out to play! One of your new fans could have romantic potential. And if you‚Äôve been giving all your lovin‚Äô to an undeserving person, the lunar eclipse reminds you just how many (interested) fish are swimming in the sea. Onward and upward!
Shake it off, Capricorn! On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your intense, intimate eighth house that began back on June 5. While that might sound like something to hold onto, there‚Äôs a good chance this cycle had its complications. After all, Venus was retrograde from July 22 until September 3, which could have caused major jealousy, mixed messages and suspiciousness to flare.
On October 8, amorous Venus soars into Virgo and your adventurous ninth house until November 8. Ah, now that‚Äôs more like it! Perspective returns and tunnel vision clears up. Venus finds freedom a major turn-on in this part of your chart, so any obsessing will give way to a more balanced view of it all. An attraction to someone of a different culture or background than yours could spark up. For couples, this is a favorable cycle to travel together.
Meantime, energizing Mars is wrapping up a visit to Libra and your career house in the first half of the month, which spans from August 27 to October 12. You could have a LOT going on at work too, which can make it hard to get into that slow and sensual groove. And ‚Äúleaving it at the office‚Äù won‚Äôt be that simple. If the object of your affection happens to be connected to your job, well, that‚Äôs just more midnight oil to burn. You could meet someone through a work-related event in the first couple weeks of the month.
The lightness from Venus will soon be amplified by her dance partner Mars, however. From October 12 to November 24, Mars will blaze a fiery trail through Scorpio and your eleventh house of friendship and casual connections. Your love life gets stoked by hanging out in groups, whether you meet someone through mutual friends or just bring levity back to your relationship through attending a fun event. Sports games, hayrides, Halloween parties: pick your pumpkin patch poison and take a hearty gulp. A strong dose of Vitamin F (Fun) will be the aphrodisiac you didn‚Äôt know you needed quite so badly!
Plain and simple, October could be one of your most successful periods this year. With the Sun and unstoppable Mars both in Libra (the Sun until October 23, Mars through October 12), your tenth house of career and success is ablaze with energy.¬†
Throw in the October 14 Libra new moon‚Äîa scene-stealing solar eclipse‚Äîand opportunity won‚Äôt just come knocking; it‚Äôll barge down your door. It won‚Äôt take ‚Äúno‚Äù for an answer, so sort through your options with care. It‚Äôs not a question of whether you‚Äôll get a great offer, but rather, of which one you‚Äôll accept!
The spotlight comes calling at the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse, a day to step out of the shadows and perform your solo act. A creative project, or just your natural talents, could draw attention and even bring fame. Embrace that celebrity status and give your fans the performance they want!

title: Sagittarius Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(November 22 - December 21)
Get out and circulate with your people, Sagittarius! You‚Äôre the maestro of every ceremony, at least for the first three weeks of the month while the Sun is in Libra and your social ‚Äúsuperconnector‚Äù eleventh house. You love playing matchmaker, whether you‚Äôre introducing two compatible colleagues or people you think would be a great romantic pairing.¬†
With energizer Mars also in Libra until October 12, you‚Äôre especially motivated to mix, mingle and become a member of an exciting group. Together, you can go farther faster‚Äîand with your ambitious plans, Sagittarius, it definitely takes a village to pull them off.¬†
Things could happen fast this month because October is eclipse season! On October 14 and 28, two change-making eclipses will light up the skies. Expect the unexpected! The first one, a solar (new moon) eclipse, lands in Libra, adding midmonth momentum to your social network. You could be offered a big opportunity to launch a digital venture, speak at a TEDx conference or join a group of thought leaders. Why NOT you, Sagittarius?
If money‚Äôs been a source of stress this spring and summer, you may rejoice when alchemical Pluto ends a five-month retrograde on October 10. The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde for the whole month of October, giving you some extra space to step back and weigh your decisions, particularly about work, home and your living situation. Take your time to ponder those while freely exploring some new revenue opportunities.
Power down a little starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your twelfth house of closure, rest and healing. But don‚Äôt sink too deep into your down comforter yet. Energizer Mars is in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, which will stoke your imagination and creativity. A bedside journal and morning free-writing sessions could yield some true gems. Be sure to capture them!
On October 28, the lunar (full moon) eclipse in Taurus brings a two-year eclipse series on your health and healing axis to a close. Your body and well-being have demanded your attention since November 2021. There‚Äôs no denying that your relationship to both the physical and spiritual planes has been transformed. If you answered the call, this could be a moment to celebrate!¬†
Take inventory of your habits then and now. Perhaps you went through a medical odyssey, changed your eating habits or completely revamped your routines with supplements or regular exercise. Whatever the case, you‚Äôre graduating from this eclipse period‚Äîwith all of its highs and lows. Here‚Äôs to your continued good health!
But first: candy. This Halloween features a moon in your opposite sign of Gemini, which rules your partnership house. Coordinating costumes, anyone? While that‚Äôs not typically your style, you might have fun sharing some part of the celebration with a friend or plus-one. Dress up as the left and right hemisphere of the brain or pick your pop culture celebrity duo and do a spooky send-up (zombified Taylor Swift and the ghosts of her dating past?). Most important item on the agenda is that you have some well-deserved fun!
Gather with your people, Archer. The Sun is in Libra and your eleventh house of group activity until October 23, a perfect three-week period to network, entertain and collaborate. Although you‚Äôre an independent sign by nature, you need people‚Äîand now is the time to put a few key players in place to support your mission.¬†
With go-getter Mars also in Libra until October 12, you could be cheered and supported by members of your circle. One or two of them could shuttle your ideas onto the fast track, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse.¬†
Mars adds excitement and stress in equal measure, and you may go into ‚Äúpeople overload‚Äù at moments, having almost too much of a good thing. Teamwork does indeed make the dream work this month, but you need to have some literal dreams (as in, a good night‚Äôs sleep!) to keep your energy levels up. There could be a zillion events, conference calls, video chats and parties to rsvp to, so choose selectively. And be sure to log off those social media sites whenever possible, even if your posts keep going viral!
Mars is in ‚Äúdetriment‚Äù‚Äîa weakened position‚Äîin Libra. After all, the planet of war isn‚Äôt terribly comfortable in the sign of peace. It‚Äôs all too easy to overestimate what you can handle (a Sagittarius issue by nature). Better to underpromise and overdeliver than the reverse. Manage people‚Äôs expectations and be sure to delegate! With Mars in this team-centric zone, you could have a power posse of capable collaborators ready to pitch in. Do your part by giving them clear instructions‚Ä¶then letting go and trusting.
Tension over money could spike on October 8, when Mars locks into a heated square with calculating Pluto in your work and money house.¬†
Go-getter Mars is blazing through Libra and your eleventh house of teamwork until October 12, catalyzing your collaborations. While it could be stressful to manage a few outsized egos and personalities, you can still triumphantly bring these people together for a shared victory.¬†
Today, however, it could be challenging to get everyone on the same page. Fights around funding or clashing work styles can culminate in a major ego battle. You may have to step in (or pull yourself out) if things get too heated and volatile. Do you have the confidence to pull off a major project? The answer is yes‚Äîbut you might need to do some internal fortifying before YOU actually believe it.¬†
Lean on your trusted circle and reliable team members to a point, but remember: They‚Äôre not your therapists! Reach out to a coach or trained counselor to do that inner work.
Any controlling or micromanaging tendencies start to clear up on October 10, when calculating Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that began on May 1, splitting its time between two signs. Since June 11, Pluto‚Äôs been reversing through Capricorn and your second house of work and money. Whew!¬†
While the karmic planet reversed through this zone, it may have driven up old fears and limiting beliefs that impacted your bottom line. From power struggles with co-workers to stressful money fluctuations, conditions haven‚Äôt always been favorable for you, Sagittarius. Your confidence may have taken a few hits during this cycle.¬†
Now, as Pluto returns to forward motion, you can regain a sense of power and get back into the financial driver‚Äôs seat. If you‚Äôve been unsure about whether to work with someone or take on a project, Pluto‚Äôs course correction can help you make a clear decision.¬†
Get ready for a spike in your popularity and influence, Sagittarius. On October 14, the year‚Äôs only Libra new moon‚Äîa boldfaced solar eclipse‚Äîbeams into your eleventh house of groups and teams. Is it time to join a new crew or catapult a collaboration to greater heights? No need to work overtime because the eclipse is pouring rocket fuel in your tank.
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016 and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your stardom and your team efforts between March 2023 and March 2025. You‚Äôll learn how to navigate the spotlight as well as delegate to a capable crew.¬†
Sharing power is not always easy for your self-directed sign, to be honest. That‚Äôs why these eclipses are here to teach you important lessons about leadership. You don‚Äôt have to sacrifice your individuality to be part of a group, but that‚Äôs how you‚Äôll learn when it‚Äôs time to compromise a little instead of bottle-necking progress.¬†
Today‚Äôs lunar mission: Start stocking your squad with people qualified to go the distance with you. This is a powerful time for networking, and, since this futuristic house rules technology, you could launch an online venture or viral piece of content. An opportunity to commune with a cutting-edge group could catapult one of your visionary ideas into the stratosphere. Team up for the win!¬†
With this new moon opposing wounded healer Chiron today, old pain around feeling invisible, ignored or ‚Äúless than‚Äù could flare up. Your ego may need some repair work‚Äîor to head to the timeout chair. If you‚Äôre craving recognition or yearning for attention, ask yourself: Why do I want it so badly? Painful as it might be to confront the feelings of abandonment or unworthiness that lie beneath, it‚Äôs time to shed those already. What if your desire to share a message was really in service of sharing your light and spreading joy? That‚Äôs much more of a win-win, Sagittarius, motivated by creativity instead of a feeling of lack.
Power down starting October 23, when the Sun shifts into Scorpio and your twelfth house of rest and endings. For the next four weeks, the Sun‚Äôs low-lit position invites you to slip off the grid as much as possible for self-care and restorative activities.¬†
Shield your field if you step out into a crowd since you‚Äôre susceptible to absorbing everyone‚Äôs energy. Carry a grounding crystal, bring a wingperson and have a ready excuse if you need to depart early and get some shuteye!¬†
With energy planet Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, you‚Äôll definitely need to conserve your resources and get extra rest. You may feel both wired and tired at times. Regulate your nervous system by powering down devices an hour before bedtime, unwinding with a healing sound bath (or bubble bath!) and by nourishing yourself with lots of open calendar space. It may take you longer to bounce back after you exert a lot of energy, so if you work hard, make sure you take twice as much rest as you think you need!
Wellness check! The October 28 Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, illuminating your sixth house of health, fitness and organization. Before you tuck yourself into bed completely, the celestial spotlight beams onto your practices and habits. Are you being as efficient as you could be? Delegating instead of trying to DIY everything?¬†
The sixth house rules helpful people and employees. This full moon can bring a change of the guard on Team Sagittarius. You could hire, fire or meet someone who‚Äôd make a rock star assistant. Is it time for a system overhaul? From a deep decluttering to a purge of apps and subscriptions you don‚Äôt use, it‚Äôs a powerful day to clear your spaces.¬†
Today‚Äôs full moon is an especially big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, revolutionizing your health and healing sectors. Your approach to work, well-being, spirituality and self-care has been radically revamped over the past two years.¬†
How are your stress levels? These eclipse helped you find a middle ground between being micromanaging and being checked out. There were moments when your inner control freak got benched, and other times when you needed to snap out of denial and take action.¬†
Today, this dichotomy is further underscored by your ruler, expansive Jupiter, in Taurus opposing stressful Mars in Scorpio. Rather than bury your head in the sand, it‚Äôs a day to finally delegate to the capable and supportive people on Team Sagittarius. An ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù situation can be solved with a simple plan‚Äîbut you don‚Äôt have to come up with that alone. Where there‚Äôs a will and a willing heart, there‚Äôs a way!
Changing of the guard! For the past four months, romantic Venus has been taking an extended trip through Leo and your expansive, free-spirited ninth house‚Äîthe zodiac zone that Sagittarius rules. Since this is one of your favorite Venus positions, you were probably one of the signs least affected when Venus turned retrograde from July 22 to September 3.
Still, it wasn‚Äôt exactly screaming ‚Äúsummer lovin‚Äô had me a blast,‚Äù Archer. Hopefully you made up for lost time over the past month, with Venus back on track and swaggering through your ninth house of travel, adventure and personal growth. (We spent a chunk of that time eating and greeting our way through Barcelona‚Äîso we hope our fellow Sags made equally good use of the transit!)
Starting October 8, things could take a turn for the serious as Venus moves into Virgo for a month. With the love goddess in your regimented tenth house of long-term goals, you may flip the switch and suddenly want to prioritize some romantic plans before the holidays. Cuffing season could get off to a better-late-than-never start for Archers looking to make things official or strengthen the relationship you‚Äôre already in.
Meanwhile, lusty Mars is powering up your social life as it revs through Libra and your collaborative eleventh house until October 12. For your free-spirited fire sign, this cycle might crank up your needs for independence and autonomy; single Archers might feel like your love life is one grand adventure. The boundary between platonic and passionate could be thin, and things could get romantic with a friend, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. One tiny word of caution: You might not have the self-restraint to think through potential consequences‚Äîbut try to anyway.
On October 12, no-holds-barred Mars moves into your twelfth house of transitions until November 24, decelerating the energy. This temporary slowdown has a silver lining, though: Mars will next move into Sagittarius, cranking up the holiday heat!
Until then, you‚Äôre ready to detoxify and downsize. From hauling junk out of the basement to ousting a faux friend from your inner circle, wrap this season with a clean slate. Easy though! With brash Mars egging you on, you could act in haste. (Once you‚Äôve donated the wedding china from your short-lived first marriage to Goodwill, it‚Äôs gonna be hard to get back.) If you must say goodbye, do it with compassion‚Äîeven if you‚Äôre done for good.¬†
Team efforts are the fastest route to success this month, thanks to the Sun, Mars and an October 14 solar eclipse in Libra and your collaborative eleventh house. There‚Äôs no question you can go ten times as far when you join up with a supportive squad.¬†
Don‚Äôt be afraid to speak up and ask for what you need. With assertive Mars here until October 12, the key is being direct yet diplomatic. This will take extra finesse when working with a team. Err on the side of politeness at all times, Sag. At the October 14 eclipse, you could be invited to join an elite or avant-garde crew, perhaps one with a humanitarian twist. Membership has its privileges indeed!
But don‚Äôt forgot those humble roots‚Äînot that you ever would. The October 28 Taurus full moon, a powerful lunar eclipse, illuminates your sixth house of employees and organization. Delegate, systematize and maybe hire some help. Be sure to thank the supportive people who helps you get where you are today. If someone on Team Sagittarius is no longer a fit, this eclipse could be your cue to amicably part ways and wish each other well.

title: Scorpio Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(October 23 - November 21)
Hang in there, Scorpio. The first three weeks of the month could be a little bumpy‚Äîbut they‚Äôll be easier if you find the courage to surrender instead of clinging to control. Resistance is futile anyhow. With two changemaking eclipses sweeping through the skies on October 14 and 28, this month will pry away anything that no longer serves you. The good news? They‚Äôll clear a space for you to step into something even better and more genuinely suited to the person you‚Äôve become.
Conserve your energy while the Sun is in Libra and your restful, foggy twelfth house through October 23. Energizer Mars is also in Libra until October 12, which could push you to the verge of burnout if you rush to the save and try to extinguish every little fire. You‚Äôll pass through the eye of the needle on October 14, when a Libra solar (new moon) eclipse‚Äîthe first one since 2016‚Äîbrings a moment of spiritual awakening and serendipity. Allow the divine guidance to lead you instead of trying to force an outcome.
On October 10, your ruling planet Pluto will wake up from a five-month retrograde, moving forward in Capricorn and your communication zone. Have you felt ignored, undervalued or misunderstood a lot over the summer? Pick up the mic again, Scorpio. Your words will have more potency, and your genius ideas will be recognized.¬†
Your co-ruler Mars will amplify this Pluto power. From October 12 until November 24, the red planet will blaze through Scorpio for its biennial visit. It‚Äôs as if an inner light was turned on and suddenly the world is responding to your confidence and charisma. Ah, now that‚Äôs more like it!¬†
When the Sun moves into Scorpio on October 23, it will team up with Mars for the next four weeks. You might have moments where you feel outright invincible! But pace yourself just the same. We‚Äôre still waiting for four of the slow-moving outer planets‚ÄîJupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune‚Äîto end their retrogrades, and that won‚Äôt start happening until next month. All of these planets are in parts of your chart related to romance and relationships. Proceed with caution before making anything official.¬†
There‚Äôs even more wisdom to taking it slow with your dynamic duos. Eclipses come in pairs, and the second one is on October 28 in Taurus, your opposite sign. It‚Äôs the grand finale of a Taurus/Scorpio eclipse series that began November 2021. Over the past two years, these eclipses have revolutionized your approach to both personal identity and relationships. You‚Äôve stepped into new roles and shed connections that aren‚Äôt a fit. Now it‚Äôs graduation day!
Take a little break, Scorpio. The Sun is in savasana until October 23, journeying through Libra and your twelfth house of rest, closure and healing. Slip off the radar for the first three weeks of the month‚Äîas much as you possibly can‚Äîand prioritize activities that replenish your mental, emotional and spiritual tanks. From meditating and spending time in nature (especially near water) to dancing and listening to music: Choose your escape route and float away!
But note to Scorpios: Powering down won‚Äôt be easy with energizer Mars in Libra, disrupting this normally Zen zone until October 12. Mars is in ‚Äúdetriment‚Äù here, its least comfortable sign to visit. It makes sense: Mars is the warrior planet and Libra is the sign of peace. As a result, the uneasy combo can make it hard to chill out. People will be passive-aggressive, even whiny, and you might find yourself tossing and turning over stressful thoughts.¬†
On October 12 Mars will move into Scorpio until November 24, amping you up even more. Put in extra measures to power down at night, enforcing a strict ‚Äúdevices and lights off‚Äù deadline and having supportive people (whether friends, therapists or healers) lined up if you‚Äôre processing any heavy emotions or confronting some grief that you pushed aside.¬†
With a solar eclipse in Libra stirring up old wounds midmonth, you might as well surrender: This is your chance to heal and deal. Silver lining? By the time Scorpio season rolls around, you‚Äôll have gotten a lot of the heavy-duty emotions out of your system!
Watch your words on October 8, when your co-rulers, penetrating Pluto and combative Mars, lock into a heated square. With Pluto in your communication sector and Mars in your twelfth house of hidden agendas, this day could crank up the gossip mill and bring passive-aggressive people out of left field.¬†
Evade the shade by knowing that people are likely to lure you into drama‚Äîand it‚Äôs your job to not take that bait! Be careful not to push anyone‚Äôs buttons or prey on their sensitive spots, even unintentionally. Stick to neutral topics and save the conflict-resolution efforts for another day.
Clear your throat and speak, Scorpio! On October 10, transformational and karmic Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde, which began May 1 in Aquarius and your fourth house of home and family. Since June 11, Pluto‚Äôs been reversing through Capricorn and your third house of expression, community and media. Messages may have gotten scrambled‚Äîor totally lost‚Äîduring this retrograde. You‚Äôve been pushed to do a LOT of thinking about how you articulate ideas and engage with others.
Communication has been an ongoing issue for you to transform and improve for the past few years as Pluto makes its lengthy, once-in-a-lifetime journey through Capricorn from 2008 to 2024. You‚Äôve already learned HUGE lessons about how to interact impactfully with others and when to trust someone enough to forge a friendship or creative collaboration.¬†
Since summer, many Scorpios have struggled to get their point across‚Äîand Mercury‚Äôs recent retrograde from August 23 to September 15 didn‚Äôt help! Old fears, some driven by shame and anxiety, may have created blocks in key relationships. As Pluto corrects course, you‚Äôll be better able to smooth out dicey dynamics. And during this psyche-probing October, you can get down to the root cause, which will help you make lasting change.
The October 14 Libra new moon‚Äîa potent solar eclipse‚Äîsweeps into your twelfth house of healing, closure and fantasy. On the positive side, this can be a beautiful moment for creativity and spirituality. It can also abruptly shut one door and catapult you through another. Eclipses can deliver swift changes that don‚Äôt leave us much time to react. Clinging onto something that‚Äôs past its prime will be futile.
Have you been holding a grudge that‚Äôs eating at YOU? This new moon eclipse invites you to commence any necessary forgiveness or amends-making process. Trade that resentment for radical acceptance. You can‚Äôt change the past, but you CAN make better choices for the future. Protect your own boundaries and let yourself be vulnerable and open again.¬†
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your health and healing sectors between March 2023 and March 2025.¬†
This new moon is also opposite healer-feeler Chiron. A spiritual or artistic endeavor gets a boost from these moonbeams, and projects you begin now will blossom in the coming six months. Your efforts to release an emotional block may feel painful or laborious now, but by next spring, any hard inner work you do will also pay dividends in the form of more serenity. Take the first steps to reclaim your equilibrium.
Great news: Scorpio season shifts into gear on October 23, flipping the lights back on. After an intense and internally focused month, it‚Äôs time for some action! Pace yourself because even as your confidence and can-do spirit return, you could easily over do it. Prioritize passion projects for the next four weeks while your solo endeavors get a special hit of solar power.
With Mars blazing through Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, your powers of persuasion will be unstoppable! No more burying your head in the sand and ignoring your deepest personal desires. Put your most cherished dreams on the front burner, whether that‚Äôs starting your own business or committing to a personal goal. Do what Scorpios do best: Radar in on what you want and block out all distractions.
On October 28, the year‚Äôs only Taurus full moon, a partial lunar eclipse, will catalyze your seventh house of committed partnerships. A budding connection, either romantic or business, could turn official at lightning speed. On the other hand, a contract or collaboration might end, or it could turn in an unexpected new direction. If any relationship in your life could use some revolutionizing, this full moon eclipse is make sure that happens!
Eclipses, especially lunar ones, can abruptly turn the tides, whether you want that to happen or not. Today‚Äôs full moon is a big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. Your relationships AND your personal growth have both soared into new dimensions over the past couple years. And if you took the ‚Äúmoon medicine,‚Äù you should know thyself like never before.¬†
The eclipses also helped you reshuffle the balance between ‚Äúme‚Äù and ‚Äúwe,‚Äù teaching you when you needed individuate and when it was better to partner up. With Mars in Scorpio opposing expansive Jupiter in Taurus today, you may feel the dichotomy even more acutely. Where are you giving too much at the expense of your own needs? Where might you be acting selfishly instead of collaborating and sharing power? Take one last deeply honest look at this today, Scorpio.
How about a little lightness back in your love life? That starts to happen as October rolls on, and not a moment too soon.
On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your tenth house of long-term goals that began back on June 5. While there were some opportunities to get on the same page about the future, there were also a few interruptions. Venus was in a tricky retrograde cycle from July 22 until September 3, disrupting your summer flow.¬†
Meanwhile, Mars has been in Libra and your foggy, low-energy twelfth house since August 27, dragging its heels through this realm until October 12. On the plus side, this is the realm of fantasy, and you may have had a few sexy encounters. However, they may have come with a side of mixed messages or uncertainty, layered with angst around which direction to take.¬†
If you were able to find your center through the cacophony, you might have had a major breakthrough in the past month, especially since Venus turned direct. One Scorpio we know got engaged after a relatively short courtship. ‚ÄúWhen you know, you know,‚Äù he assured us.
Whatever the case, any mishaps or misgivings all start coming out in the wash starting October 8. That day, Venus moves into Virgo and your indie-spirited eleventh house until November 8. If you‚Äôre not happily hooked up, you may feel more experimental about dating, perhaps considering a long-distance or open relationship or seeing multiple people more or less simultaneously.
This is a great cycle for getting out and hanging with friends and not being so serious about love. You may be hard to pin down‚Äîif one can even find you‚Äîand attracted to people who think outside the box and aren‚Äôt afraid to pursue their grandest visions. If you‚Äôre in a relationship (or trying to be), Venus in Virgo gives you the courage to be more playfully authentic about your desires.¬†
But things really blast off on October 12, when red-hot Mars blazes into Scorpio, cranking up the heat, passion and your famously magnetic sex appeal. Carpe diem! This passionate planet only visits your sign every two years, and you‚Äôll have its energizing presence at your disposal until November 24. You‚Äôll also have plenty of momentum for a personal project, which could turn into a cult of personality with you at its epicenter. Suddenly, you‚Äôll flip from feeling invisible and irrelevant to the hottest thing in town. Enjoy the wave of confidence and charisma, and ride it through to the holiday season!¬†
Conserve your energy this month, Scorpio, at least for the first two weeks. Energy planet Mars is in Libra and your twelfth house of rest and closure until October 12, alongside the Sun (here until October 23). There‚Äôs also a solar eclipse in Libra on October 14, which could finalize the loose ends of a lingering life chapter. Focus the lion‚Äôs share of your energy on wrapping up any unfinished projects and balancing that out with lots of self-care. If you can slip off for a short sabbatical (even the three-day-weekend kind), do it.¬†
Your motivation will return with a vengeance once Scorpio season begins on October 23. But it could ramp up even sooner as go-getter Mars starts the Scorpio soiree, visiting your sign from October 12 to November 24. Get ready: You‚Äôll bring new meaning to the concept of finishing the year strong!
When the Taurus lunar eclipse ignites your partnership house on October 28, you could ink a deal or team up with a complementary collaborator for an even bigger win. This is a huge moment, as this supercharged full moon is also the final installment in an eclipse series that‚Äôs spent the last two-years traveling over the Taurus/Scorpio axis. It hasn‚Äôt been the easiest time, as it‚Äôs been filled with major growth and important life lessons. But you did it! You rose to the challenge and here you are. Reflect back on the person you‚Äôve become since November 2021, Scorpio, and prepare to be amazed.

title: Pisces Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(February 19 - March 20)
A little privacy, please? For the first three weeks of the month, your introspective side takes hold, pulling you into the depths of your emotions. With the Sun in Libra and your eighth house of intimacy and investments until October 23, you have a narrow focus and could be preoccupied with people and projects that consume your attention. Intensifier Mars is also in Libra until October 12, and on October 14, eclipse season begins with a Libra solar (new moon) eclipse‚Äîthe first of this month‚Äôs changemaking duo.¬†
Eclipses come in pairs, and the October 14 eclipse is the first one to land in Libra since 2016. It‚Äôs part of a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that‚Äôs revolutionizing your approach to money, self-worth and joint ventures. Your most important ties could be revolutionized, and your values and priorities might undergo big shifts.¬†
The second eclipse arrives on October 28, and it‚Äôs a full moon (lunar) eclipse in Taurus. This one will impact your social life and the way you express yourself. As it beams into your third house of communication, you could get long-awaited news or a surprising message. This is the grand finale of an eclipse series that began in November 2021, touching down in Taurus and Scorpio and revolutionizing communication, learning, travel and your role in the community.
Eclipses can bring sudden changes, shifting alliances and curveball news. For that reason, you might be glad that all of the slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and Pluto) are in low-power retrogrades this month. It will give you a chance to process!¬†
The one exception is on October 10, when transformational Pluto corrects course and turns direct (forward) in Capricorn and your eleventh house of friendship and teamwork. If power struggles have disrupted a group dynamic or your social circle‚Äôs gotten shadier than a Bridgerton scandal sheet, the drama will start to die down.¬†
Perspective returns starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your adventurous, optimistic ninth house for a month. Pull yourself out of tunnel vision and go reconnect with the wider world. Make travel plans, follow your natural curiosity about a topic, explore a business startup idea. Let your visionary side out to play now, Pisces.¬†
Dive into those mermaidy depths, Pisces. October always starts out as an intense and introspective time for you as the Sun makes its annual rounds through Libra and your private eighth house until October 22. You‚Äôre not exactly eager to be in the limelight now, especially with energy planet Mars also in Libra until October 12. Swim under the radar as often as you can. This is an excellent time for behind-the-scenes work, intensive research and focused tasks you can do without distraction.
The eighth house rules merging, and this solar cycle can strengthen your bonds with the innermost members of Team Pisces. You don‚Äôt have to isolate yourself or struggle alone‚Äîin fact, please DON‚ÄôT do that. If you‚Äôre grappling with something complex and confounding, reach out for support from trusted people, whether friends or a professional, such as a therapist or energy worker. Real estate, long-term finances and other assets also fall under the eighth-house domain, so use this month to assess your plans and make sure you‚Äôre properly set up for the future.
From investments and shared finances to engagements and pregnancies, the Sun in this perma-linking zone has you evaluating all your closest alliances‚Äîand how far you want to go together. Libra season could spark a strong mind-body-spirit attraction to someone, so keep your antennae up for a sexy soulmate or, if you‚Äôre in a relationship, for ways to deepen your intimacy.¬†
Watch your temper on October 8, when a volatile square forms between Mars and powermonger Pluto, which is in Capricorn and your eleventh house of teamwork and technology. Jealousy could erupt between friends, or a simmering rivalry might reach a meltdown point. Do your best to stay out of the controversy. Attempts to mediate may backfire, so let the drama queens and divas settle their own issues without you!¬†
If you have to protect any legal rights or intellectual property, that‚Äôs a different story. (You‚Äôll still need to stay out of the low-vibe conflict, though.) Call an attorney and handle your strategy on the downlow instead of getting sucked into any interpersonal scuffles. This square could also crank up some sexy tension with a friend or co-worker. Think VERY carefully before crossing that line.
On October 10, karmic powerhouse Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde nap, powering forward in Capricorn and your eleventh house of groups and teams. A stalled collaboration could pick up speed, and you may find group dynamics improving (hooray!), especially if tension has been simmering beneath the surface.¬†
Earlier this year, yous social circle may have gotten an upgrade. Associating with a more mature and ambitious crowd is paying off for you, and Pluto‚Äôs course correction could turn a few of those folks into powerful allies who can open doors.¬†
A mind-body-soul connection could turn into a sizzling fall romance, especially near the October 14 Libra new moon‚Äîa potent solar eclipse‚Äîwhich sends fresh-start signals into your intimate eighth house. The eighth house rules permanent bonds, from marriage to cohabitation to any way you might join your life with another person‚Äôs. Maybe the connection is more of a business spark, but it will ignite with equal fervor at this eclipse.¬†
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your money, intimacy and investments zones between March 2023 and March 2025.¬†
The eighth house rules shared finances and investments, making this a great time to explore ways you can multiply your moolah. The solar eclipse could serve up an opportunity to join forces with a well-connected VIP. Could you merge your superpowers for mutual gain? With healer-feeler Chiron opposite the new moon, you may have to do some deeper inner work to get to the root of any blocks.¬†
Your perspective widens on October 23, when the Sun shifts into Scorpio and your ninth house of adventure, travel and expanded horizons. All that deep reflection of the past month will yield a refreshing wider-angle view of the world.¬†
You could also adopt a traveler‚Äôs mindset closer to home, looking at your current situation in a completely new and exploratory light. Perhaps you‚Äôll sign up for a mind-expanding workshop or teach one yourself. Or maybe you‚Äôll master that foreign language you‚Äôve only flirted with thus far, either in a class or with an app like Duolingo.¬†
The actions you take are less important than your mindset: When it comes to realizing your wildest dreams, think big, Pisces. Got an idea for a business you could launch? Go-getter Mars will also join the Sun in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, making you extra pumped to explore your entrepreneurial side.¬†
On October 28, the year‚Äôs only Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, igniting your third house of communication and community. An idea that‚Äôs been percolating since the corresponding Taurus new moon on May 19 could reach an exciting turning point. Have you been waiting for news or a green light on a project? It could come‚Äîand faster than you expected!¬†
Make sure you‚Äôre camera and microphone ready. Your opinion could be in high demand today. Record a podcast or an Instagram Reel if you‚Äôve got the irrepressible urge to speak out. Stand up and share at the meeting. Take the plunge and be honest with friends instead of saying everything‚Äôs ‚Äúfine.‚Äù
The energy is especially kinetic today because it‚Äôs the grand finale of a two-year eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. You‚Äôve been finding your voice, speaking your truth and clarifying your message ever since. Assertive Mars (in Scorpio) is also opposite outspoken Jupiter (in Taurus) today. You might find that once you open up that can of truth serum, there‚Äôs a whole lot more in there than you expected!
Cosmic cuffing season arrives with serious intention this month! On October 8, Venus will cruise into Virgo and your seventh house of partnership until November 8. If the balance in a key connection feels off-kilter, these next three weeks provide an opening for talking it out and finding a workable compromise.¬†
Single Pisces should lean into your natural gift of gab for attracting someone with LTR potential. Sultry conversation is the best aphrodisiac! Don‚Äôt be surprised if a meeting of the minds quickly turns into a linking of the hearts too.
You may have some lingering tension to clear as Venus finally exits Leo and your stressful sixth house after an extended four-month visit. Since June 5, life has felt mired in the practical more than the magical‚Äînot the preferred ratio for you, Pisces. And to make matters worse, Venus was retrograde in Leo from July 22 to September 3, putting a damper on the sweet summer lovin‚Äô you look forward to every year.¬†
Grrr! Use this new Venus in Virgo monthlong cycle to get back in sync with your closest people‚Äîand yourself‚Äîand to bring balance back to your bonds.
Emotions could still be intense for the first half of October, running the gamut from jealousy and obsessiveness to a passion that‚Äôs burning so strong you can‚Äôt even think about the outcome. That‚Äôs because Mars is wrapping a visit to Libra and your intense, intimate eighth house that began on August 27. With Mars in this heat zone until October 12, lust or anger can override common sense. Make sure to have plenty of healthy outlets to prevent a reactive meltdown and a messy cleanup job.
Your fun-loving side returns on October 12, when the randy red planet relocates to Scorpio and your expansive ninth house until November 24. Mars in this big-picture zone will snap you out of tunnel vision and help you see all the amorous options and adventures that await.¬†
Swim up to the surface, Pisces, and have a look around! With your wanderlust fired up, too many cozy days at home could make you feel claustrophobic. Poke through the travel sites and make some calls, even if the website says the place is fully booked for the holiday season. You might as well get on the waitlist. Under this spontaneous surge, hopping a last-minute flight isn‚Äôt too far out of reach.¬†
And if you can‚Äôt get away, bring the action and adventure close to home. With your vivid imagination, a sexy staycation should be easy to plan‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs for yourself or shared with a playful plus-one.¬†
Invest and inspect! With the Sun in Libra until October 23 and go-getter Mars here through October 12, this is a powerful period to examine your financial and wealth-building efforts through a microscope. Libra rules your laser-focused eighth house, the realm of joint ventures, research and large lump sums.¬†
You‚Äôve got the stamina for those nitty-gritty details‚Äîand you could make a compelling pitch for a shared business endeavor, especially at the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. Get things in order and you could welcome a windfall!
Exciting news could arrive with the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse, which spotlights your communication house and attracts kindred spirits and helpful collaborators. Make your announcement, drop your new product, tell the world what you‚Äôve been up to these past few months!

title: Aquarius Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(January 20 - February 18)
Think big‚Äîno, bigger, Aquarius! October is your most visionary month, when your ambitions are amplified and you feel like everything‚Äôs possible for you. With two game-changing eclipses lighting up the skies on October 14 and October 28, change is happening whether you want it to or not.¬†
Ride the wave. These eclipses could bring an unexpected business opportunity or living situation. Buying a home, moving or a change in your family could be on the agenda at the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse especially. That one is the grand finale of a two-year eclipse series on the Taurus/Scorpio axis that‚Äôs been making major waves in your personal AND professional endeavors. You could close out October with big decisions in both areas.
But for now, there‚Äôs a wide world to explore! The Sun is soaring through Libra and your ninth house of expansion, travel and adventure until October 23, a time when you feel like anything‚Äôs possible‚Äîand hey, why shouldn‚Äôt you? This buoyant starmap is further amped up by energizer Mars, which is making its biennial blast through Libra until October 12.¬†
You could give any motivational speaking guru a run for their ‚Äúidea evangelist‚Äù money with this cosmic lineup, especially near the October 14 Libra new moon solar eclipse. From launching a startup to returning to school to publishing your ideas, this eclipse presses down hard on the ‚Äúshare‚Äù button and inspires you to put yourself out there in a big way.
Whether you realize it or not, your subconscious has been gathering a lot of wisdom and creative capital over the spring and summer. Shadowy Pluto ends a five-month retrograde on October 10 that began in your sign on May 1, then slipped back into Capricorn and your imaginative, healing twelfth house on June 11. You could emerge from this soul-searching period with many gifts to share.¬†
The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) remain retrograde for the whole month, giving you space to ponder matters of money, home and family at a gentler pace. Don‚Äôt rush into decisions if you can help it‚Äîbut know that the eclipses may force your hand despite these cosmic cycles.
Scorpio season sweeps in on October 23 and revs up your ambitious, professional tenth house. With motivator Mars energizing this career corner of your chart from October 12 to November 24, the last quarter of 2023 could be a lucrative one. Why not end the year with a success story, Aquarius?¬†
Halloween could be filled with tricks AND treats thanks to the moon in Gemini and your playful, passionate fifth house. Feel free to make it a spicy night for romance. But watch out for jealous vibes and masked intentions as the moon squares off against Venus in Virgo and your secretive eighth house. Maybe you‚Äôll sneak off with a sexy costumed cutie‚Äîbut screen them for skeletons in the closet and ghosting tendencies before you get swept away.
Spread your wings, Water Bearer! The Sun is blazing through Libra and your expansive ninth house until October 23, giving you a wide-angle view on life and emboldening you to take risks‚Äîcreatively, emotionally and in every way.¬†
For your future-forward sign, who‚Äôs happiest when you have something big to look forward to, Libra season might be one of your favorite times of year. With your mind so open to new possibilities, you‚Äôll be able to take advantage of those spontaneous moments that can lead to new friendships and adventures. Follow your curiosity, Aquarius, and see where it takes you.
Every two years, Mars arrives to ramp up your excitement to triple-exclamation-point levels‚Äîand here it is! Until October 12, the red planet will ride shotgun with el Sol, heating up your enthusiasm even more. If you can slip in a getaway, even for a weekend, this month would be ideal. You want anything but ‚Äúbusiness as usual‚Äù now, making this a stellar time to launch an indie business, sign up for a workshop or class, or to expand your mind by exploring new metaphysical ideas. Shift your perspective on the world and watch yourself attract a whole different set of results.¬†
One day to lay low arrives on October 8, when rash Mars locks into a volatile square with subterranean Pluto. Mars in your outspoken and expansive ninth house can tempt you to make a blunt comment or take a big risk that you haven‚Äôt totally thought through.¬†
With shadowy Pluto playing the blame game, you could be undermined at every turn. Someone may turn your words around on you or punish you for a misstep. You might be pointing fingers instead of taking responsibility for your actions. Catch yourself if you‚Äôre doing that, Aquarius. Where can you take the high road here instead of getting dragged into drama or defensiveness?
Come out of the fog, Aquarius. On October 10, karmic Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde, powering forward in Capricorn and your twelfth house of sacrifice and endings. This could be a bit like a bear rousing from hibernation‚Äîyou don‚Äôt know if he‚Äôll be grumpy and reactive or just groggy enough to seem harmless. Similarly, your own energy could be a bit erratic for the next couple days, especially with an eclipse coming.
Pluto‚Äôs been retrograde since May 1, and the first six weeks of its backspin (until June 11) it was in Aquarius‚Äîa new 20-year phase that we got a sneak preview of in March and April and where it will return to in earnest next year. Until then, you have a few loose ends to wrap up!
Since June 11, Pluto‚Äôs been back-spinning through your zone of healing and closure. Some Aquarians weathered a loss or were plunged into the depths of emotions you might not have wanted to deal with. Perhaps you did some important forgiveness work or faced up to an addictive pattern. If you‚Äôve been forcing an outcome and swimming upstream, Pluto retrograde was a time to STOP pushing an agenda.¬†
The only way to free yourself from suffering is to practice radical acceptance‚Äîto the best of your human ability. That might get easier now with Pluto direct. Other important lessons from the retrograde? Allowing others to support you and for things to unfold in their own time. Now you‚Äôll start to see that tough inner work pay off.¬†
Where would you like to be six months from now? And what horizon-broadening experiences do you want to have between now and then? At the October 14 Libra new moon, start putting plans into action. This new moon, which falls in your visionary and risk-taking ninth house, is also a solar eclipse‚Äîthe first one we‚Äôve seen in Libra since 2016!¬†
Big ideas could turn into reality quickly, so fasten your seat belt. Get some bucket-list goals on the agenda, from launching a startup venture to visiting a dream destination. The ninth house rules travel, study and entrepreneurship. Don‚Äôt limit yourself‚Äîexplore all possibilities during this blue-sky month without holding back!¬†
This eclipse is part of a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your zones of communication, local events and long-distance connections between March 2023 and March 2025. Influential people can enter your life from far away and right down the street in your homegrown community. Keep an open mind (and door) to all possibilities.
Got some emotional repair work to do around your confidence and using your voice? The new moon will also be opposite healer-feeler Chiron in Aries and your communication house. Reminder, Aquarius: You have something important to say, and people want (need) to hear it! Telling your own story can be transformational to someone else who‚Äôs going through a similar struggle now. Share generously‚Äîyou never know who you might touch.¬†
Career becomes your focus starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your tenth house of ambition and professional goals. What would you like to accomplish over the next month, before the holidays kick into high gear?¬†
If excess and hedonism sent your life a bit off the rails over the past three weeks, you can corral things into more of a structure during this disciplined time. Or if you‚Äôve had a million ‚Äúahh-mazing‚Äù ideas, you can now sort the winners from the duds and get to work on building those out.¬†
Go-getter Mars is blazing through Scorpio too from October 12 to November 24. You can make serious strides to the top for the rest of the year. Align yourself with power players and well-connected people or tap a mentor who can show you the ropes and save you from wasting valuable time and energy!
But take a break from being ‚Äúall business‚Äù on October 28 and make time for home, hearth and heartfelt bonds. The annual Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, landing in your domestic and sentimental fourth house. The spotlight is on personal matters, so take a deeper look at your emotions. If you‚Äôre thinking of moving, buying or selling property or expanding your brood, this full moon could set things in motion.
Today‚Äôs full moon is an especially big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. For the past two years, major momentum has come to your living situation and your career. One Aquarius we know moved four times; another was promoted to an executive role, only to be recruited for an even better gig six months later! Yet another Aquarius relocated to a suburb and separated from her partner for a short term, who later moved back in on a part-time basis, and, well, they‚Äôre still figuring it all out.¬†
Such is life with eclipses in these important zones of your chart! You may feel the split between your work and non-work life acutely today because intense Mars in Scorpio is facing off in opposition to expansive Jupiter in Taurus. Demands are coming from all directions, and you might wish you could clone yourself several times over.¬†
But the goal here, Aquarius, is to feel less fragmented and more integrated. Pay attention to the signs the eclipse is sending you instead of trying to control everything with your mind. Allow the universe‚Äîand the people in your world‚Äîto support you! In order for them to do that, you have to open up a little, sink into your heart, and admit that you don‚Äôt have all the answers. Good news: None of us do, so you‚Äôll be in good company with the other 8.1 billion people on this planet.
Partnerships: getting back on track! On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your committed relationship house that began back on June 5. While that sounds like a dream for lovestruck Water Bearers, this fortunate cycle was disrupted for six whole weeks when Venus turned retrograde. From July 22 to September 3, there was static, if not constant disconnection, on the line. While things have been clearing up over the past month, you could still feel some lingering tension.
On October 8, Venus sails into Virgo and your smoldering eighth house until November 8, making for one scintillating and sexy month! Lower the blinds, queue up the slow jams. Your inner siren comes out to play as amorous Venus slips into this erotic zone. Boudoir fun and games are high on your priority list.¬†
Snuggling up in bed is a great place to start, so find room in your calendar for intimate connection. Do little things to get yourself in the mood. Upgrade your lingerie collection, commit to regular yoga practice, meditate each morning to shift into a state that is relaxed, receptive and ready to get close.
That might not happen until October 12, when lusty Mars moves into Scorpio (more on that in a minute). Until then, the randy red planet is burning through your freedom-loving and expansive ninth house, where it‚Äôs been since August 27. You may feel more experimental about dating, perhaps considering a long-distance or open relationship or seeing multiple people more or less simultaneously.
But starting October 12, your tune changes. Mars will move into Scorpio and your tenth house of long-term goals and serious endeavors until November 24. Now, you‚Äôll want to know where things are headed. Where you were okay keeping things in the undefined realm, suddenly, you‚Äôll feel the need to have clarity and direction. Keep in mind that this sudden change could give the other party in your situationship whiplash. Make sure you don‚Äôt start issuing demands and directives out of nowhere!¬†

title: Taylor Swift, Sophie Turner, Blake Lively, and Brittany Mahomes Got Dinner Together
text:
On Saturday night, Taylor Swift, Sophie Turner, Brittany Mahomes, and Blake Lively all headed to Italian restaurant Emilio's Ballato in New York City for dinner together. Swift is longtime friends with Lively and has seemingly been supporting Sophie Turner this past month as she faces divorce proceedings and a custody battle with her ex-partner, Joe Jonas.
Mahomes and Swift appear to have recently become better acquainted since the Eras Tour star attended a Kansas City Chiefs game last weekend. Mahomes is married to the Chiefs' quarterback, Patrick Mahomes, and Swift has reportedly been on a few dates with his teammate Travis Kelce. Swift's appearance at the game at Arrowhead Stadium alongside Kelce's mother cause quite a frenzy amidst Swifties and NFL fans.
For the night out in NYC, Swift wore a spaghetti strap minidress in black with a belt at the waist and a pair of strappy sandal heels. She had a black handbag on a long strap and a pendant around her neck. The Midnights singer swept her hair up into a bun with tendrils around her face and wore her signature red lipstick.
Lively went with more of a layered fall look, wearing a multi-colored pencil skirt by MOTHER. She paired it with a beige crop top and a tweed jacket over her shoulders and had on suede knee-high brown boots.
Turner arrived a bit later in a rich red-brown leather two-piece composed of a mini skirt and long sleeved jacket. She wore it with knee-high black leather boots and carried a small matching purse on a gold chain.
Mahomes wore black leather pants with a white t-shirt and an over-sized jacket made from black and gray leather with white piping, and a pair of black boots.
Swift and Mahomes became friendly at the afterparty for the game last weekend, and it's rumored Swift will attend the Kansas City Chiefs game against the New York Jets on Sunday night.
