title: Florence Pugh Wears Semi-Sheer Gown With String Bikini Bodice
text:
On Saturday, Florence Pugh attended the The BoF 500 gala in a stunning black Valentino gown made from semi-sheer fabric. The dramatic skirt trailed along the red carpet in a long train while the bodice was composed of minimal fabric, forming a string bikini-style shape around her bust. 
She wore the gown with black platform heels and accessorized with a gold pendant necklace studded with diamonds, her gold septum piercing, and a few rings. The Black Widow actress had her short platinum hair slicked back away from her face with a slight finger wave. Her makeup was a natural palette with pale pink lips and a smokey eye.
Pugh loves Valentino and sultry looks that display her figure. In 2022, she wore another Valentino piece in Rome that caused some controversy because of its see-through top. She told ELLE UK that she likes clothes that show her as she is.
‚ÄúI'm not trying to hide the cellulite on my thigh,‚Äù she stated. ‚ÄúI speak the way I do about my body because I'm not trying to hide the cellulite on my thigh or the squidge in between my arm and my boob: I would much rather lay it all out....I think the scariest thing for me are the instances where people have been upset that I've shown ‚Äòtoo much‚Äô of myself.‚Äù
She added, ‚ÄúWhen everything went down with the Valentino pink dress a year ago, my nipples were on display through a piece of fabric, and it really wound people up...It's the freedom that people are scared of; the fact I'm comfortable and happy. Keeping women down by commenting on their bodies has worked for a very long time.‚Äù
‚ÄúI think we're in this swing now where lots of people are saying, ‚ÄòI don't give a sh-t,‚Äô‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúUnfortunately, we've become so terrified of the human body that we can't even look at my two little cute nipples behind fabric in a way that isn't sexual...We need to keep reminding everybody that there is more than one reason for women's bodies [to exist].‚Äù

text:
Cher's relationship with Alexander ‚ÄúA.E.‚Äù Edwards seems to be heating back up. On December 25, 2022, the musical icon shared a photo on Twitter of a giant diamond ring in a pear shape being held by Edwards, displaying the jewelry box and his flame manicure design.

THERE R NO WORDS,ALEXANDER,A.E pic.twitter.com/TZOYLGVWkv

I posted this cause his nails are so cool pic.twitter.com/aeUOOy4IIE
In May 2023, TMZ reported that the couple broke up weeks before after six months of dating and were never even engaged. Then, in mid-September 2023, they were reported to be exploring their relationship again.
Given all that history, here‚Äôs what is known about Edwards.
Edwards is the VP of A&R at Def Jam Records, and is known for his relationship with model and reality star Amber Rose. He and Rose got together in 2018, and had a son in 2019, who they named Slash Electric Alexander Edwards. They broke up in 2021.
Us Weekly reported on September 18, 2023 that they were exploring reconciliation. ‚ÄúThey had stayed in communication even though they called things off a few months ago,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve reached a point where they want to give things a second try. They‚Äôre not officially back together yet, but they‚Äôre enjoying spending time together again and they make each other happy.‚Äù The pair was photographed out together days before, on September 15.
Then, during Paris Fashion Week, they made several appearances out together in the city. On Friday, September 28, they arrived at the Costes Hotel together in coordinated ensembles. Cher was wearing black leather over a matching satin dress. Edwards sported a black tuxedo jacket, over a white button-down, and he also had platinum locks. That same day they were photographed at the Givenchy show, again coordinated in black.
On Sunday, October 1, they were seen arriving together at the Valentino show, this time with Cher wearing her hair black.
Cher started tweeting about Edwards in November 2022, sharing heart emojis and pics of him to her fans. They were spotted holding hand in Los Angeles that same month. The 77-year-old singer and 37-year-old artist apparently met in September 2022 at Paris Fashion Week.
Alexander‚ô•Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/o8tH1F0Th6

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs 36 & In End He Came after me,Till we met in the middle.He‚Äôs Consistent one ,I‚Äôm The Skittish one. We love each other‚Ä¶. LADIES NEVER GIVE UP,‚Äù she wrote.

Younger men don‚Äôt care if you‚Äôre, you know, funny or outrageous and want to do stupid things and you have a strong personality. I‚Äôm not giving up my personality for anybody.‚Äù
Sources close to the couple told TMZ on May 1, 2023 that Cher and Edwards broke up quietly weeks before. The exact reason wasn‚Äôt disclosed, but the sources revealed they were never actually engaged. Edwards had just gotten Cher a diamond ring for the holidays, and they went along with engagement speculation for fun.

title: Selena Gomez and Hailey Bieber Reportedly Did Not Dine Together at Same Paris Restaurant
text:
A few days ago, Hailey Bieber and Selena Gomez were seen entering and leaving the same restaurant in Paris as the city flooded with celebrities for Fashion Week. Fans of both immediately went wild, speculating on possible interactions between the two. However, TMZ reports that while they both stopped in at L'Avenue, they did not dine together and were even on different floors of the venue. 
To add to the speculation, the model and The Only Murders In the Building star were both seen at the same fashion after-party, which was also attended by Kendall Jenner and Nicola Peltz. Once again, they reportedly did not interact.
Some of the confusion is linked to a viral TikTok insinuating a secret meet up.
Gomez is frequently linked to the Rhode founder even when they have zero contact. She was the on-again-off-again girlfriend of Justin Bieber before they ultimately split in 2018. He married Hailey shortly after. All three parties appear to have long ago moved on, but any hint of interaction or comment is picked apart by their followers as evidence of an ongoing feud.
About six months ago, Gomez's fans targeted Hailey after she posted a TikTok made with Jenner and Justine Skye, in which they're lip-syncing to the words, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not saying she deserves it, but God‚Äôs timing is always right.‚Äù
The TikTok was posted around the same time Gomez was receiving unflattering attention over some paparazzi photos. Hailey has denied the post was related at all, and deleted the TikTok.
‚ÄúI never comment on this type of thing but we were just having a girls' night and did a random TikTok sound for fun,‚Äù she wrote later. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not directed at anyone.‚Äù
Hailey eventually asked Gomez to speak with her fans about the ongoing harassment she was receiving. 
‚ÄúThis isn't what I stand for. No one should have to experience hate or bullying. I've always advocated for kindness and really want this all to stop,‚Äù Gomez said on social media.
Hailey responded with gratitude, saying, ‚ÄúI want to thank Selena for speaking out, as her and I have been discussing the last few weeks how to move past this ongoing narrative between her and I.‚Äù

title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker's Complete Relationship Timeline
text:
Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker have had a very passionate and public relationship and were engaged after less than a year of dating in October 2021. They shared photos from the beach proposal in Montecito, California.
They ended up having quite a few weddings ceremonies, one in las Vegas, one in a Santa Barbara clerk's office to make things legal, and one in Italy. This might all seem fast, but they have actually been friends and neighbors for quite some time. They both have homes in Calabasas but have been in other relationships.
Kardashian has three children with her ex, Scott Disick: Mason, Penelope, and Reign. Barker has two children: Landon and Alabama, with his ex-wife Shanna Moakler, and is the step-dad to Moakler's daughter, Atiana Cecilia De La Hoya. 
In June, Kardashian and Barker announced they were expecting their first child together. 
Here's Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker's complete relationship timeline.
The couple was seen together in Palm Springs at Kris Jenner's home there, sparking rumors they might be dating. People reported in late January that it was official, with a source saying, ‚ÄúThey're in Palm Springs together. They've been dating for about a month or two.‚Äù The source added, ‚ÄúTravis has liked her for a while.‚Äù 
E! reported they went to dinner at Matsuhisa in Los Angeles, and an eyewitness told the publication that ‚Äúthey seem very connected, very close. Travis took her hand, and they giggled as they started having a little thumb war with one another. It was playful and sweet. They were talking constantly and very engaged with one another. It seems like such a natural fit.‚Äù
They spent that Valentine's Day together, according to Page Six. Barker went semi-Instagram official by sharing a photo of a diamond anklet that he gave her on his Instagram Story. Kardashian shared an ode to her new boyfriend on her Instagram Story: ‚ÄúRoses are red / Violets are blue / Garlic bread / Blink-182,‚Äù the poem read.
She later went official-official with a picture of her hand and Barker's entwined. Barker commented ‚Äúüñ§‚Äù on the post. A source told People at the time,‚ÄúKourtney is very happy with Travis. She wanted to confirm their relationship, because it's something positive.‚Äù
In early March, Barker made an appearance on The Drew Barrymore Show. Barrymore asked Barker about dating with kids, and he took the opportunity to praise Kardashian.
‚ÄúUp until now, I would date girls who didn't have kids, and I find it kind of hard because I think they would have trouble understanding, like, ‚ÄòWhy don't you want to go to dinner every night with me? Or why don't you want to see me every night?‚Äô,‚Äù Barker said. ‚ÄúAnd now, I'm spending time with a woman who's a great mom, who's a great friend, and you don't have to worry about any of those things. It just comes natural.‚Äù 
Later in March, they were photographed at UFC 260: Miocic vs. Ngannou 2 fight, alongside friends Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly. 
MGK, Megan Fox, Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian in the house for #UFC260 üôå(@espnmma) pic.twitter.com/8kdRcCmnnP
They took their first family vacation in April, heading to Deer Valley, Utah. Kardashian shared pics featuring Alabama and Atiana on snowmobiles.
Kardashian called Barker her boyfriend for the first time in a TikTok posted by Barker's daughter, Alabama, while playing the viral ‚ÄúPass the Phone‚Äù challenge. 
‚ÄúI'm passing the phone to my boyfriend,‚Äù she said.
Barker also shared content from the vacation, including some videos from the slopes.
They spent that Easter together as well, and Kris Jenner shared pics of the family gathering on Instagram.
‚ÄúHappy Easter, and thank you @callawaygolf #irvingazoff for making our Easter so special!!! üôèüê∞üê£üê•üôè and thank you for the @coreygamble @realtristan13 @travisscott @travisbarker that are already on the golf course!!!!!!! LOL #impatient,‚Äù Jenner captioned the post.
That month, a source told Entertainment Tonight that things had become ‚Äúway more serious.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThis is the happiest Kourtney has been in a while, and her family is thrilled for her,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúKourtney and Travis' kids get along great, and all have the best time together. Kourtney's been trying to keep their relationship as private as she can on social media, but they're both super into each other and cute together.‚Äù
Then Barker got a tattoo reading ‚ÄúKourtney‚Äù on his chest. 
For the reality TV star's 42nd birthday, Barker gave her a huge bouquet.
And on Instagram, he wrote, ‚ÄúI F-CKING LOVE YOU! üñ§ YOU'RE A BLESSING TO THIS WORLD HAPPY BIRTHDAY.‚Äù
They headed back to Utah later that month.
For Mother's Day, Barker gave Kardashian more flowers.
And he got another tattoo of the words ‚ÄúI love you,‚Äù in her handwriting.
Kardashian helped Barker take his first flight since 2008 after surviving a crash 13 years prior. He captioned his post about the flight to Mexico, ‚ÄúWith you anything is possible.‚Äù
They headed to Italy to celebrate.
Shortly after, Kardashian's ex Scott Disick sent an Instagram DM to one of The Kardashian star's ex-boyfriends, Younes Bendjima, saying, ‚ÄúYo is this chick ok!???? Broooo like what is this. In the middle of Italy.‚Äù 
Disick appeared to be jealous of her affection with with her new beau.
The couple went red carpet official at the 2021 MTV VMAs.
On October 17, 2021, Barker proposed to Kardashian on the beach in Montecito, California.
Kardashian and Barker spent the holidays with their family, and she shared some pics with the caption, ‚Äú‚ÄòTwas the night before Christmas.‚Äù
The couple enjoyed a ‚Äúpractice‚Äù wedding in Las Vegas after the Grammys, and she shared photos of her and Barker at a chapel, explaining they were not actually married.
‚ÄúFound these in my camera roll,‚Äù Kardashian wrote. ‚ÄúOnce upon a time in a land far, far away (Las Vegas) at 2am, after an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license). Practice makes perfect.‚Äù
Talk of having kids is on the table. A source speaking to Entertainment Tonight said that the couple is ‚Äúso in love,‚Äù and they are ‚Äúopen to the idea of having children together and growing their family.‚Äù 
It was added that ‚Äútheir families are both supportive of it too and just want them to be happy.‚Äù 
They had another wedding ceremony in May, but this one was legally binding. TMZ broke the news that they were married on Sunday, May 15, in Santa Barbara. They left the scene of the courthouse in a convertible with a ‚ÄúJust Married‚Äù sign attached to its trunk.
People confirmed the news, with a source saying, ‚ÄúThey had to legally get married first ahead of their big Italian wedding, which is happening very soon. All the details are set and the whole family, including all the kids, are very excited.‚Äù
The big ceremony took place in Portofino, Italy, and the event eventually became a special aired on Hulu. 
In June, Barker had a scary and painful health complication and had to be hospitalized for pancreatitis. TMZ wrote he was checked into West Hills hospital, then transferred by ambulance to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
Later, Barker wrote on Instagram Stories, ‚ÄúI went in for an endoscopy Monday feeling great. But After dinner, I developed excruciating pain and have been hospitalized ever since.‚Äù 
He continued, ‚ÄúDuring the endoscopy, I had a very small polyp removed right in a very sensitive area, usually handled by specialists, which unfortunately damaged a critical pancreatic drainage tube. This resulted in severe life threatening pancreatitis.‚Äù
Barker concluded, ‚ÄúI am so very very grateful that with intensive treatment I am currently much better.‚Äù
On Stories, Kardashian wrote, ‚ÄúOh what a scary and emotional week it has been. Our health is everything and sometimes we take for granted how quickly it can change. Travis and I went in for a routine endoscopy together and he ended up with severe, life-threatening pancreatitis.‚Äù
She added, ‚ÄúI am so grateful to God for healing my husband, for all of your prayers for him and for us, for the overwhelming outpouring of love and support. I am so touched and appreciative.‚Äù
She then thanked doctors and nurses at Cedars Sinai for their ‚Äúwonderful care‚Äù of them both, writing, ‚ÄúIt's crazy how sometimes words could never truly express the gratitude or feelings I have inside me.‚Äù 
Kardashian joined Travis Barker as he went on tour with Machine Gun Kelly, and shared some pictures of what it looks like being a ‚Äútour wife.‚Äù
Barker commented on the post, ‚ÄúTour life's better with you,‚Äù with a black heart and devil face emoji for a little emphasis. He later shared some pics of her too.
‚ÄúPractice makes perfect,‚Äù he captioned it.
Which she re-shared, writing, ‚ÄúTime for drum practice.‚Äù
‚ÄúFavorite time of the day,‚Äù Barker commented.
In September, Kardashian told WSJ magazine that she and Barker had decided to pause their fertility treatments when they were planning their wedding. 
‚ÄúWe started an IVF journey, but I stopped. It was a lot,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI took a break to just focus on our wedding and getting married.‚Äù 
Kardashian attended Barker's Coachella set with Blink-182 and original bandmate Tom DeLonge.
‚ÄúMy first @blink182 show!‚Äù Kardashian wrote on a post about the night.
Barker then commented, ‚ÄúYour coming on tour with me.‚Äù
In May, Kardashian shared on the first episode of The Kardashians' third season more about ending IVF. 
‚ÄúWe are officially done with IVF,‚Äù she said in a confessional. ‚ÄúWe would love a baby more than anything, but I just really believe in what God has in store for us. If that‚Äôs a baby, then I believe that it will happen.‚Äù
She said added that her seven frozen eggs from before she started dating Barker ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt survive, [and none of them] made it to an embryo.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe freezing of the eggs isn‚Äôt guaranteed,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI think that that‚Äôs a misunderstanding. People do it thinking that it‚Äôs like a safety net and it‚Äôs not.‚Äù 
She added, ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äôs meant to be... Being happy is most important, and being a good parent to my kids.‚Äù
In June, Kardashian and Barker announced they were expecting a baby by having the POOSH founder hold  up a sign reading, ‚ÄúTravis, I'm pregnant‚Äù at a Blink-182 concert. 
Just one week later, they shared the baby‚Äôs sex with a shot of blue confetti: They are having a boy.
A source told Entertainment Tonight in June, ‚ÄúKourtney and Travis are on cloud nine. This pregnancy is beyond Kourtney's wildest dreams. Kourtney and Travis feel like this is one of the most magical things to happen to them and a complete miracle. They are so thrilled and can't wait to experience this pregnancy together, bring a baby into the world as a unit, and expand and grow their families." 
Kardashian shared some very sexy maternity looks with the caption ‚Äúlost and found.‚Äù 
In September, Barker returned from his Blink-182 tour to join Kardashian at a hospital in Los Angeles, California. The couple were photographed leaving together, but there has been no announcement as to what the issue was. However, the band tweeted about changing tour plans in light of Barker's exodus.

Barker did share images of himself in an airport prayer room as he waited to travel to the U.S. from the U.K.
His ex, Shanna Moakler did comment to TMZ that the children she shares with Barker are ‚Äúsafe and sound.‚Äù
‚ÄúWhen they have to cancel shows, it's a big deal, so I am praying for his immediate family and the baby and Kourtney is safe and okay,‚Äù she added.
At the end of September, Barker and Kardashian celebrate their son‚Äôs upcoming arrival with a Disney-themed baby shower. 
Fans speculated that Barker may have hinted that they plan to name their baby Rocky, as he liked a post on X, formerly known as Twitter, calling the name out as cute.

On October 1, Kourtney shared some shots of one of her Halloween costumes as the ‚ÄúBride of Frankenstein.‚Äù

text:

‚ÄúI would love to invite them,‚Äù she said at the American's Got Talent show finale, which Klum judges.

Klum could have been referring to a number of elaborate costumes she's donned over her many years as a Halloween hostess, but she most likely meant her ‚Äúearthworm‚Äù costume from 2022. She was definitely unrecognizable.
The costume went immediately viral and Klum was applauded for her sense of humor, but she said her team told her it was a ‚Äúcrazy‚Äù idea and tried to discourage it. Thankfully, she could not be stopped.

‚ÄúThe whirlwind that this relationship has started is something that Taylor is familiar with, and Travis is OK with,‚Äù the insider said. ‚ÄúHe wants to get in as much time as possible with her before she embarks on her international tour.‚Äù
They add, ‚ÄúHeidi Klum's Halloween party is a very big option for them to attend, they haven't made it 100 per cent, but since they have made things official in other ways that they have even started a relationship, they are really feeling it all out and they might want to make that night be the night they go, red carpet official.‚Äù

That‚Äôs part of your intense appeal‚Äîto the people who aren‚Äôt content with anything superficial. Between now and October 22, your creative life will be rich. Record every fantastical notion, even if you have zero idea about the practical application just yet.
While Mercury took a long trek through Virgo since July 28‚Äîincluding a befuddling retrograde from August 23 to September 15‚Äîyour team-spirited eleventh house was in its crosshairs. Have you had your fill of people-time yet? Retreat into solitude (at least a few nights a week) and enjoy the contemplative, restful energy of Mercury in the twelfth house. Once the buzzy planet wings into your sign on October 22, you won‚Äôt have many quiet moments. Enjoy a little serenity while you can!
Not that you can go total ‚Äúlone wolf,‚Äù of course. On Sunday, another planet wraps up a prolonged cycle. This time, it‚Äôs convivial Venus who struts into Virgo and your collaborative, experimental eleventh house until November 8. This will be a refreshing change of pace! Since June 5, Venus was parked in Leo, pouring her enchanting energy into your tenth house of career. Despite the rocky retrograde from July 22 to September 3, you may have had some exciting professional developments over the past four months.
Before burnout sets in, add more ‚Äúplay‚Äù to your work-life balance equation. And if you‚Äôre single and searching, take a hard left away from the conventional, Scorpio. With Venus in your delightfully eccentric eleventh house, anyone too ‚Äúvanilla‚Äù will have to wait. Make a policy of NOT judging a book by its cover for the next few weeks. Venus is the image consultant of the skies so make sure you‚Äôre wearing enough of your own personality on your sleeve. Push the envelope with your style‚Äîeven if you have to wait until after office hours to fully unleash.
The eleventh house is the tech sector, and with love goddess Venus logging in, single Scorpios have higher odds of success on dating apps. Group hangs could also yield some hot prospects‚Äîand with the bonus of friends who can verify their references, which is a huge plus for your gun-shy sign. Coupled Scorpios should make a point of mingling outside the house together more often. Where do your respective friend groups overlap? Here‚Äôs your opportunity to form a joint entourage of people you BOTH enjoy‚Äîand fill the fall calendar with dinner parties, dive bar nights and weekend trips en masse.¬†¬†¬†¬†

title: Libra Weekly Horoscope
text:
(September 23 - October 22)
If your birthday season has been off to a slow start, you might want to buckle up this Wednesday, October 4. After two months slogging through Virgo and your transitional twelfth house, social Mercury commences its annual visit to your sign until October 22, energizing you mentally and physically and sparking your creative juices. Genius ideas and opportunities for collaborations come flowing in like magic, but you won‚Äôt have time for small talk. You‚Äôre a Libra on a mission, so set your sights for the finish line and hit the gas.
Are you ready to refresh your personal brand? With the messenger planet whirring in your first house of identity, experiment with new ways of dressing and expressing yourself. This is a particularly rich time to use your language and communication skills, since Mercury rules thought and speech. Don‚Äôt worry about ‚Äúthe party line‚Äù and spare yourself the corporate jargon. Speak from the heart and you‚Äôll have ‚Äôem before you even form the word ‚Äúhello.‚Äù
On Sunday, it‚Äôs your cosmic custodian Venus who is ending the second prolonged transit of this week. After four whole months in Leo and your cerebral, experimental eleventh house, the love planet glides into Virgo until November 8. With your twelfth house of fantasy lit by Venus for four weeks, you won‚Äôt be stuck in your head the way you‚Äôve been since June 5. (And let‚Äôs not even talk about Venus‚Äô libido-numbing retrograde from July 22 to September 3.) In fact, a torrent of bottled-up emotions may come rushing out‚Äîeverything from deep desire to grief. Welcome this release, Libra. Uncomfortable as it may be, it‚Äôs also cleansing and gets you back into feeling like the heart-centered, caring soul you relish being in the world.
Rose-colored glasses may be a favorite accessory for some Libras during this phase. Until November 8, your imagination will run towards the dreamier end of the spectrum. This will be a huge blessing for your creative pursuits and your ability to glimpse the highest potential in any situation. But easy does it when it comes to love. True, there are few things quite so magical as ‚Äúnew relationship energy.‚Äù But in time the dew will evaporate and you‚Äôll have to deal with the very real human standing in front of you. Go ahead and enjoy the luscious liftoff you get from falling into a lover‚Äôs arms. (No one could stop you, anyway.) But wait until you‚Äôve been through a good day and a bad one together before making it Instagram official. People‚Äôs ‚Äúflaws‚Äù might shatter a few romantic illusions. But those edges can actually create some undeniably sexy dynamic tension.
Coupled Libras may feel adrift during this Venus cycle, perhaps due to an unresolved issue you swept under the rug. Instead of ruminating or stewing in resentment, bravely begin a dialogue about the distance you‚Äôre feeling. If you‚Äôre not able to broach the matter without sounding accusatory or confused, consider that your cue to do some private processing first. The underlying issue may have little to do with bae‚Äîand more to do with something you locked in the vault of your childhood memories. See what you can unearth before Venus comes home to Libra on November 8.

title: Capricorn Weekly Horoscope
text:
(December 22 - January 19)
The pumpkin lagers are flowing freely, but starting this Wednesday, October 4, you‚Äôll be on your grind‚Äîand perhaps too busy to partake in happy hours. As astute Mercury stampedes into Libra and your tenth house of professional ambition and success until October 22, your competitive spirit is lit! Visualize yourself mingling with the heavy hitters and then, find your ‚Äúin‚Äù to their elite circles.
Climbing the career ladder involves more than busting your butt on the job. With social Libra ruling your tenth house, you know that it‚Äôs also about who you know‚Äîand how strong your relationships are. If the aforementioned happy hour serves a bonus opportunity to network, by all means pop up with your elevator pitch rehearsed. Since the tenth house is the domain of the divine masculine, men may appear as ‚Äúearth angels‚Äù over the coming few weeks. Reach out to some of the helpful and influential guys in your sphere if you need a boost.
Romantically, you‚Äôll be in wilder and far more playful spirits starting this Sunday, October 8. After four months submerged in Leo and your private eighth house, Venus comes up for air, heading into Virgo and your zone of adventures and optimism. You‚Äôve held a lot in since June 5‚Äîand may have felt locked tighter than an international bank vault while Venus spun retrograde from July 22 to September 3. But starting Sunday, your icy defenses quickly begin to thaw.
Until November 8 (and hopefully after that, too) you‚Äôll enjoy pushing the erotic envelope and expanding your palette. The ninth house rules travel and cross-cultural connections, making it the perfect opportunity to diversify your dating portfolio. You could swoon for someone whose packaging is VERY different from your own. If you‚Äôre single and heading out of town over the next four weeks, pack some alluring eveningwear. You might wind up going on impromptu dates when you‚Äôre done with your day of meetings.
Coupled Capricorns, don‚Äôt go into early hibernation mode just yet. This Venus cycle wants you out, exploring the world as a pair. If you‚Äôre in a relationship, research destinations together, ideally someplace neither of you has been. Even a night in a boutique hotel will do wonders for your mood AND your love life.

title: Sagittarius Weekly Horoscope
text:
(November 22 - December 21)
You‚Äôll have other things on your mind besides ‚Äúwork, work and more work‚Äù starting Wednesday, October 4. That day, messenger Mercury saunters into Libra and your eleventh house of teamwork and technology until October 22. This marks the end of Mercury‚Äôs hyperactive trek through Virgo and your career zone that began on July 28‚Äîan extra-long journey because of a retrograde from August 23 to September 15. Some Archers may have burned the candle at both ends to cover for vacationing colleagues. Now it‚Äôs time to let others come to YOUR aid. With the communication planet buzzing through your community-spirited eleventh house, you can blend work with socializing or get chummier with a few cool coworkers.
Pro tip: When recruiting members for the Sagittarius Dream Team, be slow and selective. For ANY joint ventures to succeed, you need to sync up with the right, qualified people. Mercury can make you quick with the trigger finger but take the time to follow through on background checks and references. And before you set off for world domination together, test the waters with a small-scale project to make sure you click.
But don‚Äôt put the power suit in mothballs just yet. On Sunday, October 8, charming, convivial Venus picks up where Mercury left off, heading into Virgo and your achievement zone until November 8. This shift is a seismic one since it marks the end of Venus‚Äô prolonged passage through Leo and your adventurous, independent ninth house that began way back on June 5. You‚Äôve preferred to be a free-range Sagittarius for the past four months‚Äîor at least a Centaur on a longer leash. And while Venus was retrograde from July 22 to September 3, you may have had to face some uncomfortable truths. But the answer to the question ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs next?‚Äù may have eluded you.
With Venus heading into Virgo on Sunday, you‚Äôll be ready to get your hands back on the wheel. For the coming four weeks, DON‚ÄôT just go with the flow, romantically speaking. That‚Äôs how you wind up in a whisky-tango-foxtrot kind of dance with‚Ä¶wait, what‚Äôs your name, actually? No, you can‚Äôt control EVERY aspect of interpersonal relationships, but you can certainly elevate your standards. Keep them high‚Ä¶and also realistic. If you know that your crush is moving abroad in three months, why even set yourself up for torment?
Already spoken for? This is power couple time. Dress up and circulate as a pair‚Äîworking the room together can be such a turn on! Or beef up the shared savings account by making new investment plans or even launching a business together. What starts as a kitchen-table side hustle (a special offering for the holiday season, perhaps?) could draw a legit income stream over time.

title: Aquarius Weekly Horoscope
text:
(January 20 - February 18)
Free your mind! That‚Äôs not something we have to say to an Aquarius often. But ever since mental Mercury plunged into Virgo and your intense eighth house on July 28, you‚Äôve been especially prone to ruminating. (And let‚Äôs not even talk about the stuck energy of the August 23 to September 15 retrograde‚Ä¶) But this Wednesday, October 4, Mercury moves on to lighthearted Libra, pulling you out of that rut and restoring your optimism.
While problems won‚Äôt evaporate into thin air, your perspective is likely to shift. From now until October 22, you‚Äôll be driven by your sense of humor and adventurous spirit. This is a great time to reconnect with friends in other states or countries. Keep your WhatsApp alerts on because you never know who may ping you out of the blue. Your mind will be hungry for fresh inspiration and information, so sign up for a foreign language class or apply to a certification program that can bump you into a higher pay grade.
Just as Mercury leaves your eighth house, Venus‚Äîthe other planet who‚Äôs pulling out of a protracted passage‚Äîplunges in. On Sunday, October 8, the goddess of love wraps up a four-month tour through Leo and your seventh house of partnerships. That might sound like a heavenly bonus, but since Venus spun retrograde from July 22 to September 3, you may have had your hands full with relationship issues. Your own desire for commitment may have run hot and cold and an ex‚Äôs disruptions didn‚Äôt make things any easier.
With Venus now heading into Virgo from Sunday until November 8, you have a chance to hit the brakes and see who can REALLY go the distance. (And who you actually want to have by your side for that marathon.) It‚Äôs not superficial to care about appearances, Aquarius‚Äîyou like what you like. But looks might take third place to intellect and higher purpose between now and November 8. (Aim for the trifecta of all three and you‚Äôll strike the bull‚Äôs eye.) If you‚Äôre single and searching, circulate among the high-vibes crowd. Virgo is the sign of service and with this cosmic energy ruling your erotic eighth house it‚Äôs no wonder you get all hot for the humanitarian type. No, a meditation circle or activist meetup shouldn‚Äôt be treated like a pick-up joint, but there‚Äôs no reason you can‚Äôt be open to the fringe benefit of meeting someone multi-dimensionally attractive there.
Are you already half of a purpose-driven power couple? With Venus casting her rosy glow over your relationship until November 8, your resistance to permanent bonding could melt away. Open that joint checking account, start house hunting, get engaged. Already did one or all three of those? Scoop a little out of your shared funds and splurge on a sexier bedroom set or maybe a couples retreat somewhere steamy and tropical.¬†

title: Pisces Weekly Horoscope
text:
(February 19 - March 20)
What‚Äôs REALLY going on here, Pisces? Wednesday, October 4 kicks off an exploratory few weeks as curious Mercury deep dives into Libra and your eighth house of secrets, mysteries and intimacy until October 22. It‚Äôs not like you take things at face value, but during this sleuthing span, you won‚Äôt be happy until you get to the bottom of the mystery. You might pursue some kind of metaphysical or esoteric study, like Tarot cards or astrology. Keep your intuition humming along by paying extra-close attention to people‚Äôs vibes and body language and the synchronicities that others write off as coincidence. (Your tuned-in sign knows better!)
With the messenger planet parked in this seductive zone, your magnetism will be dialed up. Bonus points if you do that in a romantic setting, preferably after the sun‚Äôs gone down.
Another call to the couple bubble comes on Sunday, October 8, as sensual Venus vectors into Virgo and your relationship zone until November 8. This shift is a welcome one since Venus has been paddling through your austere sixth house (Leo) since June 5‚Äîan extra-long time due to the July 22 to September 3 retrograde. Since then, you may have felt a bit guarded or more focused on getting grounded and healthy than doing other sorts of things with your body.
The odds of finding your ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù increase exponentially as Venus swings by your seventh house from Sunday until November 8. Old-married types should lighten up about those petty things that make you crazy, like socks on the bedroom floor or dishes in the sink. title: Ella Richards and Lucie de la Falaise Are Fashion (And Rock) Royalty
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The multigenerational style icons on family, style, and staying power. 
On the outskirts of Paris, a studio blooms with bright flowers‚Äîsome real, some faux. Lucie de la Falaise, however, is accoutred in all black. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like a strong fairy,‚Äù the legendary model jokes. Her daughter Ella Richards, the shoot‚Äôs other subject‚Äîin a white bathrobe and house slippers, and the same slick blonde chignon as Mom‚Äîcounters: ‚ÄúIf you are, then I am.‚Äù
That exchange sums up their playful dynamic, the two perpetually in cahoots. When the photographer behind the shoot, Brigitte Niedermair, saw the duo leaving Dior‚Äôs Mumbai show in March sniffing jasmine necklaces, very much in fairy mode, she had the idea to photograph them festooned with blooms, and clad in some of fall‚Äôs most exuberant, lush takes on floral, from designers like Bottega Veneta and Chanel.
Their lighthearted demeanor belies a weighty legacy in both fashion and rock ‚Äôn‚Äô roll. De la Falaise‚Äôs aunt Loulou was a muse to Yves Saint Laurent, and de la Falaise herself worked for the designer, when, at 21, she decided to marry Marlon Richards, the son of Keith Richards. (They‚Äôre still together.) Thus Anita Pallenberg, the late rock goddess and reluctant model who played the villainess in Barbarella, is, in addition to being the subject of the recent documentary Anita, which premiered at the Cannes Film Festival, Ella Richards‚Äôs grandmother.
All of which is to say: Mother and daughter have It Girl-dom practically encoded in their DNA, though de la Falaise and her longtime publicist and later business partner H√©l√®ne Renaud remind me‚Äîwarmly, humbly‚Äîthat I really needn‚Äôt go there again. Yes, those rock-royalty genes are a ‚Äúhuge benefit,‚Äù and the physical resemblances are obvious. But I could take a different tack when writing about them, like when Cat Power covered ‚Äú(I Can‚Äôt Get No) Satisfaction‚Äù and entirely left out the titular chorus (to very satisfying effect, it must be said). Old song, new life.
As for de la Falaise‚Äîwho is based in West Sussex, where the family decamped some two decades ago‚Äîshe‚Äôs relieved to be on the other side of the ‚Äúold-fashioned idea‚Äù that any of us is just one thing. Today, ‚Äúyou can be pretty and have a voice, too,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúand have something on the side.‚Äù You can bloom again and again.
In 2017, she and Renaud launched Lucie de la Falaise Studio, a lifestyle/interior design firm, to spearhead more of the kinds of collaborations they‚Äôve done in the past. In 2016, de la Falaise designed a wicker picnic hamper kitted out with Dior plates, glasses, cutlery, and napkins. And in 2018, for Schiaparelli‚Äôs spring haute couture collection, she dreamed up a series of bags made from raffia, wicker, driftwood, wooden beads, pearls, and upcycled plastic. De la Falaise and Richards demur when asked about upcoming projects‚Äî‚ÄúThat stuff‚Äôs always hush-hush until the last minute,‚Äù Richards says‚Äîbut it‚Äôs something to see them together in the meantime.
Now 50, de la Falaise was in her early twenties and in the midst of her modeling career when she had her daughter, who then was often on set for (and ended up in) her mom‚Äôs shoots. When Richards later accepted her own modeling gigs, for brands like Burberry and Tom Ford, de la Falaise chaperoned her as vigilantly as she‚Äôd been chaperoned herself. Richards says her mom encouraged her to ‚Äúfigure out what you love...try a little bit of everything.‚Äù (Also, her godmother Kate Moss‚Äîwhose agency Richards has signed with‚Äîhas impressed upon her that ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is a full sentence.) 
Based in London, the 27-year-old Richards is a city girl but not a wild child. Clubbing, she says, has ‚Äúnever really been my thing.‚Äù Dinners with friends are so much better. Her closet, bookshelf, and apartment in general are stuffed with heirlooms and hand-me-downs‚Äîincluding Pallenberg‚Äôs clothes (an archive she wants to publicly exhibit) as well as her books. She‚Äôs planning to read a couple of the classics next: Dune, by Frank Herbert, and The Leopard, by Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa‚Äînovels, incidentally, about succession and finding your place in the world order.
Her favorite possessions tend to be secondhand‚Äîincluding a pale pink silk frock that belonged to the model-actress Patti Hansen, her step-grandmother. ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt wait for the day that I would grow into it,‚Äù she says. She loves to look for garments at vintage shops and to browse antiques at online auctions before bedtime. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what excites me these days!‚Äù she admits.
Richards can also be spotted before dawn at the antique stalls in Kempton Park Market, where she has acquired such objets d√©co as a convex mirror framed with mother-of-pearl, and her description of the scene sounds like advice for life in general: ‚ÄúYou [have to] go with a torch and make decisions really quickly,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre buying‚Äîbut you just have to hope that when the sun comes out, you will like it.‚Äù

title: Manolo Blahnik on The Craft Room, His Inspirations, and Designing for ‚ÄòBeautiful Women‚Äô
text:
The legendary shoemaker discusses his latest venture in the digital sphere.
In 2021, Manolo Blahnik introduced a virtual archive on its website where you can freely explore the world of the luxury shoemaker, from the eponymous designer‚Äôs first-ever silhouette to his muses and inspiration throughout the decades. And today, the brand adds a new room‚ÄîThe Craft Room‚Äîwhich showcases the incredible craftsmanship that goes into each covetable pair (including the Carrie Bradshaw-beloved Hangisi). Not only does it offer an unparalleled look into the world of fine shoemaking, with eight separate rooms dedicated to specific parts of the shoemaking journey‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a celebration of all things Manolo, from its custom processes to the signature lace and buckles. 
To properly unveil the new venture, Manolo Blahnik hosted an exclusive trip to its factory in Vigevano, Italy, bringing to life the journey from sketch to shoe. In Milan, ELLE had the privilege of visiting some of Blahnik‚Äôs favorite places, discovered where he finds inspiration for his collections, and even experienced a day in the factory to watch the full construction process and artisans at work firsthand. Below, the veteran founder discusses why he wanted to bring The Craft Room to life digitally, his muses, and more. 
The whole experience is a big thank you to the artisans that I work with in the factories. I work so incredibly closely with all the wonderful artisans, and have done for almost 35 years. Craftsmanship is in their blood, passed down over generations. The Craft Room celebrates their work, and I hope it showcases that I would be nowhere without their magic hands. Also, the fact that it is online means anyone is able to see it from anywhere in the world. How exciting!
For me, everything starts with a sketch. I need to get it on paper first before anything else happens. I communicate through drawing. The next stage is speaking to the artisans in the factories so they can begin to build the shoe. The team there knows exactly what I am thinking, and strives to bring all my creations to life. Even with the most intricate and embellished designs, they are always pushing boundaries to ensure complete perfection and attention to detail. My inspiration comes from anywhere and everywhere! These days, I spend a lot of time in nature, and find I get a lot of inspiration from my surroundings.
My process has not changed at all! The sketch still comes first. I always carry my pens and paper with me so that when inspiration comes, I am always ready. Or else I forget it and the shoe is gone! I have been working with the artisans for so long, it‚Äôs like we have a secret language‚Äîthey feel like family. I am so proud that we have been able to put family first in our business. We are a family that makes beautiful things that we hope make people smile. That‚Äôs the most important thing for me. 
It is extremely important. Once we have decided on the shape and how the shoe will be made, we look into fabric and colors. Sometimes, the fabric and colors are so clear in my mind that the shoe must be made exactly how I envision it. Other times, the shoe needs some experimentation, some trial and error. Some fabrics will work, and others will not. When we see the right fabric and the right color for the right shoe, we know immediately‚Äîit‚Äôs a gut feeling. There is a collective gasp with the artisans!
There is not one type of Manolo muse, so I find it hard to define. Tina Chow was a muse of mine for so long, and I miss her dearly. The same with Anna Piaggi and Isabella Blow. I have so much to thank Diana Vreeland for. All of these women had the most extraordinary style, and that is something all of my muses seem to have in common. I simply love designing for beautiful women who have an enriched life.
We don‚Äôt call it ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù because I feel sustainability is misunderstood. It‚Äôs binary‚Äîyou either are, or you are not. We use the term  ‚Äúresponsibility‚Äù because it is a journey. There is a consistent, continuous, growing roadmap that we are on, looking at how we can improve and move forward. It‚Äôs a more realistic approach. We‚Äôre on that journey. We have a lot to do, but have had great success so far, and we are constantly striving to be better.
This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.

title: I Didn‚Äôt Think This Iconic Serum Could Get Any Better (I Was Wrong)
text:
Sulwhasoo‚Äôs First Care Activating Serum just got another major upgrade.
 When it comes to Korean skin-care brands, I‚Äôve always considered Sulwhasoo the cr√®me de la cr√®me. Its products are known for cutting-edge innovation, cultural heritage, and a luxurious user experience‚Äîall at once. The company traces its roots to 1932, making it one of the oldest and most respected skin-care brands in K-beauty and worldwide, and in 1966, it became the first-ever beauty brand to formulate with ginseng. Since that time, Sulwhasoo has dedicated more than 50 years of research and technology to the ancient herb. So when I learned that the brand had finally added the star ingredient to its iconic First Care Activating Serum‚Äîa product I‚Äôve used and adored for years‚ÄîI couldn‚Äôt wait to give the new formulation a go. Here‚Äôs how the upgraded serum is leveling up my routine. 
Not-so-fun fact about yours truly: I have a chronic condition called Netherton syndrome that weakens my moisture barrier. So I‚Äôm always looking for skin-care products that help address dry patches. I was happy to find that the new formula is even better suited for this challenge. Sulwhasoo‚Äôs hyper-concentrated form of Korean ginseng extract is infused in its Sulwhasoo Master Complex‚Ñ¢ to help strengthen the moisture barrier and boost skin‚Äôs natural abilities to function optimally. Following my usual routine with the product, I applied it on damp skin after cleansing and before moisturizing. After just a few weeks of use, I‚Äôve noticed that my skin isn‚Äôt nearly as stressed or temperamental as usual. My tone appears more even, and my skin‚Äôs texture is visibly smoother. 
I just turned 30 and am starting to notice that my fine lines are getting deeper and my skin isn‚Äôt as firm as it used to be. In comes Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum VI, which utilizes the power of ginseng to address visible signs of aging, including loss of firmness, lack of hydration, and fine lines and wrinkles. As a beauty writer who has tried countless lackluster products that make these same claims, I appreciate that Sulwhasoo has the science to back them up: Its clinical studies showed that the formula improves the look of 10 signs of skin aging within four weeks.*  
And for my part, I‚Äôve definitely noticed that my laugh lines now appear minimized, and the skin around my eyes and jawline looks more taut. Overall, I love how bright and healthy my complexion looks.
Get this: It took more than 26 years of research and development for Sulwhasoo to get this formula to where it is today. Worth the wait, the newest version has been shown to have better absorption and improved skin barrier strengthening properties. And while I‚Äôm not sure how the brand could possibly top this iteration, I bet it will find a way to keep impressing skin-care devotees like me for years to come. 
*Based on an 8-week clinical study on 30 women 39 to 60.

text:

Jackson and Turner-Smith first started dating in 2018 after meeting at Usher‚Äôs 40th birthday party. In December 2019, they got married. The pair welcomed their daughter in April 2020.
The estranged couple was seen out together quite recently, attending J.Crew‚Äôs 40th Anniversary party side by side. They also went out to celebrate Turner-Smith‚Äôs 37th birthday that Saturday. Neither have commented on the divorce yet. This is both Turner-Smith‚Äôs and Jackson‚Äôs first marriage.
In December 2022, Turner-Smith spoke to Bustle about the impact that dating Jackson, who broke out on Dawson‚Äôs Creek, had on her own life. ‚ÄúThe thing is I‚Äôm not actually that famous,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut people have looked at certain elements of my life, and those elements of my life have become subjects of tabloid and gossip.‚Äù 
‚ÄúWhen I came onto the scene I was secretly married and I was secretly pregnant,‚Äù she said of when she first started making tabloid headlines. ‚ÄúAnd that was a story for people. I think a lot of it was because I was married to a white person. And I was married to a white person who has been in the public eye for decades and you know, has been someone that the tabloids like to talk about.‚Äù

title: Stevie Nicks Sent Her Original Rumors Outfit to Mattel to Help Create Her Barbie
text:
The music legend talks getting her own version of the iconic doll, her signature uniform, and her lasting legacy. 
Stevie Nicks is taking this call from her flip phone. The septuagenarian rock icon does have an iPhone, but she mostly uses it to take photos. And lately, the photos have been of her new Barbie‚Äîas in, the just-launched Barbie that Mattel has fashioned in her likeness. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm photographing her everywhere we go. I was photographing her this morning sitting on a pillow looking out at Pittsburgh,‚Äù she tells ELLE.com, calling from her latest tour stop before heading to New York‚Äôs Madison Square Garden on Sunday (where she ultimately unveiled her Barbie). 
Nicks has forged a legendary career for herself as both a member of Fleetwood Mac and a solo artist; she has won Grammys, been inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame twice, sold millions of records worldwide, and inspired generations of musical artists after her. Having her own Barbie was something she ‚Äúnever thought‚Äù would happen. But now that Stevie Barbie (that‚Äôs what she calls her) is here, she can‚Äôt get enough of her. 
‚ÄúI just continued my relationship with this little person. I don‚Äôt even look at her as a doll anymore. She‚Äôs like a real person. She came alive for me.‚Äù Nicks admits she props the doll up for photos as she travels from city to city on her tour, wraps her hair when she goes to bed, and talks to her to cheer herself up. ‚ÄúI just go, ‚ÄòHello, Stevie Barbie, how are you doing today?‚Äô She says to me, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm doing good. How are you doing?‚Äô And that‚Äôs it. I feel a hundred percent better.‚Äù
In Nicks‚Äô signature style, the doll carries a tambourine and wears a breezy black top with cape sleeves and a matching skirt, recreating the look she wears on Fleetwood Mac‚Äôs Rumors album cover. She actually lent the original ensemble‚Äîa French silk chiffon look by Margi Kent and 1977 handmade Italian boots by Di Fabrizio‚Äîto Mattel for reference. ‚ÄúI sent them the boots, which I would never ever let out of my sight before, and the outfit. I said, ‚ÄòThis is it. This is the whole package.‚Äô‚Äù
Looking back at how that now-iconic look materialized, Nicks says, ‚ÄúI went on the road for the first time with Fleetwood Mac in 1976 with just street clothes that I had bought when we joined Fleetwood Mac six months before. I‚Äôd actually had a little money to go out and buy some fun clothes. I got out there, and there was food out there, which there hadn‚Äôt been before, because we were very poor. All of a sudden I gained like 10, 15 pounds, and I didn‚Äôt fit in any of that stuff. When I came home, I had a friend who knew a designer and said, ‚ÄòListen, you need to see Margi, because you need to have, like I said, a uniform.‚Äô‚Äù
So, Nicks sketched up a handkerchief skirt and wraparound blouse with long chiffon sleeves and collaborated with Kent on a design. ‚ÄúThat is what I started wearing on stage, starting at the beginning of 1977, and continued to wear in all different skirt lengths,‚Äù she says. She‚Äôs been wearing it ever since.  
‚ÄúWhen I told Margi Kent, my designer, to make this outfit, I said to her, ‚ÄòI want a uniform, and by the way, I‚Äôm going to probably still be wearing this when I‚Äôm 60.‚Äô Maybe it‚Äôll be a little bigger, but basically this is what I‚Äôm going to wear for the next 50 years. She laughed, so funny, ha-ha. I said, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs not funny. It‚Äôs true.‚Äô‚Äù
Nicks‚Äô Barbie partnership might come as a surprise, but it‚Äôs just another testament to her lasting influence. Forty-two years after her debut solo album Bella Donna (46 after Rumors and 50 after Buckingham Nicks), she continues to inspire not only pop culture as a whole, but notably, the youth. She has performed with Harry Styles and Taylor Swift; Fleetwood Mac‚Äôs ‚ÄúDreams‚Äù went viral on TikTok; some women have likened her 1997 performance of ‚ÄúSilver Springs‚Äù (sung directly to ex and bandmate Lindsey Buckingham) to the Roman Empire; and her history with Fleetwood Mac gained new interest with the TV adaptation of Daisy Jones and the Six (which she has watched at least twice). Nicks shows no sign of slowing down, either. In the midst of her North American tour with Billy Joel, she just announced more show dates through next year.
‚ÄúWhen I look at her [the Stevie Barbie] now, I not only see my younger self ‚Ä¶ But I also see me at the age that I am now, which we‚Äôre not even going to mention that,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI see myself now in her a lot. That also really makes me happy and proud, and it makes me look at her and go, ‚ÄòThis is what we did Barbie. We created a look. We created a persona, we created a character, we created a songwriter. We created what you wanted most.‚Äô‚Äù
In a way, Stevie the doll shows just how far Stevie the person has come. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like we did everything that I wanted to do when I was 27.‚Äù
Nicks was a kid when she got her first and only Barbie doll in 1958, she recalls, but she didn‚Äôt find the toy relatable at the time. ‚ÄúShe was the tall Barbie‚Ä¶and she was in her high heels and her beautiful striped bathing suit with her blonde hair on top of her head. I think I was only 11. It was like, huh, my mom‚Äôs five-foot tall, so even at 11, I‚Äôm going, ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm ever going to be as beautiful and as tall as Barbie.‚Äô I didn‚Äôt quite understand it. I was just too young, honestly. I‚Äôm from a whole ‚Äônother generation.‚Äù Her mother packed away that Barbie, but Nicks hopes to search for it one day when she gets back to Phoenix, where she and her parents lived. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really looking forward to finding her, because I know that I‚Äôm just going to go like, ‚ÄòOh my God, you just didn‚Äôt understand this beautiful Barbie, because you were just too little.‚Äô‚Äù
Like many of us, Nicks watched the Barbie movie and loved it. She even has the Margot Robbie Barbie doll, which was released to promote the film. ‚ÄúI just love Margot Robbie. I‚Äôve also taken thousands of pictures of my Margot Robbie Barbie, who is also my Barbie‚Äôs best friend now, because they sit next to each other all the time and talk in the silence of the night.‚Äù
She calls out some of her favorite scenes, like when Robbie‚Äôs Stereotypical Barbie realizes her feet are flat or when she drives to the real world and realizes Ken is in her car. But she especially loves the scene where Weird Barbie makes Stereotypical Barbie choose between a pink heeled pump or a Birkenstock to learn the secrets of the universe.
As for which shoe she would choose, Nicks firmly responds: ‚ÄúOh, Stevie is not a Birkenstock [person]. Stevie would find a pair of sandals that worked and were really good, but that were really cute and had a little ankle strap and could be a little bit fashionable. Had I been Margot Robbie Barbie, I would‚Äôve had a lot of trouble making that choice too.‚Äù
The Stevie Nicks Music Series Barbie is available at Mattel Shop for $55 starting now. 
Erica Gonzales is the Senior Culture Editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage on TV, movies, music, books, and more. She was previously an editor at HarpersBAZAAR.com. There is a 75 percent chance she's listening to Lorde right now.¬†

title: Madelyn Cline Does Paris Fashion Week Right‚ÄîWith Champagne and Hash Browns
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The actress let ELLE.com in on her getting-ready process ahead of the Rabanne show.  
Next time I attend Paris Fashion Week, remind me to take a page from Madelyn Cline‚Äôs book and do it with the same laid-back enjoyment that the actress emanated ahead of Rabanne‚Äôs spring/summer 2024 show.   
‚ÄúThe environment is best described as chaotic good,‚Äù she tells me from her Paris hotel room, where she‚Äôs preening and primping with one of her best friends, her glam and styling teams, and photographer Jeff Thibodeau, who captured the morning exclusively for ELLE.com.  
When Cline isn‚Äôt styling herself or being dressed by iconic fashion houses, she often works with celebrity stylist Mimi Cuttrell for events and red carpets. ‚ÄúI feel so lucky to work with her,‚Äù Cline says. ‚ÄúShe also helps me pack sometimes, because I‚Äôm a mess.‚Äù She says mess, I say chaotic good. And she‚Äôs no mess at all, to be honest. Today, she‚Äôs well-rested and ready for fashion-fueled madness. In fact, she hasn‚Äôt done much other than chill out since landing in Paris. ‚ÄúI love laying in bed and rotting after traveling.‚Äù
The Outer Banks and Glass Onion star does love the City of Lights, though. Everything about it, she tells me. ‚ÄúParis is so sexy, and the energy during fashion week is perfection.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm so excited for the show,‚Äù Cline adds. ‚ÄúI love Rabanne‚Äôs unconventional use of materials to create almost otherworldly designs...Rabanne, to me, feels very ethereal. Almost fever dreamlike.‚Äù
For the big event, she chose a light pink and purple frock (by Rabanne, naturally). It‚Äôs lacy, semi-sheer in portions, and printed. She exclaims: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen anything like it, and it‚Äôs comfy!‚Äù Accessories were kept to a minimum, allowing the dress to take center stage. 

Instead of dripping in jewels, she wears Fame, a Rabanne fragrance. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very Parisian and it‚Äôs a little incense-y.‚Äù She picks up on its notes of jasmine, like the kind that grew in her backyard as a kid. 
 ‚ÄúWe always start with music and food,‚Äù she says. Cline describes her getting-ready playlist for me, which includes Party Rock Anthem by LMFAO, along with other bangers from Missy Elliot, Dua Lipa, and, of course, the Ken song. As for the food, the menu is ‚Äúchampagne and hash browns.‚Äù Only the finest. 
Despite swirling rumors about her love life as of late, Cline conducts herself like a true girl‚Äôs girl (as evidenced by the hash browns). When I ask what her ideal Parisian date night would entail, she answers: a girl‚Äôs night in. ‚ÄúOr out. Maybe both.‚Äù

title: All About Malcolm McRae, Anya Taylor-Joy‚Äôs Husband
text:
Anya Taylor-Joy has kept her personal life as private as she can manage as her Hollywood profile grows. But ahead of The Queen‚Äôs Gambit actress‚Äôs Saturday Night Live hosting gig in May 2021, Taylor-Joy was photographed making out with musician Malcolm McRae in New York City. The photos sparked dating rumors‚Äîand come after Taylor-Joy spoke about having a partner in her ELLE May 2021 interview.
Taylor-Joy didn‚Äôt initially explicitly confirm that she and McRae are dating, but they didn‚Äôt exactly hide their romantic connection in the city. According to Page Six, the two were seen holding hands and kissing multiple times while walking around the Big Apple.
In September 2021, the two were photographed kissing again, this time in Venice. And in March 2022, Taylor-Joy spoke about her romance with McRae in an interview and made her red carpet debut with him at the Vanity Fair Oscars after party. In July 2022, the two went further, secretly tying the knot, a source told Page Six. The two ultimately made their first award show debut as a couple at the Golden Globes in January 2023.
In September 2023, the Daily Mail reported they would be having their wedding in Italy. Photos came out on Monday, October 2 of the Venice festivities.
Here, all about McRae‚Äôs career and what's known about his relationship with Taylor-Joy.
Per McRae‚Äôs IMDB bio, McRae ‚Äúwas ‚Äòdiscovered‚Äô at the AMTC (talent competition) among 1,100 hopeful actors at age 12, where he won Over All Young Actor, 2006.‚Äù McRae starred in a short film, Brotherly, in 2008 and played Gene Grady in 2020‚Äôs How'dy!.
Music is McRae‚Äôs real focus though. His IMDB bio cites him as playing ‚Äúguitar and piano‚Äù and singing ‚Äúpop, folk, rockabilly, rock and musical theatre.‚Äù On his Instagram, McRae plugs his rock band More‚Äôs music, most recently posting footage of himself playing his song ‚ÄúSettled In‚Äù in April.
More is a two-member group that McRae and Kane Ritchotte (formerly of Portugal The Man) created and that is signed with Warner Records. The band is verified on Spotify and has been together for over three years now. They released the first half of their two-part EP, 1/2, last summer.
In a July 2020 interview with Rain magazine, McRae spoke about his history with Ritchotte and the creation process for 1/2. ‚ÄúThe writing process was a span over three or so years,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúKane and I were doing solo projects individually and had a few songs we had written and recorded separately. We met up and decided it was fun to write together and bring our songs together. So we finished 10 songs over about three years.‚Äù
According to More‚Äôs Spotify bio, McRae came to Los Angeles from the South a few years ago. As the band wrote, ‚ÄúMalcolm had only recently fallen in love with a young woman and followed his foolish heart, dropping everything to move to Los Angeles. Well, his heart was mistaken. The relationship was a disaster. But the music that followed wasn‚Äôt. Within a week of meeting, the two [McRae and Ritchotte] realized that the music they made together transcended what either was doing alone.‚Äù
McRae spoke to American Songwriter 10 months ago about how he worked as a paralegal in Pasadena, California, and wrote song lyrics for ‚ÄúElaborate Attraction‚Äù while at his desk job.
In his Rain interview, McRae spoke more about the inspiration behind ‚ÄúElaborate Attraction‚Äù and how his late father influenced its lyrics. ‚ÄúMy dad was an investment banker,‚Äù McRae said. ‚ÄúHe passed away when I was eighteen, but that song revolves around and is based on some of his life. He studied classics at an Ivy League school and so the reference to Joseph Campbell, that‚Äôs what we took the video from. We wanted it to be an antihero‚Äôs journey. All 17 points of Campbell‚Äôs hero journey‚Ä¶ we wanted to make them super menial tasks with an incredibly small reward for each task. It symbolizes what the song is about which is nature versus nurture.‚Äù McRae‚Äôs brother Keene McRae directed the music video for the single, and its YouTube video has gotten more than 93,000 views.
McRae told Rain that music helped him and Ritchotte get through the coronavirus pandemic mental health-wise. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm grateful for the outlet and you don‚Äôt need many resources to write music, you know?‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf we didn‚Äôt have that in this quarantine, I would be entirely morbidly depressed and unfulfilled. I mean, I don‚Äôt know how anybody‚Äôs survived. I don‚Äôt know how not everybody is writing an album right now.‚Äù
Taylor-Joy and McRae‚Äôs exact timeline is not clear nor has either explicitly confirm they're dating. But the 26-year-old actress spoke to ELLE three days after the Golden Globes, indicating she had a significant other in March 2021 while explaining why she was doing her Zoom interview from her bathroom.
‚ÄúMy partner‚Äôs just come back from work, and he‚Äôs moving around all of his equipment, so this was the safe spot,‚Äù she said. She didn‚Äôt offer any more details on who he is, how long they‚Äôve been together, and didn‚Äôt confirm outright that they were living together.
Taylor-Joy did open up to Vanity Fair earlier this year about a past relationship ending right before she began production on Emma in March 2019, meaning her relationship with McRae is likely more recent.
‚ÄúPrior to filming [Emma] I‚Äôd just had a devastating breakup, and it had challenged everything,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI was just incredibly insecure and very, very unsafe in my own skin.‚Äù Taylor-Joy had been working constantly during that time, immersing herself in the characters she played while not taking the time to learn about who she is.
She could go into an art gallery and recognize the pieces each character she played would like, ‚Äúbut I had no idea what I liked,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI had no clue of what I would choose for myself. I‚Äôm sitting here talking to you, and for the first time, I‚Äôm like, I know what I like. I know what I, as a person, enjoy!‚Ä¶ The whole of 2019 was me becoming a woman, essentially.‚Äù
On July 23, The Sun reported that McRae ‚Äúhas practically moved into [Taylor-Joy‚Äôs] L.A. home.‚Äù
‚ÄúThey are inseparable and spend all of their time together,‚Äù a source close to Taylor-Joy told the outlet. ‚ÄúHer schedule is really hectic because she is so in demand following The Queen‚Äôs Gambit, but he is always there for her.‚Äù
The source added that ‚ÄúMalcolm is practically living with her at her home in L.A. now, and they spend every night together.‚Äù
Taylor-Joy and McRae proved their relationship was still going strong post-Labor Day when the two were photographed kissing in Venice by paparazzi. Taylor-Joy was at the festival to promote her upcoming film Last Night in Soho.
McRae and Taylor-Joy posed side-by-side at Vanity Fair‚Äôs Oscars after-party. Taylor-Joy was dressed in a black sheer Dior corset dress alongside her partner.

Ahead of their Oscars red carpet debut, Taylor-Joy reflected on dating McRae to British Vogue in her cover story with them. ‚ÄúI said to my partner [the musician and actor Malcolm McRae] the other day that he was my hobby,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI see reading as something that I have to do. He loved it because he‚Äôs the same. I‚Äôve finally found someone who will happily sit in silence with me reading. We‚Äôre basically 80 years old and seven at the same time and it works really well.‚Äù
She reflected on being long distance with him, as she owns a house in east London and is regularly traveling for film projects. ‚ÄúYes, it is [hard], but it‚Äôs also kind of great because when you‚Äôre together you‚Äôre really valuing the time that you have. Everyday mundane activities are so full of joy. I love going to the petrol station with him and filling up the car and going to get breakfast.‚Äù
Casual dating just wasn‚Äôt her style either, she added: ‚ÄúI was not a good dater and I‚Äôm quite glad to not be. I hear stories from my friends and I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄôGod, I would suck at that.‚Äô‚Äù 
Taylor-Joy and McRae didn't shy away from showcasing their love for each other during the screening for her film The Northman on April 5 in London. Both dressed chicly, Taylor-Joy and McRae kissed in front of photographers in one of their most public displays of affection yet.
In a subtle sign of their ties to each other, both Taylor-Joy and McRae follow each other on Instagram. Until recently, neither Taylor-Joy nor McRae posted about each other though or liked the other‚Äôs Instagram posts, but Taylor-Joy recently tagged McRae in a photo implying he was at the scene. Then McRae went Instagram official!
On October 20, 2021, McRae shared two shots of he and Taylor-Joy standing in a window‚Äôs reflection, smiling and holding hands. He captioned it, ‚ÄúOof supremely happy.‚Äù
In the photos, Taylor-Joy is wearing a red razor-back tank top with white piping, and a long checkered shirt over it, her blonder hair pushed back with a pair of sunglasses. McRae is in a white t-shirt and black jeans. 
Taylor-Joy was photographed arriving at the Sydney airport in Australia in late June via private jet. As she reached up to brush her hair from her face, a sparkling rock was spotted on her ring finger. Rumors quickly spread that she is engaged to McRae.
A person at the scene said, ‚ÄúShe bounded off the plane and then seemed to flash the ring at her driver before getting in the car. She was either showing off the ring or doing a dance move. Either way, she looked ecstatic.‚Äù
Her plane outfit included matching purple slacks and shirt and she was carrying her new cat, Kitsune, in a backpack with a window for her pet to enjoy the scene.
Taylor-Joy and McRae may secretly be husband and wife. A source told Page Six that the couple quietly got married in an intimate courthouse wedding. On July 18, Taylor-Joy was photographed walking with McRae, wearing her engagement ring on her left ring finger. Neither McRae, Taylor-Joy, or Taylor-Joy's rep have yet to commented on the wedding reports as of July 19.
On Thursday, September 1, Anya Taylor-Joy and Malcolm McCrae enjoyed a little PDA as they walked through the streets of Los Angeles during a heat wave. The couple held hands as they walked, and were photographed embracing and sharing a kiss here and there on their date night in West Hollywood.
Taylor-Joy was wearing a pale pink sundress with a square neckline with flower details down the front for each button. She carried a green sweater over her left hand, which obscured any potential sighting of a wedding or engagement ring. McRae was wearing a vintage green Nascar shirt over khaki pants.  
Taylor-Joy and McRae were seen in Sydney's center for a Saturday night out, leaving popular party spot Frankie's in two stylish ensembles. The actress was wearing a bright purple mini dressed with a leather jacket and lace-up boots. She left her long blonde hair loose down her back, and wore dark red lipstick. By her side, McRae was rocking a grown out shag and a green turtleneck under a blazer with jeans. 
The actress has been filming in Australia since may for the film Furiosa, of which she is the lead. After leaving the night club, they were escorted into a car and headed off.
On Tuesday afternoon, October 18, the couple enjoyed a lunch in Sydney at Mark And Vinny's spaghetti. As they waited for their food to arrive, they couldn't keep their hands off each other, leaning in to steal kisses and hug. At one point, McRae even gave Taylor-Joy's hand a chivalrous kiss in a romantic gesture.
The actress was wearing a vivid with matching lipstick and a pair of white mules with black designs. She covered it in a navy bomber jacket and pair of cat eye sunglasses. McRae was dressed in black jeans, a white t-shirt, and a grey button down over it. 
On Sunday, December 25, Anya Taylor-Joy shared a glimpse of her holiday plans on Instagram, posting pictures of herself in bed with MacRae. 
MacRae was wearing a dark sleeping mask up on his forehead, and Taylor-Joy seemed to be in a fluffy white hat with ear flaps. On closer inspection, it is actually a white cat with gray ears. They both cuddled under the white sheets of their bed, looking sleepy and happy. 
‚ÄúMerry Christmas to all you filthy animals, from our home to yours,‚Äù she wrote in the caption. 
The couple made their award show debut on January 10, posing together at the Golden Globes, where Taylor Joy was a nominee. They showed PDA in front of the photographers.
Taylor-Joy was photographed on Sunday, January 15, with McRae backstage at the 2023 Critics Choice Awards in Los Angeles, held at the Fairmont Century Plaza Hotel. The actress was presenting an award at the ceremony alongside Top Gun: Maverick actor Miles Teller. The couple were photographed sharing an intimate moment before the festivities where McRae appears to be adjusting her necklace.
For the event, Taylor-Joy wore a sheer, nude netted dress over a matching body-suit of opaque fabric and had her long hair piled into a tall knotted updo. She accessorized with diamond jewelry around her neck and one wrist and a pair of sandal heels with a rhinestone strap across her toes. McRae was wearing a traditional suit with an untraditional ribbon cravat under a white button-down shirt.
Taylor-Joy gave her partner a romantic shoutout on her Instagram on Valentine's Day 2023, sharing footage of them kissing, and writing, ‚ÄúMi amor, I'm all yours.‚Äù
Ten days after, the couple was photographed holding hands while out at London's Chiltern Firehouse on February 24, 2023. Taylor-Joy had been in town for the BAFTA Awards that previous weekend.
McRae and Taylor-Joy put their couple style on display and signaled things were on and strong between them when they attended the Tiffany & Co The Landmark store reopening in New York City on April 27, 2023. Taylor-Joy wore a red lace dress while McRae was dressed in a black suit with a black choker.
On Thursday, Taylor-Joy and McRae were seen walking outside a friend's house in Los Angeles. It appeared that the musician was comforting the Queen's Gambit star, wrapping her arms around her and kissing her forehead. The pair arrived at the house with guitars and were accompanied by McRae's bandmate Kane Ritchotte.
Taylor-Joy was wearing a sleeveless white top and an asymmetrical mini skirt and black leather Maison Margiela loafers. 
Taylor-Joy and McRae never specified if they were actually married. Multiple sources close to the couple told the Daily Mail on September 29 that they would be wedding that weekend in Italy in front of 150 guests.
A source said, ‚ÄúAnya and Malcolm are incredibly private and wanted to ensure their wedding was kept away from prying eyes. They both love Italy and always dreamed of tying the knot in a beautiful setting surrounded by their nearest and dearest. There will be no expense spared and their guests are bound to have an incredible time.‚Äù
Taylor-Joy appeared in a beige gown embellished with birds and flowers in photos of her posing on a window balcony. She wore her platinum hair half up, half down with a white veil. Guests included Cara Delevingne, Julia Garner, Nicolas Hoult, and Miles Teller.
Neither Taylor-Joy nor McRae have confirmed news of their wedding themselves or shared official photos yet.
Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.
