title: Bigger Than Botox: The Newest Beauty Game Changer
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Exosome therapy has dermatologists and plastic surgeons rethinking the future of aesthetics.
When Jennifer Levine would visit aquariums as a little girl, she would spend hours watching starfish slowly tumble across the glass. Starfish are naturally intriguing to children, but it was their ability to regrow arms that really fascinated young Jennifer. These days, Levine‚Äîshe grew up to become a leading New York City plastic surgeon‚Äîcan do just about any aesthetic procedure. But it is dermatology‚Äôs newest hot topic, exosome therapy, that reminds her of the starfish she grew up watching, with their magically regenerative bodies. 
Exosomes are nano-size vesicles (sort of like little care packages) that cells excrete to communicate with each other. They are packed with lipids, proteins, and nucleic acids, like messenger RNA. In aesthetics, they are generally sourced from stem cells, specialized cells that have the ability to develop into many other types of cells. Exosomes have been explored in regenerative medicine to repair cartilage and joints, and many doctors now believe exosomes hold promise for regenerating and repairing skin, and even restoring hair growth.
The idea is that when injected or used topically, exosomes might help skin not only look better, but also behave like younger skin on a deep cellular level. As we grow older, our body‚Äôs ability to heal, including its power to produce collagen, decreases. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen that [exosomes] have anti-inflammatory and regenerative properties and signal cells to do things they‚Äôre supposed to do‚Äîlike make more collagen. It leads to an improvement in skin texture, thickness, and quality,‚Äù says Catherine Chang, MD, a plastic and reconstructive surgeon and founder of Priv√© Beverly Hills. Exosomes are not yet FDA approved (in July 2020, the agency issued a consumer alert on them and other stem-cell-derived products), and some experts feel that we‚Äôre years out from FDA approval, but that hasn‚Äôt stopped doctors from dreaming big.
‚ÄúIt could be bigger than Botox, and the Holy Grail in anti aging,‚Äù says Steven H. Williams, MD, president of the American Society of Plastic Surgeons. Compared to bio-stimulatory tools such as Sculptra and radio frequency, which also encourage collagen production, exosome therapy can stimulate growth without creating an injury, or swelling, that requires healing. And in contrast to platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy, its most commonly compared-to cousin, exosomes can contain more growth factors and are somewhat more widely available. The platelets for PRP need to be spun from an individual patient‚Äôs own blood and will contain fewer growth factors as patients age, but exosomes can be derived from plants, animals, or humans, and even from donated blood or fat, and are, in that sense, ageless. 
Anecdotally, Chang and Levine, who both offer exosome therapy topically in their practices, tell me that they and their patients have been blown away by the results. Chang used it herself following a CO2 laser treatment and found that it decreased her redness from seven days to one. One of her patients, who‚Äôd  been trying to regrow her hair for a couple of years, excitedly came in following one exosome session and showed Chang her new hair. Levine has used it on patients to help heal things like stitching wounds, deep skin gashes from running falls in Central Park, and a large bruise from an airport luggage accident. 
It‚Äôs precisely because exosomes can be so powerful that Williams says we need more research on them. Among many other recent studies on exosomes, a review of early preclinical research in the August 2022 Journal of Dermatologic Surgery found that they have promising skin rejuvenation and hair growth effects, but that inconsistency in the ways they are purified, and practical issues with how they are sourced, stored, scaled, and reproduced, are hindering their adoption in the clinical sphere. Jason Diamond, MD, a Beverly Hills plastic surgeon, cautions, ‚ÄúThe biggest factor is making sure that they come from a reputable lab, because there can be contamination and infection risks, and they‚Äôre frankly hard to produce consistently.‚Äù Outside of beauty, there‚Äôs the potential that exosomes could one day be used for delivery of antibiotics or even anticancer agents, he notes. Still, Williams adds that because exosomes affect communication between cells, we need more studies to better understand the likelihood of scenarios in which they could trigger cell signaling problems and result in outcomes like undesired cell replication, cell death, or cancer.
‚ÄúIt also seems that some people are taking advantage of some of the excitement about it to try to get some economic gain, and that‚Äôs not always in the patient‚Äôs best interest,‚Äù he cautions. It‚Äôs easy to find clinics and wellness centers offering exosome therapy at prices varying from $60 to $6,000. But if you don‚Äôt know the right questions to ask, you could be wasting your money (at the very least). For example, Williams explains, fat-derived exosomes are generally the easiest to obtain. But ‚Äúif you‚Äôre trying to use a fat-derived exosome for hair growth, you‚Äôre probably not going to see results, because it‚Äôs a different signaling mechanism: You‚Äôre trying to communicate with a different part of the cell to influence it.‚Äù There are also new skincare serums, purported to contain exosomes. Barbara Sturm has a line of Exoso-metic skincare, with "exosome and growth factor activated ingredients." Celebrity esthetician Angela Caglia's new Cell Fort√© Serum uses a mix of real human-derived exosomes mixed with synthetic exosomes, cytokines, and epidermal growth factors. Caglia tells me that since developing the serum, her hyperpigmentation has cleared much faster, and her skin has been brighter than she's ever seen it. 
Many dermatologists have heard of exosome therapy from conferences and studies‚Äî and like many skin innovations, it‚Äôs been available in South Korea for a few years. Young Woo Ro, MD, founder of the renowned Oracle dermatology clinic in Seoul, tells me he first heard of it in aesthetics about five years ago. In South Korea, exosomes are a common add-on to Fraxel or microneedling, where the microchannels help them get into deeper layers of the skin. Exosome skin boosters are another popular treatment, containing a cocktail of ingredients like hyaluronic acid, amino acids, collagen peptides, and glutathione, for additional ‚Äúbrightening, firming effects,‚Äù says David Kim, MD, of Idriss Dermatology in New York City. He tells me that ASCE+ is a popular exosome product; the subtype SRLV is for skin and HRLV is for hair, and both contain exosomes derived from roses.
When I visited Seoul for the first time this spring, I was surprised by the number of dermatology and plastic surgery clinics and saw signs touting the ability to ‚Äúbank‚Äù your stem cells for future use at certain luxury clinics. This could be common in the future, according to Chang. ‚ÄúI suspect we‚Äôre going to get to a place where you can harvest stem cells, whether it‚Äôs from bone marrow or fat, and then you can send it to get processed and banked for you down the road.‚Äù Think of it sort of like beauty wealth management. 
To get continued results, this wouldn‚Äôt be a one-time treatment. The recommended frequency varies: Kim and Ro both say that it‚Äôs recommended in Korea to get an incredible five injection sessions of exosome skin boosters over two weeks.  But Levine suggests that since exosomes can stimulate your body to produce its own collagen, the effect could last longer. For hair, she recommends treatment roughly once a year. If you want a combination of immediate and long-term results, exosomes can be combined with filler or microneedling. 
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre just at the tip of the iceberg,‚Äù Levine says. ‚ÄúThis is certainly the direction that the field of aesthetics is going into.‚Äù Williams agrees, but worries about that iceberg. ‚ÄúScience shows that there‚Äôs something there, but we‚Äôre not sure what it is. That doesn‚Äôt mean that physicians can‚Äôt use non-FDA-approved treatments. But they need to be a little bit more careful. Patients should always be cautious about being the first one ever to try something. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt work out as well.‚Äù
Editor‚Äôs Note: This article does not constitute individual medical advice, and you should consult with your doctor before deciding if certain cosmetic or medical treatments are right for you.

title: What Happened Between Uche, Aaliyah, and Lydia on Love Is Blind Season 5?
text:
The trio caused quite a stir in the pods.
Spoilers below.
The fifth season of Love Is Blind has finally arrived, and new episodes are juicier than ever. As usual, some couples find love in the pods, but a prior relationship also threatens to wreck one of the new romances.
ICU travel nurse Aaliyah seemingly finds love with lawyer Uche in the pods. However, an emotional revelation from Uche completely throws Aaliyah off, making her question the burgeoning romance. Here‚Äôs what you need to know about the surprising love triangle between Aaliyah, Uche, and Lydia on Love Is Blind season 5.
At the end of season 5, episode 3, Uche emotionally opened up to Aaliyah with a secret he hadn‚Äôt revealed before. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something I have to tell you,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt been completely honest with you. One of my dates on the first day, I walked into the pod, and it is a girl that I have dated in the past. And, um, it‚Äôs Lydia.‚Äù The episode ended on this mic drop, with Aaliyah clearly shocked that Lydia, with whom she‚Äôd developed a close friendship, had previously dated Uche.
Episode 4 delved deeper into the love triangle, showing us Lydia and Uche‚Äôs first pod dates, in which they quickly realized that they knew one another. Lydia excitedly asked Uche, ‚ÄúDo you want to start at zero?‚Äù However, Uche responded, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we can do that, because I kind of, it ruins the experiment.‚Äù He also admitted, ‚ÄúThis really caught me off guard.‚Äù While Lydia seemed keen to continue talking to Uche, he essentially shut down any possibility of a second chance.
Cutting back to Aaliyah and Uche‚Äôs date, Uche said of his relationship with Lydia, ‚ÄúWe dated for a few months. I just didn‚Äôt think that we were that compatible so I ended things. It hurt me so much because she deserves an amazing person who is completely sure about her, and I really hope she finds that.‚Äù Aaliyah started crying, clearly shell-shocked that her close friend Lydia had previously dated the man she was now falling in love with. 
As for whether or not he was still considering Lydia as an option, Uche reassured Aaliyah, saying, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs over with ... I went back and forth about it for a long time, because I do see a lot of qualities that would make her a good wife. She seemed 100 percent into me, and I thought if I can‚Äôt give her 100 percent back, then I don‚Äôt want to hurt her.‚Äù 
After stepping outside the pod for a moment, Aaliyah returned and revealed to Uche, ‚Äú[Lydia]‚Äôs been making comments. She‚Äôs been saying things and I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòHow do you know this?‚Äô‚Äù Aaliyah continued, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs been telling me multiple times, like, ‚ÄòI just see myself in you. We are almost the same woman, you know? It‚Äôs just weird.‚Äù
Back in the women‚Äôs quarters, Aaliyah revealed to Lydia that she‚Äôd found out about her prior relationship with Uche. The pair embraced and cried, telling one another how much they loved each other.  However, the conversation became uncomfortable when Lydia started revealing personal details about Uche, telling Aaliyah, ‚ÄúI know everything about him because I know him.‚Äù Even though Aaliyah firmly said that she didn‚Äôt want to know anything about Uche because she wanted to discover it for herself, Lydia couldn‚Äôt help but spill the details.  
Lydia started talking about Uche‚Äôs dog, Kobe, telling Aaliyah that Kobe ‚Äúpees every time he sees me.‚Äù Lydia also revealed that she‚Äôd met Uche's friends, saying, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre going to get along.‚Äù She also called Uche a ‚Äúworkaholic,‚Äù said that he was ‚ÄúOCD,‚Äù that he drove a Tesla, and revealed that his three-level ‚Äúhouse was dope.‚Äù She even revealed Uche‚Äôs favorite color. With each new revelation, Aaliyah looked more and more uncomfortable. 
Finally, Lydia dropped the bombshell that she‚Äôd last slept with Uche in January of that year, only months before they‚Äôd entered the pods. In a confessional, Aaliyah said, ‚ÄúYou had sex three months ago, and I‚Äôm supposed to feel like that‚Äôs no big deal?‚Äù She also revealed, ‚ÄúI'm struggling with the fact he left out a lot of details. I get Lydia‚Äôs story and it includes a lot more detail than I would have liked.‚Äù
After hearing Lydia‚Äôs side of the story, Aaliyah joined Uche in the pods, and she was clearly distressed about what she‚Äôd learned. ‚ÄúOn the outside world, I would never date a friend‚Äôs ex. I would never befriend your ex,‚Äù she told him. Uche‚Äôs response did nothing to calm Aaliyah fears, with him asking, ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt think this is hard for me? I mean it‚Äôs happening to me just as much, or even more, than it‚Äôs happening to you.‚Äù Aaliyah responded, ‚ÄúNo it‚Äôs not, because I‚Äôm over here sitting with your ex that you fucked three months ago. She‚Äôs telling me things that I didn‚Äôt want to know from her.‚Äù 
Uche tried to persuade Aaliyah that they could make it work, in spite of the Lydia curve ball. They ended the date choosing each other, with Uche revealing that he had every intention of proposing. However, when he returned to the pod to propose, Aaliyah wasn‚Äôt there. Production intervened, telling Uche, ‚ÄúUnfortunately, Aaliyah‚Äôs decided not to continue with the experiment.‚Äù 
In an interview with Entertainment Tonight, Aaliyah opened up about her decision to leave the pods before Uche proposed, saying, ‚ÄúI had this gut feeling after really analyzing my interactions with Uche, Lydia, getting all the facts and things, or at least hearing both sides of that situation.‚Äù She continued, ‚ÄúBeing engaged, it‚Äôs a sacred thing to experience and you‚Äôre sharing that with family, friends, people I love dearly and that love me dearly. It was something I felt was best for me moving forward.‚Äù
After finding out that Aaliyah had left the experiment, Uche spoke to her on the phone during a confessional in episode 5. She explained that she had ‚Äúan exchange of words‚Äù with Lydia, which resulted in Aaliyah saying Lydia could have Uche back if he didn't propose. Aaliyah then went on to reveal that she felt as though Lydia smothered her, and wouldn't stop speaking about Uche in conversation. Tearfully, Aaliyah apologized to Uche for leaving.
Uche then asked her, ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you stay here and talk to me?‚Äù She revealed that she still loved him. However, he was angry that she left, and cast doubt on their relationship, telling her, ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt get through something like this, we would never get to that point.‚Äù He continued, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe some girl said something to you and you let that come in between us.‚Äù 
Aaliyah then suggested that Lydia knew that Uche was going to be on the show and applied as a result. Uche was angry about this suggestion, and called Aaliyah selfish for leaving. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt even write me a letter,‚Äù he told her. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve got nothing.‚Äù Uche then said he ‚Äúlet himself get close to the wrong person,‚Äù then told production, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt wanna talk to her‚Äù and hung up. 
Outside of the pods, Uche and Aaliyah met in a restaurant to talk, shown in episodes 6 and 7. ‚ÄúI do regret, I regret leaving you like that,‚Äù Aaliyah told Uche. ‚ÄúI do love you. Like, never felt the connection that you and I have with any other man.‚Äù She also revealed that she still wanted to be in a relationship with Uche. ‚ÄúI would marry you,‚Äù she told him. 
Unfortunately, Uche was not receptive to Aaliyah's declaration. ‚ÄúWhen I found out that you had left, it‚Äôs like I broke,‚Äù he told her. ‚Äú... You didn‚Äôt communicate any kind of doubt to me.‚Äù Aaliyah revealed that the doubts started when she discovered Uche‚Äôs past relationship with Lydia. She also felt awkward that Lydia revealed too much information about her past with Uche.  
Uche then started to explain the problems in his past relationship with Lydia, revealing that she'd invaded his privacy while they were dating. However, after she apologized, he decided to give her a second chance. Soon after, some of Uche‚Äôs friends reached out claiming that Lydia had been watching their Instagram Stories for weeks, despite not knowing them. He continued, ‚ÄúThe worst thing was, she drives over to my house, she takes a picture of my driveway and she texts it to me with a message that says, ‚ÄòI see you.‚Äô And I panicked.‚Äù Uche initially cut Lydia off, but started talking to her again as she had experienced a loss, before breaking up with her once more.
Uche admitted he should have told Aaliyah about his experiences with Lydia while in the pods. He explained, ‚ÄúMaybe Lydia still likes this guy, she‚Äôs still obsessed with him, maybe she doesn‚Äôt have the best intentions when it comes to me, and maybe you would‚Äôve been able to have your guard up a little bit more.‚Äù Aaliyah said that Uche‚Äôs seeming concern for Lydia and Milton‚Äôs relationship made her uneasy, and made her wonder if Uche still had feelings for Lydia. Aaliyah also revealed that Lydia had told some fellow contestants that she thought someone she‚Äôd previously dated was also on Love Is Blind, suggesting she had planned to reconnect with Uche.
While Aaliyah wanted to continue her relationship with Uche, he said that he had doubts about whether they could make it work, and walked away.
At a party for the contestants, shown in episode 7, Uche pulled Lydia aside and confronted her about their romance. The conversation quickly descended into an argument, with Uche suggesting that Lydia had been going through his possessions in his house. He later brought up Lydia's alleged Instagram behavior, suggesting that she‚Äôd been following his friends. She denied it, and accused Uche of sleeping with someone else while they were together. Lydia stormed off, and Uche found Milton to have a conversation.
Amy Mackelden is a freelance writer, editor, and disability activist. Her bylines include Harper's BAZAAR, Nicki Swift, Cosmopolitan, Marie Claire, ELLE, The Independent, Bustle, Healthline, and HelloGiggles. title: A Hot Girl‚Äôs Guide to the Best Amazon Halloween Costumes
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Buying something I‚Äôll never wear again? Now that‚Äôs scary.  
The best time of year is upon us. It‚Äôs the season for candy corn, slasher flicks, and letting cobwebs pass as decor (when really, you just need to dust). If you haven‚Äôt sorted out your Halloweekend outfits yet, don‚Äôt fret. We have lots of cute costume ideas here at ELLE, but I‚Äôm here to break down a few easy Halloween costumes from Amazon. Conveniently, the Amazon Prime Big Deal Days savings event is coming up on October 10 and 11, so you can score these items at an even better price.  
These are mostly made of things you A) already own, or B) need to purchase but could totally re-wear. As much as I love costume stores, I‚Äôm not interested in buying a sexy Bob Ross getup because when could I possibly wear that other than this one day a year? If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable and simple look that‚Äôs still chic and Instagrammable, look no further. Here, find 10 easy Halloween costumes you can get on Amazon. 
Iconic characters like Dorothy from The Wizard of Oz tend to make for fantastic Halloween costumes that can be worn again. Judy Garland and this character will always be timeless, and thus a trusty option for that costume party. I personally have this gingham dress for my own dress-up purposes and can attest that it‚Äôs just as cute on October 31 as it is paired with white sneakers during the summer months. But as Dorothy, try these sweet ballet flats that are very much aligned with our favorite fall 2023 shoe trends. 
As the song goes, ‚ÄúMiracles happen once in a while, if you believe.‚Äù The miracle I‚Äôm personally willing into existence is that I might do as good of a job as Hailey Bieber did when she dressed up as the girl next door-turned-princess Mia Thermopolis. It‚Äôs an all-time look for an all-time movie. And if you‚Äôre looking to make a group costume out of this, there are plenty of other endearing characters to rope your friends into (including Anne Hathaway‚Äôs pre-makeover look from Paolo).  
This might be a hot take, but here‚Äôs where I stand. Black cat ears: Basic. Witch: Failsafe. I can‚Äôt quite spell out the reasoning behind this, but I stand by it. A witch is a nod to the holiday‚Äôs very essence, as well as an homage to a long history of fierce women. Plus, this might be the easiest to throw together last minute. If you‚Äôre like me, you have ample black garments in your wardrobe to choose from. Make this the year you buy a pointy black hat and keep it on hand for all the Octobers to come. If you do actively practice witchcraft, even better (but it‚Äôs not a prerequisite). 
She‚Äôs the blueprint for all the baddies. And she‚Äôs just plain cool as hell. If I had darker hair or could pull off a wig, this costume would be at the top of my list. Not only are her look and vibe totally sexy and chic, but Betty Boop is also not a very common costume. In the realm of cool girl costume dressing, uniqueness is a virtue. You aren‚Äôt likely to see a slew of fellow Betties, and if you did, that would actually be pretty rad. 
For the gals who aren‚Äôt sold on the idea of dressing up at all, might I suggest this uber-cozy option? It requires minimal effort and will keep you warm and comfortable while your pals shiver in their Little Red Riding Hood frocks. Personally, half the time I ditch a party it‚Äôs because I don‚Äôt want to change out of my sweats. As the Pink Panther, you don‚Äôt have to. And you get to pretend to be a jewel thief‚Äîhow fun! 
Let me address the elephant in the nerd-filled room. A lightsaber wasn‚Äôt really part of Leia‚Äôs get-up‚Äîshe was more of the blaster type‚Äîbut I still think you can get away with this if for no reason other than recognizability. The dress and belt could easily be worn time and time again, and space buns are a simple enough hairdo. If you‚Äôre raiding your brother‚Äôs room to borrow the lightsaber he already owns, make sure it‚Äôs blue. This is your only hope of successfully clapping back at anyone who tries to mansplain that Leia didn‚Äôt carry a lightsaber. If someone gives you a hard time about this detail, just tell them to check their facts, because Leia technically does use a blue lightsaber to train with Luke in an episode IX flashback. (And thank you, to my boyfriend for all this information.) 
You could lean into the Tinkerbell of it all if you‚Äôre so inclined, but you can also decide to be your own kind of pixie, whatever that looks like for you. Honestly, almost any cottagecore-adjacent outfit will do for this one. Floral dress? Sure. Just pop on those wings and call it a day. But I do draw the line at those pointy elf ear accessories; The best I can do is pointed-toe shoes. Final offer. 
Everybody dresses up as the Scooby-Doo gang. Skip Daphne or Velma, and instead go for the less overdone option of Nancy Drew, the original woman in STEM. Pretty much any solid-colored top or sweater will do the trick. Pair it with a pencil skirt or pedal pushers in true Nancy Drew form.

Elizabeth James is one of the top 10 onscreen mothers, according to no one other than myself. This low-lift idea comes from ELLE‚Äôs senior video producer Laura Hacker, and it requires hardly anything at all. The primary components are a button-down shirt, sunglasses, and a hair roller. You can decide whether you want to talk in a posh British accent and quote this Natasha Richardson character all evening, but I strongly recommend it. 
 Okay...I have a confession. I have not seen The White Lotus. I know, I know; I‚Äôm terribly out of touch. But not so out of touch that I would overlook such a glaringly obvious costume idea. Pop culture or current zeitgeist costumes can be a total trap because you risk looking like a bandwagoner. But I do believe that Tanya makes an excellent costume inspiration. For that matter, any Jennifer Coolidge character is an excellent idea.

She also co-writes a monthly column, Same Same But Different. Meg has previously written for Cosmopolitan and Town & Country. Her passions include travel, buffalo sauce, and sustainability. She will never stop hoping for a One Direction reunion tour.

title: Dakota Johnson and Chris Martin‚Äôs Complete Relationship Timeline
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
After Coldplay's Chris Martin consciously uncoupled back in 2014 with his partner of a decade Gwyneth Paltrow, his dating life became decidedly more private. Martin seems to have finally  found lasting love with Dakota Johnson after previously being linked to actresses including Jennifer Lawrence and Annabelle Wallis. 
Although they've kept their relationship low-key, they celebrated three years together this past October. Here, a rundown of the romance.
Rumors of a relationship first arose when Johnson and Martin were spotted grabbing dinner at Sushi Park in Los Angeles. According to a People onlooker, the pair appeared "cozy, laughing and affectionate" during the outing.
By mid-November fans clocked Johnson at Coldplay's Buenos Aires, Argentina concert. Lainey Gossip noted that it was the last show of the band's Head Full Of Dreams tour‚Äîand that Johnson was viewing the show from a VIP-level vantage point.
The following month, multiple sources confirmed to Us Weekly that the potential couple was together. "Dakota and Chris are definitely dating," one source said. "They've gotten to know each other really well and are very comfortable from one another. Chris sends Dakota his music to get her opinion. It's more than just a fling."
A sighting at Nick Cave's concert in Israel solidified this news. Afterwards, they had dinner at Yam Sheva restaurant in Herzliya. "They came in and they were really, really nice, like extremely nice. It was a surprise," an eyewitness told the outlet. "They sat with Nick Cave too. I didn't see them kiss or hold hands or anything like that. They ordered some starters and not a lot of food."
People obtained photos of Johnson and Martin at Soho House in Malibu, California. An eyewitness said, "Chris and Dakota arrived together in Chris' car. They met up with friends and had a fun night. They both seemed very happy. They were flirty, and also left the restaurant together."
A week later, People spotted the couple walking the beach in Malibu, with a source noting that they had spent "m0st of the weekend together." The insider offered that, "They seem to be getting more serious. On Friday, they had dinner with friends. They also hung out at Chris' house and went for a beach walk. They didn't see each other over the holidays and seem excited to be catching up now."  
People was reportedly on their date night scene again at Stella McCartney's autumn collection unveiling. They skipped the red carpet, but an onlooker said the couple stayed close once inside the event. "They walked in holding hands and Dakota was not letting go‚Äîshe was super into the PDA," the eyewitness remembered. "When Chris let go of her hand, she slipped her arm through his." 
Later that month, Dakota's father, Don Johnson seemingly confirmed her relationship to Digital Spy. When asked about his daughter's romance he said, "Yeah, that's... uh troubling, isn't it? No, she's a big girl, she can handle herself!"
In mid-February, the couple appeared at Ellen  DeGeneres' 60th birthday party, an event also attended by Paltrow and her fianc√© Brad Falchuk. People obtained photos of the pair holding hands outside of the festivities while talking to Drew Barrymore.
A few months later, the pair was spotted walking Johnson's dog, Zeppelin around Malibu. People spoke to a source who gave insight into Johnson and Martin's relationship. "For the past two weeks, they have spent a lot of time together," the insider said. "Chris lives in Malibu and Dakota seems to love hanging out there. They occasionally go for dinner with friends, but mostly have friends over at home. They go to the beach together, and walks around the neighborhood. They seem to enjoy sharing a quiet life. It does seem they are getting more serious."
The following month, a Twitter user caught the couple at a Radiohead concert in Boston. They were seemingly on a double date with Breaking Bad's Aaron Paul and his wife, Lauren. "They stood up for a couple of the ovations," a concertgoer told People, noting that they sat for most of the show. Earlier, Martin and Johnson were seen strolling into the venue hand in hand.
HI IM SAT BEHIND CHRIS MARTIN AND DOKOTA JOHNSON pic.twitter.com/YcDGFRpvqP
The weekend of Paltrow's wedding to Falchuk, Martin supported Johnson at the Global Citizen Festival in New York City. E! noted Martin's presence in the audience while Johnson spoke onstage about the power of sharing stories of sexual assault.
As further proof of the pair's bond, they seemingly got matching tattoos. E! spotted the similar ink when Johnson was photographed at the Venice Film Festival. On her left elbow, there was an infinity sign tattoo with two Xs. Days prior, Martin was seen at an event in Los Angeles with the same tattoo in a similar location.
A week later, TMZ reported that Martin and Johnson were throwing a gender reveal party at his home. Photos of blue and pink balloon arches raised speculation that the couple could be expecting a baby. Both of Johnson's parents, including mother Melanie Griffith, and celebrities such as Sean Penn and Julia Roberts were spotted at the event.
Shortly after, Johnson's rep denied the rumors to Us Weekly, clarifying that the celebrations were for a birthday party and not a gender reveal of any kind. On Ellen the following month Johnson confirmed that sentiment herself, saying, "Well, the only thing I'm pregnant with is a lot of really good ideas. But not any babies."
Around a year after Martin and Johnson were first spotted at Sushi Park, the couple returned for a casual dinner out. A source told Us Weekly around this time that the couple will "be engaged soon. Chris is head over heels." The insider also claimed that Martin was holding off on an engagement after Paltrow wed Falchuk in September. "He wanted to make sure the kids didn't have too much change all at once," the source said. "He's a great dad." 
Martin spent Thanksgiving with Paltrow and their two children, Apple, 15 and Moses, 13. A source told E!, "Gwyneth thinks (Johnson) is lovely. She gets on very well with her and is happy for Chris. They've spent a good amount of time together and have a very nice friendship." 
Johnson and Martin were photographed walking her dog barefoot around Malibu in their last public sighting for months.
The Sun reported that the couple split the month prior, to the surprise of close friends. "Chris and Dakota were very easygoing and always seemed really happy together," a source told the outlet. Meanwhile, The Express claimed that Johnson and Martin "could not have been further apart" when it came to starting a family. A source said, "Chris made it clear he wants more kids as soon as possible but Dakota's career has really taken off and that's the last thing she wanted to think about right away. It got to the point, last month, where a light seemed to flick on in both their heads and they realized they were pulling in completely opposite directions - so they decided to call it a day."
Rumors of reconciliation begin when a Twitter user spotted Johnson and Martin at a wrap party for the actress's upcoming movie, Covers.
Another New Picture of Dakota and Chris Martin at the wrap-party of #Covers last night ‚ô• #DakotaJohnson; via tyraoneal_ on Instagram. pic.twitter.com/qMH7fghtfI
Soon after the sighting, Us Weekly confirmed that the pair had reunited. The day after their initial spotting, Martin attended the Los Angeles premiere of Johnson's new movie, The Peanut Butter Falcon. E! also shared that the couple was back together and "planning to spend more time together later this summer," per a source
Us Weekly reported that the couple's reconciliation came courtesy of Martin's ex, Paltrow. "Gwyneth is the one who pushed them to do it," a source said, noting that the two had bonded at an April event.
There could be some truth to that claim, as Martin, Paltrow, and their respective partners were all spotted in the Hamptons together in photos from TMZ. Shortly after, Johnson and Martin had date night at East Village's Double Zero in NYC. 
Griffith, Johnson's mother, definitively commented on her daughter's relationship with Martin. "I love my daughter‚Äôs boyfriend. I think that they're an awesome couple," she told People. A source told an outlet at the time that privacy is paramount for the couple. "Dakota has been filming out of state, but most weekends she comes back to Malibu to spend time with Chris," the insider said. "They are very low-key together. They usually have friends over and rarely go out." 
On October 4, it wasn't Martin wishing Johnson a happy birthday on social media. It was his ex Paltrow, who shared a black-and-white photo of Johnson and her pet dog. "Happy 30th birthday to this absolute gem üíô," she captioned the celebratory IG post.
A few days later, E! reported on Johnson's 30th birthday bash in Malibu. Guests included Martin, Paltrow, and celebs such as Miley Cyrus and Robert Downey Jr. The report said Johnson and Martin arrived at the event together and spent most of the evening by each other's side. "Dakota and Chris sat side by side watching different musical acts," the source told E!. "Dakota and Chris spent a lot of time together. They walked around holding hands or with his hand on her back. They seemed very happy." 
Just before Christmas, Page Six spotted Johnson on a trip to Aspen with Martin, Paltrow, and the former couple's two children Apple and Moses. In photos, Johnson locked arms with Apple while on a coffee run alongside Martin. On Christmas day, Paltrow shared an Instagram of herself and husband Falchuk in ski gear, indicating he was also on the family trip.
Paltrow's support of her ex-husband's relationship continued into the new year. In a cover story interview with Harper's Bazaar, she had nothing but kind words for Johnson. "I love her," Paltrow said. "I can see how it would seem weird because it‚Äôs sort of unconventional. But I think, in this case, just having passed through it iteratively, I just adore her. I always start to think of the ampersand sign‚Äîwhat else can you bring in, instead of being resistant to or being made insecure by? There‚Äôs so much juice in leaning in to something like that.‚Äù
She also spoke about the evolving nature of her dynamic with Martin. "It‚Äôs not like there‚Äôs a finish line: ‚ÄòOh, we consciously uncoupled; we‚Äôre done,'" she explained. "It‚Äôs a lifelong commitment to constantly reinvent your relationship with your ex, which you do presumably because you have children together. I don‚Äôt see a reason to do it if you don‚Äôt have children together. Some people do. But I think we put all the hard work in at the beginning. I would say very rarely is it difficult now. We‚Äôve learned how to communicate with each other. We love each other. We laugh. We have the best of each other. It‚Äôs really nice. It makes you feel like you don‚Äôt have to lose.‚Äù
Martin was involved in a major career milestone for Johnson. On Valentine's Day, Coldplay released its music video f0r the song, ‚ÄúCry Cry Cry.‚Äù The romantic video's director was none other than Johnson, who made her directorial debut with the collaboration.
Early this month, the couple had a rare public outing with Martin's two children. The foursome was spotted by the Daily Mail strolling through Disneyland for his 43rd birthday. 
A few weeks later, Martin and Johnson enjoyed dinner at Crossroads Kitchen in Los Angeles, per E!. Johnson wore dark wide leg jeans, a hoodie, and black loafers for the outing. Meanwhile, Martin sported a long sleeve shirt, dark gray pants, and a blue baseball cap. During an interview with Architectural Digest a few days prior, Johnson had joked that "the key to a healthy relationship" with Martin is having "double sinks" in the bathroom. 
Quarantine hasn't stopped the couple from sharing some adorable moments together. On March 26, Johnson's friend Olivia Wilde posted a video made by the pair with the caption, ‚ÄúDakota Johnson: Hand wash CHAMPION.‚Äù In the clip, Johnson stands in front of a kitchen sink as she demonstrates her hand washing technique. It's soon clear that the actress's "hands" in the video were Martin's. The "M" and "A" tattoos on each of the wrists gave it away. Martin scrubbed his hands while Johnson spoke to the camera.   
A few days later, Martin and Johnson made a rare public appearance together while on a break from quarantine. Photographers snapped the couple walking arm-in-arm through Malibu with Johnson's dog on March 31. 
People reported that Johnson and Martin are still going strong and are still spending time with Martin's kids his ex-wife, Gwyneth Paltrow, and her husband, Brad Flachuck. The two are living in the $12.5 million Malibu mansion Martin bought last October. 
"Chris was always a big fan of Malibu," a source told People. "He loves the beach and often goes surfing and running. The source added: "She seems to enjoy it as much as Chris does. They both love the outdoors and often take beach strolls. They also support local restaurants."
Per The Daily Mail, Johnson has been fueling rumors of her engagement to Martin‚Äîwith an Emerald ring on her left finger. Neither Johnson nor Martin have confirmed the rumor. 
On Saturday the 24th, Martin and Johnson were seen out in Malibu for a lunch and coffee date, while fans still wonder if the two are planning to tie the knot. Johnson wore ripped jeans, a black spaghetti-strap top, black Adidas sneakers, and a green knit hat as Martin, who was barefoot, in gray sweats, and a black shirt, followed. 
Martin and Johnson were spotted enjoying a vacation in Palma De Mallorca, Spain, where they took a boat ride and were seen taking a leisurely stroll together. They each wore black baseball caps as they joined arms. 
Earlier in the month, Martin and Johnson were photographed together in New York City. They walked arm in arm, wearing matching pink and black outfits. A few weeks later, the couple was seen in London, where they grabbed dinner in the chic neighborhood of Mayfair. Johnson wore a coat over a white button down and black pants, along with a pair of Converses and a Gucci purse. Martin opted for a low-key black sweater, gray sweatpants, and knit beanie.
Coldplay announced it would be postponing several shows in Brazil due to Martin coming down with a serious lung infection. Later that month, he and Johnson were spotted on a beachside stroll in their home city of Malibu. Johnson wore a white sweatshirt and gray sweatpants, while Martin paired a graphic tee with a baseball cap and baggy pants.
Johnson put on her own show in the audience at Martin's November 8 concert in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Johnson told Vanity Fair in July 2022 that she loves to tour with Coldplay when she's not working, and she apparently also loves dancing up a storm to her man's tunes.
Amo como disfrut√≥ el concierto üòç‚ù§Ô∏è #dakotajhonson #DakotaJohnson pic.twitter.com/ZzqtvnQiLi
When Johnson can't travel with him, Martin makes a point of visiting her. He stopped by Boston, Massachusetts, to see his girlfriend as she was filming the superhero movie Madame Web that summer.
On the March 19 episode of the Conan O'Brien Needs A Friend podcast, Martin shared how Johnson made Coldplay reconsider accessibility at their shows by introducing him to new tactile technology.
‚ÄúThey are called SubPacs,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúDakota, my partner, gave me one as a gift because she saw someone online experiencing whatever they are experiencing with this‚Äîit's kind of like body armor ‚Äîyou put it on and plug it in and it connects to the base.‚Äù
Johnson had seen the technology being used online and told Martin that he ‚Äúshould use this somehow.‚Äù
‚ÄúSo, we started using it and it's been so amazing and it should get better and better,‚Äù Martin continued. ‚ÄúWe have ten or twenty now‚Äîevery night‚Äîof those packs and so if you're hearing impaired we have an area where you sign up and you put on the pack and you can feel the show.‚Äù
He added that the SubPacs are expensive, but well-worth it because ‚Äúthey are amazing and the things that people do to consider other people are just wonderful.‚Äù
On Saturday of Easter weekend, Johnson and Martin were seen in Malibu, California, going on a coffee run together. During the rare public outing, Johnson wore large sunglasses, a black hat, a pair of floral tapestry loose pants by Bode, Converse sneakers, and a Bruce Springsteen t-shirt. 
Martin wore a light grey t-shirt, matching sweatpants, and sneakers with a grey beanie. Johnson had her arm looped through Martin's as they walked together. 
On June 21, Chris Martin and his band Coldplay were performing in Naples, Italy, and his girlfriend Dakota Johnson was in the audience. In a video shared by the Daily Mail, the singer covered the stage, then stopped to serenade her where she was sitting to watch the show in the sound deck. Johnson smiled and blew him a kiss.
Johnson kicked off the month by being a supportive girlfriend. The actress attended Martin‚Äôs Coldplay concert on Sunday, October 1, in Pasadena, California, with her mother. Photos came out of Johnson there in a long leather jacket with a black top and light pants.

title: Kendall Jenner and Bad Bunny‚Äôs Complete Relationship Timeline
text:
Earlier this year, it was rumored that model Kendall Jenner and musical artist Bad Bunny were starting a romantic relationship, and a few months later things seem to still be going strong. Jenner split with her on-again-off-again ex-boyfriend Devin Booker in 2022, and was reportedly spending time enjoying the single life.
Then Bad Bunny, or Benito Antonio Mart√≠nez Ocasio, swept her off her feet. Here's their relationship timeline so far.
The pair were first seen together out for a date in Beverly Hills. Jenner and Ocasio were spotted leaving Wally's, a popular eatery amongst the rich and famous. E! News said that Hailey and Justin Bieber were also at the restaurant, which could mean they were on a double date ‚Äî or everyone wanted brunch at the same time.
The new couple were out in West Hollywood in early March having dinner with friends. They shared a hug and possibly a kiss before parting. By he end of the month, the rapper seemed to be mentioning his new gal friend on Eladio Carri√≥n's track ‚ÄúCoco Chanel.‚Äù 
In the lyrics, he sings, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not bad, baby that‚Äôs a gimmick / But the sun in Puerto Rico is hotter than in Phoenix / She knows it.‚Äù
Booker, Jenner's ex, plays for the Phoenix Suns. Elsewhere on the song, he shouts out ‚ÄúScorpio women,‚Äù which is Jenner's birth sign. A source told US Weekly that month that Jenner wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúreally looking to date anybody.‚Äù
‚ÄúThings are not official between Kendall and Bad Bunny, but they‚Äôre seeing each other on a regular basis and getting to know each other better,‚Äù the insider said, but Jenner's feelings were ‚Äústarting to grow‚Äù after ‚Äúspending more time‚Äù with him.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not super serious, but she likes him and is open to seeing where things go with him. Kendall appreciates how he treats her with respect and he makes her laugh,‚Äù the insider added. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs very charming and she thinks he‚Äôs a great guy. Although things are still fairly new, she definitely sees potential.‚Äù 
In late March, they were seen out at dinner again and an eyewitness said they were ‚Äúopenly kissing‚Äù and ‚Äúbeing very affectionate.‚Äù 
In April, TMZ reported the couple had gone horseback riding together, so things have definitely heated up. On April 15, Jenner watched Bad Bunny's performance at Coachella in Indio, California, and was captured dancing on the crowd on a TikTok. Later that weekend she was also photographed by his side as he whispered to her in the crowd. 
They were then seen together at Tyler the Creator's concert in Los Angeles on Wednesday, April 26, dressed casually and laughing as they walked through the street.
On Saturday, April 29, they were seen in NYC heading to Carbone, a celebrity favorite. They later headed to Pergola for after-dinner drinks, leaving together in a blue Mercedes. For the night out, Jenner stunned in a sleeveless semi-sheer asymmetrical crop top that matched her dark brown miniskirt trimmed in tan fuzz. She completed the look with knee high leather boots covered in belt details.
The rapper wore black slacks with a black and yellow leather jacket and a pair of black sunglasses. He had one square-toed black boots and a gold chain around his neck.
Jenner and Bunny didn't walk the Met Gala red carpet, but they attended an after-party together.
A source told People that same day that the couple was becoming ‚Äúmore serious.‚Äù
‚ÄúThey are very cute together. Kendall is happy,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúHe is a fun guy. Very much a gentleman and charming. She likes his vibe. He is very chill.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt was a slow start, but they spend almost every day together now,‚Äù the source continued. ‚ÄúHe hangs out with her friends and she hangs out with his. It's more of a relationship now. Kendall is not seeing anyone else. She really likes him.‚Äù
On May 11, E! reported that Bunny and Jenner went on vacation together with friends. A TikTok revealed this, with Bunny and Jenner appearing alongside each other in a video taken by photographer Renell Medrano and posted to his page. He ultimately took it down. A screenshot from the video of Bunny and Jenner remains online here.
Another source told UsWeekly that day, ‚ÄúThings are going really well for Kendall and Bad Bunny and she definitely sees long-term potential with him. She feels like he‚Äôs the complete package and he treats her like a total gentleman.‚Äù
They added that she is ‚Äúreally attracted‚Äù to the artist‚Äôs confidence. 
‚ÄúThey are having a great time together, and she appreciates that he gets along with all of her friends,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey complement each other on so many levels and she‚Äôs enjoying getting to know him better every day.‚Äù
On May 12, they were seen sitting court side at the Lakers playoff game in Los Angeles.
On May 24, a source gave more detail to Entertainment Tonight about how Jenner and Bunny's more serious relationship was progressing. ‚ÄúHe is not only spending more time with Kendall, but with the rest of the family as well,‚Äù the source said.
There's ‚Äúpotential‚Äù for the pair's romance to be more ‚Äúlong term,‚Äù the source added. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre both always laughing and smiling together and have similar family values.‚Äù Jenner herself is ‚Äúenjoying their low-key relationship and is excited about where they're headed.‚Äù
On June 21, interviews with both Jenner and Bunny came out where they discussed their intention to keep their relationship private.
Bunny told Rolling Stone of keeping his personal life under the wraps, ‚ÄúI know something is going to come out. I know [people are] going to say something. People know everything about me, so what‚Äôs left for me to protect? My private life, my personal life.‚Äù 
When asked if he wanted to clear up any rumors about his relationship with Jenner, he repeated that line: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the only answer. In the end, the only thing I have is my privacy.‚Äù
Jenner told WSJ magazine, meanwhile, that she had  ‚Äúno comment‚Äù on Bunny.
‚ÄúI try [to] find the balance of keeping things private and keeping things sacred, [and] also not letting the unfortunate frustration and stress of everyone trying to get in on it stop me from enjoying my side,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúDoes that make sense? I‚Äôll go out of my way to do things as privately as possible because I just think that that‚Äôs the healthier way of dealing with relationships anyway.‚Äù 
A source told People that Jenner and Bunny went on vacation together to Gozzer Ranch Golf & Lake Club in Harrison, Idaho.
The source described them as ‚Äúreally cute‚Äù and ‚Äúso happy together,‚Äù adding, ‚ÄúThey definitely seem in love, and super serious. They're really friendly. Kendall is so low key that plenty of guests don't even know who she was.‚Äù
Jenner and Bad Bunny were also seen back in West Hollywood on July 27, enjoying a dinner date together at Sushi Park. It's one of their favorite spots, and they were also seen there with friends in late June.
That same day, on an episode of The Kardashians, Jenner shared that her mom Kris has gifted custom dollhouses to all her siblings for Christmas and decorated her to manifest a marriage.
‚ÄúShe put an engagement ring in mine, because she thought it was manifesting an engagement for me,‚Äù she said in a confessional. ‚ÄúSo if that tells you anything about where my mom wants me to be in life.‚Äù
Videos and photos of Jenner and Bunny kissing and showing PDA came out when the couple attended Drake's Los Angeles concert together. The date night marked one of their most affectionate public outings yet since they started seeing each other.
Later in August, Bunny appeared to soft launch their relationship on his Instagram Stories. He shared a video featuring a woman he called ‚Äúmami‚Äù whose voice resembled Jenner‚Äôs. He also wore a ‚ÄúK‚Äù initial necklace in one photo and had a photo of her 818 tequila line in another.
Kendall on Benito‚Äôs insta story ü•∞ pic.twitter.com/21odRhMWnm
Throughout the month, Jenner and Bunny had a string of public dates, including at the Met Opera in New York City and at Gucci‚Äôs fashion show in Milan.
Bunny also addressed why he is so against discussing his romance with Jenner in a Vanity Fair profile published in mid-September.
Regarding fans who disapprove of him dating Jenner, he said, ‚Äúthey don‚Äôt know how you feel, they don‚Äôt know how you live, they don‚Äôt know anything, and I really don‚Äôt want them to know. I‚Äôm not really interested in clarifying anything because I have no commitment to clarify anything to anyone. I am clear and my friend Jomar [D√°vila] is clear and my mother is clear. They are the only ones to whom I have to clarify anything. As for Juliana Dominguez from Mississippi [a random fan name], I have nothing I need to clarify to her. Never. About anything.‚Äù
‚ÄúThere are people who say that artists have to put up with it,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have to accept anything and everything because I wanted to be an artist. At the end of the day, you listen to me because you want to. I don‚Äôt force you to.‚Äù
He also revealed that he isn‚Äôt about to get engaged to anyone. When asked if he wanted traditional milestones like a wedding and kids, he said, ‚Äúno, I don‚Äôt think so,‚Äù adding at least ‚Äúnot now.‚Äù  
After shortly after their appearance at Gucci‚Äôs show, Jenner and Bunny appeared in the fashion house‚Äôs newest campaign together, released on September 30.

title: All About Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen‚Äôs Rumored Relationship
text:
Romance rumors have been swirling around actress Hailee Steinfeld and Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen since spring 2023. They were first spotted on Thursday, May 25, then again that Saturday. The pair were spotted that night getting out of a black SUV before enjoying their evening together.
They also had dinner at Sushi by Bou, with photos of them at the restaurant posted on Facebook by the sushi spot's founder, Michael Sinensky.
In the months since, they‚Äôve continued to spark dating rumors. Here‚Äôs everything to know about Steinfeld's rumored romantic interest Josh Allen so far.
The football star once played for University of Wyoming, and was selected seventh overall by the Buffalo Bills in the 2018 NFL Draft after his stellar performance as an MVP. The 27-year-old took a couple years to warm up to NFL life, then lived up to his reputation with an incredible 202o season, leading the team to their first division title and playoff victory since 1995.
Allen's personal life has been a big part of his story, as he had been dating longtime girlfriend Brittany Williams for eight years. 
They first met as children, and even went to the Sadie Hawkins dance together in high school, but didn't start dating until college. However, they have seemingly split. Fans of the player noted in May that he'd stopped following Williams on social media, though he still has some snapshots of his former girlfriend up on the timeline. Williams has unfollowed and deleted all of her photos with Allen.
Based on the very recent social media clues and very recent sightings, it likely hasn't been long. Steinfeld was most recently dating Irish musician Niall Horan, starting in early 2018. They broke up less than a year later.
‚ÄúThey split months ago,‚Äù a source told Us Weekly in December of that year. ‚ÄúNiall wrapped up his tour and had more free time, but Hailee‚Äôs work schedule really ramped up, so they didn‚Äôt have time for a relationship. They still have a lot of love for each other.‚Äù 
In July, over Independence Day weekend, the pair were seen in Los Cabos and photographed smooching in the water. Steinfeld was wearing a bucket hat and sunglasses, and had her arms wrapped around Allen's neck as they kissed. He was also wearing sunglasses and had wet hair from their pool time.
Steinfeld was photographed shopping with Allen‚Äôs mom Lavonne on September 30. The women bought Bills merchandise to support Allen at Leveled Up Buffalo in East Aurora, New York. The shop shared a photo of Lavonne and Steinfeld posing with owner Lindsey Vega on its Instagram.

title: Can Taylor Lorenz Fix the Internet?
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The Washington Post reporter breaks the internet on a regular basis. Can she keep it from breaking her?
One million years ago, in 2009, the first image had yet to be posted on Instagram, ‚Äúfriend‚Äù was just starting its transformation into a verb, and the internet was still, by and large, considered a realm you could enter and leave at will. It was also the Great Recession, and jobs were scarce. Which is how Taylor Lorenz, then in her twenties, signed up with a temporary work agency and found gigs doing the types of administrative tasks that stretch time out like taffy. Until one day when her cubicle mate showed her a portal. ‚ÄúOh, I just go on Tumblr all day,‚Äù the woman said. 
Lorenz spent the rest of the afternoon scrolling and exploring the blogging platform, which teemed with the open, hopeful energy of a new world. Then she went home, logged back in, and kept going. After years of never finding where she fit in, Tumblr introduced her to a space where she felt, finally, at home: the internet. 
Now, the Washington Post reporter, whose first book, Extremely Online: The Untold Story of Fame, Influence, and Power on the Internet, is out today, is one of the most extremely online (per her title) reporters in the country, and one of the most discussed. 
At The Daily Beast, The Atlantic, the New York Times, and now the Post, she has pioneered, legitimized, and dominated a beat sometimes described as ‚Äúinternet culture.‚Äù Thanks to her, people who get their news from newspapers understand ‚Äúok boomer‚Äù is an insult and are familiar with the adjective cheugy. The same goes for the conspiracy parody group Birds Aren‚Äôt Real, the 14-year-old creator who originated the TikTok dance known as the Renegade, and the formerly anonymous right-wing influencer account Libs of TikTok.   
Lorenz remains immersed in the world she covers: She has over half a million followers on TikTok and over 346,000 on Twitter, recently rebranded as X. (We‚Äôve continued to refer to it as Twitter here for clarity.) And while Lorenz doesn‚Äôt monetize her content, she navigates social media like a lot of people who do, in that she‚Äôs attuned to engagement, undeterred by conflict, and plainly interested in brand-building. On TikTok, she offers tips for early-career journalists and slaps back at nasty comments. On Twitter, she posts, reposts, argues, replies, opines, signal boosts, subtweets, and sometimes even apologizes at a steady clip. 
Somewhere along the way, though, Lorenz has become not just a journalist, but a phenomenon. Tucker Carlson, in one of his numerous Lorenz-focused segments, described her as being ‚Äúat the very top of journalism‚Äôs repulsive little food chain.‚Äù She is the terrain upon which people fight battles about the perils of social media and journalism, about misogyny and trolls, as well as someone who has been ingested by the attention economy and refracted back as a million pieces that float around the internet, alternately true and totally twisted. She is 24, she‚Äôs 50, she has a trust fund, she is a talented reporter, she has ties to the Clintons, she is a lizard (yes, a lizard). She is, in other words, not just synonymous with her beat but representative of it. As she has put it, she has lost the narrative of her own life.
The toxicity of online spaces, though, has not led Lorenz to disengage (she did take a five-month break from Twitter while working on her book but said it led her reporting to suffer). Last May, as a new set of claims led her to go viral on Twitter for the umpteenth time, she could be found riding the wave. ‚ÄúGo ahead and drop all the conspiracies about me you want, it only adds to my lore,‚Äù she tweeted.
When I meet Lorenz in person, I learn not all the lore is false. She is vegan and often keeps the thermostat in her home at 87 degrees: ‚ÄúMy body temperature‚Äôs very low,‚Äù she says on a recent morning in Washington Square Park in New York, where she‚Äôs visiting for work. ‚ÄúI always joke that I am part lizard, so the lizard conspiracy is very apt.‚Äù She moved from her 400-square-foot Brooklyn apartment to East Los Angeles during the summer of 2020, looking for more space in which to quarantine. Most mornings, she makes fresh nectar for her hummingbird feeders and watches the birds. Most nights, she watches a horror movie‚Äîshe once read they can help people externalize anxiety and thought that made sense.
But despite Lorenz‚Äôs frequently stated belief that there is no distinction between being online and offline‚Äî‚Äúthe internet is the world,‚Äù she tells me‚Äîthe person I anticipated from her social media is different from the one I meet. Online, it‚Äôs not uncommon to find Lorenz, who‚Äôs immunocompromised, writing posts like this: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs wild how quickly a certain brand of leftist went from ‚Äòhealthcare is a human right!!!‚Äô to ‚Äòdisabled people should shut up and die already and stop asking for basic COVID protections bc I am fine with normalizing mass death/disability as long as it doesn‚Äôt disrupt my brunch.‚Äô‚Äâ‚Äù In person, though, she is apologetic even asking if we can move when someone nearby begins coughing. (Navigating COVID as a high-risk person, she says, sometimes leaves her feeling like she‚Äôs in a zombie movie.) ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm the type of person who‚Äôs militant about anything,‚Äù she says, adding that the night before, she hung out with an old friend who loves Carlson so much she calls him her boyfriend. 
Lorenz is also ‚Äúvery open to many points of view,‚Äù impulsive (‚Äúwhich is not a good quality,‚Äù she says), and by turns kind and combative, confident and self-effacing. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs funny when people paint her as controversial,‚Äù says her friend Kat Tenbarge, a tech and culture reporter at NBC News. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòNot in real life.‚Äô‚Äâ‚Äù Lindsey Underwood, an editor at the Washington Post, describes her as ‚Äúa regular-ass girl‚Äù who is notably generous‚Äîwhen Underwood was moving to L.A., Lorenz checked out a prospective home for her. ‚ÄúHow she‚Äôs seen online is perplexing,‚Äù says Cooper Fleishman, who edited some early pieces of Lorenz‚Äôs at the online news site Mic. ‚ÄúShe welcomes [disagreement] and throws herself in there. But the backlash is so far out of proportion to what she‚Äôs actually saying that it feels like, Is this a thing? Or is the right turning her into a caricature? And are we playing into that?‚Äù 
Part of what inflames matters is that Lorenz sometimes, for example, calls out public figures for problematic tweets they made as teenagers, while auto-deleting her own tweets, putting her in the middle of hot-button debates around cancel culture, hypocrisy, and language. (‚ÄúI think having a long history of everything you‚Äôve ever said on the internet is insane, actually,‚Äù she says.) Some who have interacted with Lorenz on Twitter question if she engages with others in ways that increase the platform‚Äôs toxicity. One person who worked on a piece about long COVID that Lorenz harshly criticized says, ‚ÄúIt comes back to a super interesting thing: Her career is about how the internet breaks people‚Äôs brains, and her beat involves understanding why a certain kind of discourse is problematic. Yet she sometimes acts in ways that are very antagonistic and not productive.‚Äù 
It‚Äôs hardly unusual to find acrimonious debates online. What remains surprising is that Lorenz, whom her former boss Neetzan Zimmerman (who has himself been called a viral news genius) describes as smarter about the internet than anyone he‚Äôs ever met, can seem so taken aback by how she‚Äôs perceived. ‚ÄúWhat have I ever done that‚Äôs controversial?‚Äù she says to me at one point. I suggest her COVID views might be seen that way. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù she says, then proceeds to list views that are indeed not that controversial, but also not what I, at least, expected from her posts. ‚ÄúI think the majority of people would want investments in vaccines,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWe desperately need clean air standards for buildings. Paid sick leave. By the way, people should have accessible health care. I guess that‚Äôs controversial, but truly, are you kidding me?‚Äù 
How much should a journalist be judged by what they do on social media anyway? Lorenz has often been at the center of this debate both because her Twitter presence sometimes overshadows her journalism and because her critics use any missteps she makes there to undermine her legitimacy. Which Lorenz finds absurd. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like I‚Äôm living in a crazy land,‚Äù Lorenz says. ‚ÄúThe internet is the world. What if you‚Äôre at a dinner party and somebody says, ‚ÄòOh, x y z,‚Äô and somebody else says ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs not right,‚Äô and you say ‚ÄòOh, my bad.‚Äô So you should never be a journalist again?‚Äù
Even a few years ago, Lorenz was able to move easily through the internet. She sold furniture on Instagram Stories and used Twitter to recommend her newly available apartment to potential renters. In recent years, though, beneath just about every YouTube video featuring her there are dozens, if not hundreds, of comments criticizing her, often in very personal terms. Lorenz has also described being barraged with hateful messages, including rape and death threats, via every channel through which she can be reached‚Äîher cell phone, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter DM. She says she has been doxxed and experienced a swatting attempt, has had law enforcement sent to the homes of family members, and has been a target of stalking. 
In 2022, Lorenz spoke to MSNBC for a segment about online harassment in which she talked about having PTSD. Screenshots from a moment when Lorenz briefly broke down in tears were later used to mock and shame her. Lorenz remains very critical of the segment. ‚ÄúIf you have [an under-three-minute] segment, there‚Äôs no way you can provide the proper context so that image won‚Äôt immediately be screenshot and used for harassment,‚Äù she says in our interview. ‚ÄúI cannot wait for cable news to rot in hell.‚Äù She has said in the past that certain types of media coverage have caused more harm to her than anything else.
Just two weeks after the MSNBC story ran, Lorenz published a piece revealing the name of the person behind Libs of TikTok. The backlash was enormous. (The right-wing site The Daily Wire put up a massive billboard in Times Square that read, ‚ÄúTaylor Lorenz Doxxed @LibsofTikTok.‚Äù) ‚ÄúI‚Äôve dealt with reporters who have been in war zones and have also taken online harassment, and to be perfectly honest, when they‚Äôre in distress and talking to me, I hear the same tone in their voice,‚Äù says Mark Seibel, Lorenz‚Äôs editor at the Post.
As a result, she no longer shares certain details of her life, because they make her easier to find‚Äîher age, for example. (Plus, ‚Äúit‚Äôs irrelevant,‚Äù she says.) She doesn‚Äôt share her dating status. In terms of her family, all she‚Äôll say is that she grew up in Old Greenwich, Connecticut. ‚ÄúEvery little piece of information you give, it‚Äôs going to sprout five more pieces of misinformation,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúYou want to be like, ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre wrong.‚Äô But it‚Äôs fruitless. The truth doesn‚Äôt matter.‚Äù She doesn‚Äôt believe all criticism of her is unfair‚Äî‚ÄúI‚Äôve made so many mistakes on the internet over the years,‚Äù she says. What she takes issue with are discussions of her personal life unrelated to her work.
She will speak about aspects of her background that haven‚Äôt become conspiracy fodder. As a young person, Lorenz felt alienated; as soon as she was old enough, she began escaping to the city. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very dyslexic, and school was always a really hard time,‚Äù she says. She didn‚Äôt seek community online, though. Instead, she worked. 
By age 14, she had already been employed as a mother‚Äôs helper and a gift wrapper, and had volunteered as a candy striper at Greenwich Hospital, delivering mail and busing dishes in the cafe. During college, she sold replacement windows door-to-door; after graduation, she worked as an administrative assistant and, at one point, at a call center for Vineyard Vines. Then she started temping and found Tumblr. Soon she‚Äôd started dozens of blogs on the platform. One of the more popular focused on sprinkles; another was about bagels. The thrill was seeing how big she could get them to be, and soon some had thousands of followers, giving her an early taste of virality. While it wasn‚Äôt clear yet how she‚Äôd make this her life, she knew she wanted to. 
In 2012, she was hired by an ad agency to handle social media for brands; she ran Verizon‚Äôs Facebook page and helped with Bud Light‚Äôs. A year later, she noticed the Daily Mail‚Äî‚Äúliterally my favorite website‚Äù‚Äîdidn‚Äôt have a Facebook page. She was soon handling their social media globally. Around then, she started freelance writing stories about the newly emerging world of online virality and fame. ‚ÄúShe began to realize it wasn‚Äôt just language shifting and culture shifting, it was power,‚Äù Fleishman says. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what Taylor spearheaded in journalism‚Äîlooking at internet culture as a nexus of power.‚Äù 
Even before she was well known as a reporter, Lorenz showed up in the news. While living in Baltimore in 2015, she witnessed a fatal stabbing: ‚ÄúBlood just started erupting out of his chest,‚Äù Lorenz told the Baltimore Sun. In early 2016, she was riding an Amtrak train hit by an unknown object. ‚ÄúThere was this great boom,‚Äù she told CBS afterward. 
‚ÄúMy mom says I‚Äôm like Forrest Gump,‚Äù she says now. ‚ÄúIf there‚Äôs something going on, I‚Äôm running toward it.‚Äù As the then director for emerging platforms for the political website The Hill, Lorenz was live streaming the 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville when James Alex Fields Jr. drove his Dodge Challenger into the crowd, killing Heather Heyer. (Her footage ended up in Spike Lee‚Äôs film BlacKkKlansman.) Not long after, she decided to try to be a full-time reporter‚Äîher beat and the country‚Äôs narrative seemed to be folding in on each other. ‚ÄúThe far right has always embraced this media ecosystem, so when Trump was elected, all these YouTubers and people that I knew from the influencer world were suddenly relevant,‚Äù she says. 
Lorenz took a huge pay cut to take a job at The Daily Beast as a tech and culture reporter. She was there for only seven months before moving to The Atlantic, then was poached by the Times a year and a half later. By the time she moved to the Washington Post in 2022, she was such a big name that her job change was the subject of extensive media speculation, especially because it had previously been reported that Times editors had discussed how to deal with the turmoil created by her social media presence (she also occasionally sparred with colleagues on Twitter, including on her way out the door).
Leaving for the Post had nothing to do with internal issues, Lorenz maintains. ‚ÄúI wanted a raise, and I wanted more autonomy,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI think the Times needs to get it together in terms of dealing with these online harassment campaigns, but I also think they‚Äôre trying.‚Äù She recognizes, like anyone familiar with online dynamics, that criticism isn‚Äôt always bad for her career. ‚ÄúThe irony of what Tucker did is he put me on this new level, which is beneficial in the sense that it raises your profile,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúNotoriety is helpful.‚Äù Similarly, she knows her willingness to be so active on social media, and sometimes polarizing, helped her build a brand large enough to be untethered from her employer‚Äîshe doesn‚Äôt list the legacy media outlet where she works in her bio on Instagram, TikTok, or Twitter. ‚ÄúThe brand discourse always triggers people, because we are all pressured to commodify ourselves and that is horrible,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like that part of it. But at the same time, it is also what gave me a career.‚Äù 
At this point, though, she‚Äôd rather be known for her journalism. ‚ÄúEvery time I‚Äôm in the media for something, it‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs have this big public discussion about whether Taylor is good or bad,‚Äô‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúThis verdict is issued on you, and I hate that. Because most of the time it‚Äôs, ‚ÄòFuck this girl.‚Äô‚Äù Which has contributed to her anxiety ahead of the book‚Äôs release: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been spiraling,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI feel like it‚Äôs going to be this verdict on me. And I just want people to care about my work.‚Äù 
Lorenz‚Äôs ability to note the shifting tides of the online world (and translate their importance) has led her to sometimes be treated like a kind of internet clairvoyant. Extremely Online, however, looks backward as opposed to forward, offering a history of social media that covers the rise of the influencer economy. It also features the experiences of several women whose success has been both enabled and complicated by the contradictory, sometimes breathtakingly cruel incentives of social media and the attendant media coverage.  (As is the case with all her journalism, Lorenz doesn‚Äôt write in the first person. But it can almost feel like an oversight that her own story is not included.) 
‚ÄúIt helped me process a lot,‚Äù Lorenz says. ‚ÄúI was just writing as therapy. A lot of us have gone through this evolution with the internet of having this unbridled positivity about what it can offer, and then being met with the horrible downsides and having to come to terms with that.‚Äù But while Extremely Online documents some of the darker sides of the internet, it is not pessimistic. By showing how users, particularly ‚Äúcreators,‚Äù have consistently shaped platforms, it ends up as an argument for the users‚Äô agency to shape the internet for the better.
Lorenz has no desire to leave journalism. She prefaces any talk of a career change (maybe she‚Äôd be an interior designer or a political consultant) by noting that would only happen if she needed to retire. ‚ÄúI love media, and the minute that I found Tumblr, I loved the internet,‚Äù she says.
She still does, in fact. ‚ÄúYes, because anything is possible [online],‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWhich is bad, obviously‚Äîwe know the bad sides. But I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre 100 percent in the bad yet. It‚Äôs bad. It‚Äôs really bad. No, no, no, it‚Äôs really bad, but it could be a lot better, I think. I think it could be better if people just understood what‚Äôs happening.‚Äù
On July 5, the same day Instagram‚Äôs Twitter competitor Threads became available, Lorenz made herself an account. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs up babies,‚Äù she posted.

All of my prima ballerinas out there know too well that those pink satin dancing shoes fall far from the realm of comfort. So while the concept of ballet flats with arch support may seem contradictory, rest assured that you can still wear one of this season‚Äôs hottest fall shoe trends without totally compromising comfort.
And who better to pirouette-turn to than Dr. Ann Anderson, podiatrist and podiatric surgeon with a background in ballet? ‚ÄúA ballet flat will not usually give as much arch support as a sneaker,‚Äù she admits. ‚ÄúBut [they] can be supportive if the construction of the shoe incorporates an arch support...‚Äù Despite the name, a ‚Äúflat‚Äù shoe can still offer adequate support if it‚Äôs intentionally designed.

Customer review: ‚ÄúThese shoes are beautiful! True to size fit and well made. I had read some reviews that said these shoes run small...this is not my experience. I may get another pair!‚Äù
FitFlop burst onto the footwear scene in 2007 when they introduced biomechanically engineered sandals designed to complement ‚Äúbody structure, joint alignment and natural movement,‚Äù while still being non-ugly, of course. A hefty feat indeed, but they‚Äôve overwhelmingly succeeded and expanded their footwear styles to include sneakers, boots, and flats‚Äîlike this one with almost 300 5-star Amazon reviews.

Typically, actual ballet dancers have notoriously high arches in their feet. But arch support-specific shoes are usually best for lower arch, or flatter, feet. 
‚ÄúHigher arch feet usually need more cushioning in the shoes for shock absorption than arch support, so I usually do not recommend an arch support shoe for these patients,‚Äù Anderson says. Whether your arches are high or low, you should always consult your doctor before ditching all your shoes for orthotics. If your feet are too flat, arch support can cause pesky callouses from excessive pressure along the arch. In this case, it‚Äôs best to seek out a custom orthotic that fits your shoes. 
‚ÄúBallet can be very hard on your feet,‚Äù Anderson notes, due to years of stretching and strengthening the midsole to stand on pointe. But ballet flats in general are ‚Äúnot considered a supportive shoe because they lack significant shoe structure, they have a narrow toe-box, and have no support for the foot,‚Äù she states. And a super thin flat with no support can make you feel like your feet are literally pounding the pavement all day long.
To counteract this, Anderson advises looking for flats that specifically tout arch support or a heel cup, and a wider toe-box to allow for more wiggle room in the shoes. However, if you do have severe podiatric woes, you may want to wear the style carefully. ‚ÄúI will caution that ballet flats are usually not as deep as other shoes, and this can lead to nail injury due to excessive pressure on the nails,‚Äù Anderson warns.

title: Selena Gomez on Why Her Final Justin Bieber Breakup Led Her to Dump Instagram Too
text:
Selena Gomez was the most followed woman on Instagram when she deleted the app and gave control of her account to an assistant in 2018. In a new interview with Fast Company, Gomez explained that her final breakup with Justin Bieber in spring 2018, after their 8-year on-off romance, led her to dump Instagram too. 
Bieber, of course, started dating his now-wife Hailey Bieber just months after, in June 2018. They got engaged a month later, and then married in September 2018. 
Gomez recalled her headspace at the time: ‚ÄúI had just gotten my heart broken. I didn‚Äôt need to see what everyone was doing,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThen there were those moments of not feeling positive about how I looked because of what I‚Äôd see on Instagram. Wow, I wish my body looked like that.‚Äù 
She explained having her own body change also impacted how she viewed herself. Before, she‚Äôd ‚Äúhad a teenager‚Äôs body,‚Äù she said. And now, ‚Äúnone of the sample sizes were fitting, and that would make me feel embarrassed. Although how unrealistic is it to expect a normal woman‚Äôs body not to change?‚Äù
At the same time, Gomez was navigating her own mental health. In 2018, she was diagnosed with bipolar disorder. Two years later, she shared her diagnosis publicly on Miley Cyrus‚Äô Bright Minded Instagram Live show.
Initially, Gomez worried about the consequences of sharing her mental health struggles and condition. ‚ÄúI grew up being a people pleaser,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI had a responsibility at a very young age‚Äîyoung people were looking up to me. I didn‚Äôt know who I was. Having that responsibility would make me walk on eggshells a lot. I thought maybe it would be damaging to tell people who I am. It started to become a threat that freaked me out. Well, if you‚Äôre not right, then you can‚Äôt work.‚Äù
She reflected on the time just before she was diagnosed: ‚ÄúI went through a really hard season [then]. It was my highs and my lows, and I didn‚Äôt know what to do, so I couldn‚Äôt control it. I would want to cancel things. It was just a tormented feeling. That‚Äôs why, when I found out my diagnosis, it was just, ‚ÄòOh, okay, I feel a bit relieved, I understand a bit more.‚Äô I got second opinions. I went to doctors. I‚Äôm fortunate enough to be able to have people who can help me survive every day.‚Äù  
As a celebrity now, Gomez puts herself in a different category than stars like Beyonc√© and Adele. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not unattainable,‚Äù she said of herself generally. ‚ÄúI look at someone like a Beyonc√©, and I am amazed. My jaw drops. Every part of her is just impeccable, and it‚Äôs just so beautiful. I went to her show and was blown away. But I‚Äôm just not that, and that‚Äôs okay. I‚Äôm me, and I‚Äôm a little silly, but I also like being sexy and fun, and I also want to do good with the time I have here. We need goddesses like Beyonc√© and Adele. But I‚Äôm just happy to be your best friend.‚Äù
